title: This is a ripoff. And shame on Amazon for not allowing a refund
review: Don't buy this product. I purchased it for my Amazon Kindle Fire which i recently acquired. I saw the reviews and was impressed but I failed to see the dates of the review. I downloaded the product and it does not work on my Kindle Fire (nowhere did it say it was incompatible). I have reached out to the vendor but guess what? It does not exist anymore.To add insult to injury, I have tried to seek a refund from Amazon but its automated system will not allow it. So it seems I have been taken for a ride by the unscrupulous and now non-existent vendor and by Amazon who is still selling a product without any support whatsoever or response from the vendor. Shame on Amazon!!!!

title: Do you update to 4.6.4, it's broken!

title: Terrible terrible
review: I tried my best to give a benefit of a doubt. But at the end I gave up. I was studying a pdf file, high lighting, underlining, commenting, making notes etc. to my surprise it started to crash on the 9, out of the 10 pages document. Before this happened the text I wrote on it kept on freezing I had to wait for the tablet to respond after 40 second or so. The worst part is that if you want to open this document using Adobe reader the only thing that is saved are the high lights and the comments. I cleaned the tablet (galaxy tab 3 8 note) from the junk, the memory and killed background tasks, I uninstalled/installed but that didn't help either Arrrghh! to think that I spent 2 hours in this so important document only to re-studying again.

I find it easier to write notes on my tablet without having to carry many sheets of paper around.

I made the mistake of paying for this app and it doesn't even work for what I need it for.Â  So don't waste your money.Â  Just go download Adobe Reader from the Amazon Appstore and it does what you need it to do (plus its FREE).

title: App Does Not Perform as Stated
review: I downloaded this app for my MacBook Pro on 10/13/13.Â  It has failed to work on my MacBook.Â  I have tweeted my issue.Â  In addition, I have emailed support.Â  I sent an email with the PDF files that I was trying to open.Â  I also included a video showing the app is not working properly.Â  It has been 3 days.Â  This is beyond frustrating that I cannot get the proper support to resolve the issue.Â  I contacted AppleCare, and they stated everything is working properly on my Mac.Â  I cannot believe that I cannot receive assistance with an app that I purchased.Â  This is ridiculous.Â  I purchased and downloaded another app that is very similar to this one and it works perfectly.Â  More importantly, I have left a review of this application giving it another terrible rating.Â  The likelihood of this app succeeding after my App Store review, tweets, and Facebook comments posts is very slim.Â  Clearly, customer reviews are very important to consumers.Â  I am beyond disappointed in how the support department has ignored my issue.Â  Furthermore, I have requested a refund for this app.Â  This is the worst experience that I have had with an application.Â  I have hundreds of applications on my Mac, iPad, and iPhone and all of them function as stated except for the one from your company.Â  Each time this app crashes a crash report is sent to Apple.Â  Does your company receive a copy of this report?Â  I am going to guess that you do receive a copy of this report.Â  Apple is a very innovative company in the number 1 brand in the world.Â  I can't imagine why you haven't reviewed the crash report.Â  However,Â  I was advised by AppleCare that I can callback with my case number and they will begin a process to investigate my complaint in detail.Â  I will be contacting them today!Thank you,Toya Hayden

title: Takes over your computer without permission
review: I bought this so I could edit MS Office docs on my Fire Tablet. Then I decided to add a copy on my desktop. I was so impressed with the interface, I went ahead an bought the license for both (though the programs still treat me as a "trial" user, and I have not received any activation codes.But the worst discovery is that OfficeSuite makes itself the default program for all MS Office products automatically during installation. When I download an MSOffice doc from the web, it automatically opens in OfficeSuite. In order to open it in Word, I have to "save document." I cannot click on the document immediately, or OfficeSuite will load it. I must then go to File Explorer, open the Download folder, right click on the document, and manually CHOOSE Word. I have been unable to find any workaround.I am more than frustrated. I am angry, and I've paid money for the "Premium" version that has strong-armed itself to the front. Perhaps OfficeSuite is the ONLY option for FIRE users to edit MSOffice docs. But now I have ruined my desktop computer. Buyer beware. (It looks like a good program, but I fear using it, not knowing what else it will take over without my permission).

At least when you download say the free Acrobat ReaderÂ  to read PDF files, even though you may not be able to edit it unless you buy the full version it still allows you to print out your document. The ads at the bottom of the screen are large and kind of annoying, but I prefer them to the full screen ads that pop up when I switch documents. Considering the free version already has a limited functionality compared to the pro, I don't think it's too much to ask that the ads are a little more unobtrusive. I'd much rather have the Google Drive app available for kindle, but for now, this will have to do

title: Nothing but a Con Job
review: There is NO decent word processor for a tablet. This app will NOT allow you to delete files unless you download ANOTHER app to "manage" the files! No font choices for the app unless you upgrade. After all these years of word processing software, you'd think there would be ONE barebones app that would let you do basic file management.

title: BOY DO I WISH I HAD READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING THIS SOFTWARE
review: CAPITALIZATION in this review is NOT screaming ... just highlighting ...My initial "review to myself" was positive, when I tested a plain, short "Word" style document. It seemed to work just fine, and NOBODY releases software that doesn't work do they? snort!!! So I bought the program, and BOY! am I SORRY! that I did so, because I can now no longer get a refund as I have struggled SO long and SO hard, trying to make this piece of software do the simplest tasks.There is SO much of this app that either just plain does not work, or has VERY limited functionality, or does not work quite right, that I CANNOT in good conscience recommend this app to ANYONE for ANY reason.I have written to Support twice, and beyond the "We have received your request..." email notice, I have received NO response whatsoever to my request for assistance or clarification.The so called HELP system is more a list of what the menu options are than they are instructions on how to use this app. As a help system, it is WOEFULLY, and PITIFULLY inadequate. So mix the fact that parts of it, despite being available to the user, just do not work, the lack of reliable support and the lack of a comprehensive help system, and you get a miserable, FAILED attempt at a piece of software that should not have gone to market for a SIGNIFICANT additional period of time for development.And when I bought this, my ONLY option was a subscription so that I have to pay for it again, and AGAIN, EVERY year. What the heck happened to just being able to BUY a piece of software?These people need a couple of million bucks of investment money so that they can do some more development on this software so that it WORKS, and works COMPLETELY before they start selling it. As it stands, it needs a LOT more development. While SOME small parts of it DO work, it is NOT a replacement for microsoft office. There is just too much of it that does not work to warrant buying this app.I just CANNOT imagine a greater waste of money. This is probably THE worst purhase that I have EVER made online.

title: Almost Perfect for my needs
review: I downloaded the Free version, and of course the Developer IMMEDIATELY kept deluging me with the "Buy the $10 Pro-Full version"; (WHY do they DO that right from the start, when you haven't even had time to try it out yet? Stupid Annoying marketing). I used it a few times a day to see if it was what I wanted, because I do not like the AMAZON WPS product included in my FIRE HDX 7 Tablet at all. After about a week or so, Developer offered the Full-Pro version, for half price, so I purchased it.The only thing that I haven't been able to find is How To Send and Store all my filesÂ  to Amazon Prime Cloud, which I desire, because the HDX that I have only allows internal total user storage up to about 11.5GB. Maybe the feature is in the APP somewhere and I just haven't found it yet... Thus, 5 Star instead of a 4 star rating given.(Come On Amazon, When areÂ  you going to update your rating system to allow Half Stars? Very,Very few man-made creations are 'Perfect' and deserving of a 5 Star!)

What was wrong with keeping that, PLUS the app. if that's what someone wanted? Everything gets more and more complicated and more difficult to use. Who sits around all day and thinks of ways to make things more complicated? As an added insult to the public, there are never any instructions available anymore. Not everyone is a techie. title: Hammersmith print app for kindle fire and kindle fire2 + galaxy phone
review: This is one one the best apps ever offered. I installed it on my wife's kindle fire, my kindle fire 2, my galaxy phone and an HTC Flyer tablet. The installation process was as simple and easy as it could get. No monkeying around and jumping through hoops to get it to work with any of the devices, either! This app should come standard with every new device. It is easy to use, and the layout and menus are so intuitive to use, that anyone should have no trouble setting it up and using it. To say I like it is a gross understatement.Joe Youngblood

title: Can't use it on my Kindle Fire HD
review: I was very disappointed to find that new version of the Kindle Fire HD does not have the same functions available as the older version.Â  I checked the Amazon site for the Kindle to see if Skype was available on the Kindle Fire HD and was very happy to see the statement that it was pre-installed.Â  Once I had the Kindle and downloaded the Skype program I called customer service to find out why I couldn't find the program on the Kindle.Â  It was then that I was given a very confusing explanation that the newer Fire HD did not have a camera, while the older version did, and if I wanted to use Skype, I could trade in the Kindle I just received for Christmas and pay an additional $100 for the Kindle HDX.Â  ALSO, I bought a Kindle Fire HD for my granddaughter for Christmas only to find out it isn't the same as the Kindle Fire HD as mine, even though they were both purchased from Amazon and within 2 weeks of each other, the Kindle Fire HD protective case does not fit her Kindle HD.Â  Why when you purchase 2 Kindle Fire HDs are they not the same? Are they getting rid of old stock or is this a bate and switch?

title: Good, but weak on handling of incoming calls.
review: I'm using this app on a Kindle Fire HD 7.Skype, in general, is excellent. This version of Skype app for Fire is only OK.It works well for making outgoing video/voice calls, and texts.If the Fire is locked, incoming calls/texts aren't notified and don't appear until you unlock and open the Skype app, at which time they appear as missed calls.IF the app is OPEN and TOPMOST on the screen (or the top app in the open-app-stack), it works fine for incoming calls. Incoming text messages appear almost instantly, but without any sound notification, so you need to watch the screen if you're expecting a message.If the app is either not running at all or not on the top of the open-app-stack, incoming calls aren't notified at all.Also, even if the app is open and topmost on the screen, calls to a Skype phone number from a mobile or landline phone (as opposed to from a Skype contact) don't appear on the Fire (but you do eventually get a "missed call" indicator).All-in-all it appears to be well behind the Skype app on other devices; I don't know if that is because development is lagging or because the Fire simply doesn't have the capability to respond to incoming notifications.

title: Be Careful - Costs involved

title: No way to hang up or disconnect a visual chat on my Fire 8HD.
review: I was excited to be able to chat with a friend in Australia from my tablet.Â  We've never spoken or seen each other before today.Â  HOWEVER, when it was time to end our chat she had to end it because the screen on my Fire 8 HD didn't have a disconnect button!Â  It was there when the call started, but disappeared and there was no way to get it back!Â  My friend had to end the call.Â  Very disappointing.

title: A cut above
review: I have read much of this genre and I think it's a cut above. I binge read all three volumes.Â  A cut above, I think as the situation is far more dire than in most apocalyptic stories.Â  There is only one very minor and not too significant criticism: I wish the author knew a little more about radio. Like other writersÂ  this one talks about a "short wave" radio with a microphone. Short wave is a rather obsolete term and they do not have microphones. and do not transmit. That would be an HF transceiver.Â  Don't worry about it. The book will grab you and drag you into a cold and scary world.

title: Clever skype, skewing your own feedback ;)
review: Skype cuts out alot, the auditory is not good, the visual is not good. I've noticed that, conveniently, skype prompts me for feedback after a call - for a long call, more than for a short call.Â  Naturally, if I have a long call, then the connection was probably sound. Otherwise, if it cuts out or the visual is so terrible, I disconnect and re-dial the person, resulting in a series of shorter calls - for which skype does not as frequently prompt me for feedback. Oooh, how convenient for you skype! Ask me for feedback coincidentally for long calls - which due to their length of time, probably went well - and refrain from prompting feedback when there is a series of short calls, demonstrating a poorly working call.Obviously, I give feedback on my own through both skype itself - and on here, like now - but still, skype, I think you are skewing your own data on purpose.

title: Very Disappointed Paying Skype Customer + Update
review: Paying Skype customer for years.Â  It was great but just gets worse.Â  Skype for my most recent Fire tablet never rings when someone calls.Â  Tried everything and then tried everything again.Â  Been through the support threads.Â  It worked fine on my older Fire.Â  It seems to be an issue with many Android and Fire tablets.Â  Also this is the worst version of Skype and hard to use. Tried a couple of free phone programs apps similar to Skype and they work just fine.Â  Very disappointed.Update.Â  Skype has had a fairly substantial update since my last review.Â  Now it rings and sometime I can answer the call successfully.Â  Often it just closes and disconnects.Â  Hard to get to messages and sometimes impossible.Â  Now when I make a call there is no ring sound. only silence until someone answers so hard to tell if it had dialed out and connected.Â  I miss the good ol' days when skype worked well.Update: Guess what... it's worse.

Not at all what I expected given my previous experience with Skype.

title: Happy with voice calls, but app needs updating
review: UPDATE 8/11/2016After writing my review below I have been experiencing problems with Skype on PC after five minutes after connecting.Â  I hear the voice of the other person, but the other person does not hear mine. Also the line has started to drop. I keep my app updated in my PC and was quite satisfied with it until say the last month, when having a chat online has becoming too much of a hassle on my PC, but if I use my Skype for Android I have no problem.Please fix the app for PC, otherwise is worthless at present.PREVIOUS REVIEWI have used Skype since it first saw the light, many years ago. IÂ  have it installed in my computers and gadgets. I use it all the time. In my PC at least once a month for intercontinental chat about 1-2 hours long.Regarding Skype for PC, I am mostly happy with it. The quality of the sound is usually very good, with no return sound or delays nowadays, which used to happen often in the past. The line drops at times but rarely. In the last year, using this app *at least* once a month, I have had a bad experience just once.My main problem with the app is for voice+audio chats, as it is a pain in the butt: frozen images, or very slow movement or very bad quality image. I don't know if it is related to my Internet carrier or not, but it is most annoying. The result is that I don't make video-calls any more.Skype's interface for PC is a bit outdated, not clear enough and not customer friendly enough. The home screen should clearly show the options, voice call, video call, written chat alone, send photo and/or doco, plus the contact list on the side bar.My account is totally private, only close friends and family are there, I cannot be found by name or email. Yet, sometimes I get requests of people I don't know, spammers I guess, so I would like that scam to be out of my house and the portholes taking them there locked.I like that Skype asks me about the quality of the sound and call/video-call when I finish. At least they care!Â  I think that serves to improve the service and is specially important when I have a bad experience.

title: Stopped working on kindle fire

Very disappointed because Skype is really the only option for kindle fire and my only way to conduct some business while overseas, not to mention stay in touch with family. Prior to the bug, which started around 25 Oct 2017, I was very happy with the app. Please fix and update version for kindle fire!

title: Mobile app became unusable after recent update
review: Last week my mobile Skype decided to update on its own without even asking my permission to do so as any other app would do. Update brought back bunch of garbage from 2 years of prior communications, including all of the blocked and deleted people and bots! To make the matter worse - the is no option to delete the from the screen either.And now the most important issue that mames this Skype update totally worthless - you CAN NOT see which of your contacts is online. The green light feature is gone, it doesn't appear even on Skype echo which is always online. They need to fix that bug,obviously. It is a bug, because yesterday i did see that green light at some point, and after i closed the app and opened it again - it was blind as usual.Please fix it!
