title: ENDLESSÂ  CRASHES
review: I have been trying to use this app on my Kindle Fire for several months now and I can accurately sum up my experience with it like this....I video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes.Â  I restart this app, video chat for a minute, Skype starts making dinging sounds, and then it crashes........Apparently Skype for Kindle suffers from severe stability issues and is completely unusable.Â  Even for a free app I feel like I got ripped off because SKYPE IS THE MAIN REASON I AND A MILLION OTHER USERS BOUGHT A KINDLE!Â  FIX THIS PATHETIC MESS!

title: Does not work on Amazon Fire HD tablets
review: Skype does not work on Amazon Kindle Fire HD Tablets.I installed this on 2 of the current new Amazon Fire HD 8 Tablets.Â  It looks similar to that of the older style Skype apps on iOS and Macs...(not like the newer funky snapchatty emoticon bloated update that Skype pushed out in June 2017).However this Amazon version does NOT work with the newest Fire HD tablets.Â  It can not receive incoming Skype video or audio calls.Â  - it never rings and anyone calling someone who is on a Fire HD will simply not get connected - it says "Connecting..." and sticks with the bleeping, At the receiving end, on the tablet, it never gets to the melody or chime of a ringing call.Â  Outgoing calls work (unless you are calling a Fire tablet!) and skype text messages work.Until microsoft work with Amazon and get a working version it is pointless installing

title: Update Almost Ruined the Skype OMG
review: Ugh. The updated Skype is almost horrible. I face too many glitches. One,the volume is too high. Even if Shogunyan mutes my Kindle, I can still hear Richard loudly. Two, Skype continuously crashes for no apparent reason. One minure (I meant to say minute) Skype works and then the next it pops up with a message that says, " Skype is not responding,would you like to close it?" If you say yes it closes the app and you have to reboot. If not, the message keeps popping up. Try to get to the old Skype app? NO, DOESN'T WORK, IT'S NOT IN THE APPSTORE ANYMORE. THEY SHOULD FIX ALL GLITCHES BEFORE PUTTING IT IN THE APPSTORE AGAIN. Oh my god. It's no fair!!!!!!!!!!! Gosh Skype people, you gotta fix the glitches!!!!!ð¤

title: It's fine
review: The app is great it allows me to text my friends but not call them. The call system used to work but now it's just broken.

title: Cannot use it on Kindle Fire
review: It seems that I cannot use it on my Kindle Fire. I keep getting a message that it is not supported. Bummer!

title: Bad port of a good service.
review: The worst aspect of this app is that it continually fails to push messages from people. Often I will message someone only to suddenly have several messages sent to me hours before suddenly load. To the other people, it just appears I am ignoring them. Signing on to the desktop app at the same time will make the messages show up and be received immediately, but then what is the point of using the app if I have to use the desktop?The interface was already bad and they continue to make it worse with each update. Now contacts are separated into a long alphabetical directory rather than simply allowing you to see who is online at a glance. The desktop interface is fine, and I'm not sure why they feel the need to try and deviate from it.You cannot choose any status but online or invisible. Worse, you can't see if anyone else has their status set as away or busy. You simply see them as online, when in reality they may not want to be disturbed.The desktop program is fine. The mobile app however is handicapped in several ways. If you need a way to use Skype from your phone or tablet, this is unfortunately your best option. If you are just looking for a video/instant messaging app that doesn't need to be Skype, then choose something else.

title: Don't get it.
review: Skype keeps signing me out. When I try to sign back in it says unable to sign in. I have had to change my password more than 5 times. I use this app to stay in touch with friends. This app is irritating and needs an update. The call quality goes from clear to EXTREMELY blurry in a matter of seconds. Sometimes out of nowhere it just hangs up my calls! The calls are laggy and it's really aggravating. I don't recommend using this app.ð

title: can not
review: I can not Skype at all. Right in the middle of something important to this dying women,Â  something that will never happen again and Skype started acting up, erased all contacts, won't let me sign in, even after I asked for Skype to send info on username and password to me, still wouldn't work.Â  Then it tells me I have to pay to proceed, PAY? Since when? And still wouldn't even let me pay and continue video chat birthday party I was participating in. It kept bumping me of telling me I had to pay before looking at my settings without being logged in.. what's going on? Wouldn't even let me look at anything that was on the page, it would change then go back to PAY PAY PAY. I felt I was being extorted.Â  I missed the party and now I fear they're mad at me cause they haven't returned my landline calls. I couldn't even get to help or customer service, kept diverting me to h home page of Skype or pay page. Terribly disappointed in Skype.

title: Horribel
review: At first this app was amazing! But then bad stuff starting happening, first, my messages weren't sending for a while. Then when they started sending, the app said I can update it. I was so excited to see what new stuff they did with Skype! Until after I updated it, when I tried logging in again, it said they didn't recognise my email\phone number\name! I tried more than once and it never worked. When I first got this app I thought it was amazingly designed, but now I feel like its the worst messaging app ever. I'm deleting this app right away.

title: I love it, but.... (Kindle Fire HD)
review: On the app, calls can only be viewed on one landscape for viewing. This is one of those incredible inconveniences of many Kindle Fire HD apps.... the charging port is on the "right side" aka bottom, when in landscape mode. this makes it impossible to prop up to view talks and charge your device at the same time. What's worse, if it's plugged in and you lay out flat, the device goes to sleep.It's a small gripe for all its benefits, great streaming, incredible video quality, but on those extra long talks with a friend 9 hours ahead in a different country, it's a bummer to have to end the call based on a small inconvenience. BUT,Â  on the plus side, to be able to video chat for 4 plus hours on a full charge is amazing.Please consider making one mode universal to the device orientation, whether it is propped up "upright" or "upside down"

title: Skype for Kindle, a total failure! Thanks to Amazon Fire OS...
review: I've been using Skype for years and It's been a good experience, but not with my new Kindle Fire.I'm not sure what thebig Idea is with amazon and propietrary versions of lots of apps. They all have problems, crashing all the time and making you sorry you bought a kindle and not a Nexus or something different form another manufacturer that can download from the official Google Play Store.Skype is one of those failures, when a nice app you love just drives you crazy for the sake of Amazon's own version of Android. I'm not sure they're aware the ammount of trouble they're causing with that. They think this is the way to capture more customers, but they're totally wrong. And since I hate being forced to buy something that doesn't work, I use alternative stores, even if I can't use the Google Play Store.I updated Skype using a version I found in another store and it works perfectly. Stay away from the "official" kindle version, it's crap, and you'll be sorry in the end.

title: Was a Good Program Before Microsoft..
review: I believe that I've used Skype for at least the last 10-12 years, and I have to admit I thought it was a much better program before being purchased by Microsoft. The program used to work flawlessly, no dropped calls, no problems hearing one side or the other, etc. I can't rate Skype for computer to computer calling. For calling computer to landline from overseas, my calls are are almost routinely dropped or there's a clicking noise on the line; and usually one side or the other can't make out parts of the conversation. Unfortunately I haven't found another vendor who provides a comparable service that's any more reliable.

title: Stopped working on the Kindle Fire and that sucks!!!
review: This was my way of keeping in touch with my family but now that it is no longer working on my Kindle Fire, I have no way of communicating with them especially when I work long hours and want to keep in touch with them. This sucks! It use to be great but not any more!

title: The New Update STINKS
review: I down loaded Skype in the past to enjoy a new and better way to communicate with friends and family. Now that I upgraded to the newest version, and to put it very polite way all I can say is, it really stinks. I am not going re tell you what others have said, it would be a total waste of my time. Just read what they said before you think of down loading it. My question is this, do they test up dates before putting them out before we use them? I think not! If the people who work on the app of Skype read our complaints on what we feel, please fix your program on making this app. I am wanting to give no stars on not only how I feel, but what you have done as well, but I am forced to give you one star, which you don't deserve to have. Thanks Skype for putting us through this misery on using your app.

title: Distorted video - useless
review: 4/9/2020 - helped my mom download Skype to her Kindle fire and her own camera stream appears clear on her side but we get all these lines and repeated images that totally distort what we see if her video stream on our end. This is a known bug since 2019 and still no fix. Ultimately have to wait for a new version of the software and hope it fixes the issue.

title: Good, but Vid Calls don't work for me
review: I got this to talk with friends when I was away from a computer, and the IM works fine, but I cannot join group calls. A call with a single person works fine, but group calls just refuse to work. I am using a Kindle Fire HD. Please fix this.

title: Doesn't work for me
review: This will be my third Skype account.Â  So far none of them work properly.Â  My first attempt with Skype was about five years ago and it worked perfectly.Â  Since then, it is constantly degraded to the point where I get garbled sound and no video.Â  I thought by having it on my Kindle.Â  My problem would be resolved.Â  No such luck.Â  I think Skype just does not like me.Â  I know it is not my Internet connection because the next step up would be to full commercial satellite receiving.Â  It does work okay for instant message, though, but that's not why I bought it.Â  Yes, I even purchased an upgrade version for my computer and it still does not work.Â  Skype and me just don't agree.Â  I sure hope someone from Skype reads this review and offers me some help because their customer service is probably the worst in the industry

title: Lower than 1 Star
review: This is the most frustrating app I have ever used.Â  I can video chat on average, 3-4 minutes before the call will drop.Â  Unfortunately, that is only about a 3 of 10 on the frustration level that this app is about to take me on.Â  After the call drops, I recall the person I was talking to only to get a black screen.Â  I can't end the call, I can't back out of it, I can only wait until the app decides it is not working correctly and gives me an error message with the option to wait or end the app.Â  Ending the app will take you back to the main page where you can either try and call the person back and repeat the black screen of Skype purgatory or exit the app completely.Â  So after surviving Skype purgatory and fully exciting the app, you think, okay let's try this again.Â  Maybe exiting the app has reset it and I can get another 3-4 minutes of video time.Â  You enter the app, everything looks good, you dial and find yourself immersed back into blackness and understand that you are not in Skype purgatory but in the depths of Skype hell where no calls are ever made and you are doomed to relive the same horrors again and again.Â  The only escape is to restart your system and stay far away from icy grips of Skype Lucifer.Â  Heed the warning and flee from this app as it only brings darkness and gnashing of teeth.

title: Worst POS app I have ever installed.
review: I bought a kindle for my mother-in-law so that she could skype with us. A fire HD. I have spent over 10 hours trying to get this to work - can't get past signing in. All I ever see is "you are already on line'". Went on the net to see if anyone else was having a similar problem. Ha - almost half the users have the same problem. I am an IT guy - over twenty years in the field. I did everything right (and several times). This app is garbage, complete garbage. I would send the kindle back (it's the main reason I bought it) but too much time has passed. If you're considering buying a kindle for this purpose, think again - find an alternative because this simply does not work. Shame on Amazon for even allowing Skype to be presented as an option. Very, very disappointing.

title: Lately this app doesn't work
review: I used this up for years, but last 3 days I can't connect with anyone in my contacts, the app for Apple devices word but on my kindle fire it doesn't connect. I don't know if it is w New update or what but i really hope they fix it soon. Very sad that we can't use it.

title: Avoid Skype - It's A Bad Dream Come True
review: I was a subscriber for many years and each year it was a poorer product. I'm tired of spam calls during the day and especially throughout the night. With the latest update I can't even access evidence of the spam call in order to block it, and when I could in previous versions, Microsoft seemed to do nothing about the issue. Using the product is an exercise in frustration. Even unsubscribing was a two-hour nightmare. Avoid this software if you value your time, productivity and peace of mind.

title: Current version does not work.
review: 5.0.0.54266 on Kindle Fire HD does not work.Â  If you make a voice call, the other person can pick up and you can talk to them - however, the UI itself is still stuck on the "connecting" screen.. If you click/touch the screen and/or attempt to change the volume - android will let you know that skype is not responding and you can either wait or close the application.Â  If you start a video call, the UI is completely frozen and you cannot do anything until you kill it when the android dialog appears... Uninstall/Reinstall does not help.Having a Windows Phone, I agonize when I have to use any Google service, since Google intentionally makes a bad experience for WP users...Â  I hope this is not Microsoft's way of payback by making their software not work properly on Google's OS...Â  sigh...

title: Omg
review: I love this app! But one little problem with the appð­. Whenever you need to sign in it'll say Unable to sign inð­. But I know how to fix it! All you have to do is: when it'll say that all you have to do is turn off your Electronic and restart the Electronic and go on the app and it will workð±ððððð

title: Does not work right
review: This app does not work. I set this up so I could video call my aunt. She can't here me on the other end and it doesn't support stickiers. Good thing we both have iPhones so we can face time. That works a lot better! ð ð ð ð ð

title: FIX ALL GLITCHES....IT'S A NECESSARY APP
review: When I first downloaded this app to my tab, it worked excellent for the first day. It's the second day and O.M.G. it is always crashing, sticking, volume is too much, can't adjust it, it's forever not responding.It's an app that I need at the moment but it's making me regret the decision of downloading it. I really didn't want to because the rating is ridiculously low for such a well needed app.FIX THESE GLITCHES PLEASE.Too many apps starts to malfunction on tabs, especially the Kindle Fire. It makeÂ  No sense you design the app for the Kindle and then the app slows it down or is not too compatible so it crashes.

title: This urgently must be fixed.
review: I have used Skype for years and is currently a staple for me because my relationship for the moment has become long distance. But it has now stopped working saying that I need to update my Skype but there is no update for us kindle fire users. This is very inconvenient and I would have assumed this would be fixed as we are part of your market and it states that this company is open to feed back. There has been a lot of feed back stating that there is an issue and almost a month later there has been no improvement nor updates available. Please fix this because this has become a great inconvenience to many.

title: good/very bad app!!!
review: This app has good and bad qualities! :): the good qualities are, you can hang with your friends without "hanging with your friends", you can also message then too. Sadly, that's about it. :( now to the BAD qualities! >:-( sometimes it's a ####### piece of GARBAGE!!!!!!! It gave my kindle an awful virus!!! It also turns off on you when you are in the middle of a conversation!!! >:-( ### this thing SUCKS at times!!! If you want a REAL good version of Skype, go on the computer!!! This thing is a piece of #### at times. And believe it or not, but I never swer in my life!!! This thing makes people swear!!! >:-0

title: Updaaaaaaate!!!!
review: This app is horrible and rarely updated much like hundreds of other Kindle apps. I use Skype every Friday. My call gets dropped about 7-8 times every 30 minutes if not more. When I attempt to call back, either the video or audio is gone. It's infuriating. If the Kindle can do no more than display books properly, why not buy a cheaper e reader? This is not the only app I have issues with but it's one of the main ones. I check for updates all the time, (despite the fact that my Kindle is set to automatically download any updates, which it does not) and there is never one to be found.

title: not to good
review: This app was okay I guess. I mean its good for video chatting and I love to do it but every time I try to call someone and they don't pickup even after I have quit I can still here that really annoying ringing noise! Its so frustrating! I even completely exit out of the app and I can still here it so I have to shut down my tablet and restart it all over again! So annoying! Also very laggy and sometimes slow. The picture is good I guess but please fix the stupid ringing noise!!!!! So annoying I just want to pick my tablet and throw it! ( I'm not that stupid don't worry) please fix this app so it will actually be good for video chatting. Yes I'm done now

title: Kind of buggy at times on Kindle
review: This program goes in spurts where it works like a champ with absolutely no problems then all of a sudden it's like the bottom fell out and I have nothing but problems and it wont work on my kindle.

title: Kindle Fire 8.9..doesn't work very well
review: One of the reasons I bought the Kindle Fire 8.9 was to use Skype. Well, it doesn't work at all. I can only see myself...not the other person. Skype works fine on my computer...I have tried talking to my granddaughter on my computer with Skype, and it works fine. Then we sign out and sign back in again and I try using Skype on my Kindle Fire to talk with her, and it won't show her at all...I can only see my face on the entire screen. I can hear her. I called Kindle customer support, but they weren't any help at all. I even re-downloaded the Skype application. Nothing helped. Very frustrating!**Update** Okay, it does work now...at least I can see the other person. It wasn't very clear, but maybe that is their (or my) wifi speed.

title: terrible
review: It looks like since mid 2013 on forwards, Skype isn't worth downloading.Â  I bought two Kindle fires just so I could keep in touch with my parents, and the app crashes non stop. Call drops, app closes, calls won't go or come through (I called on cell phone, and could hear their Skype ringing from their end but I never got the call and vice versa). Once it gives you the error message if you don't close it, it'll crash your system. Freezes the screen, and you have to full power down. The only reason I bothered to review and rate one star at all is voice calling is superbly clear with minimal lag.Â  However two minutes into my voice call (because I gave up on video), I got the error that Skype was not responding.Â  My screen then froze completely. Couldn't even hit menu to go to home.Â  But my voice call never dropped, so I guess that's the one thing it has going for it.

title: Needs updated
review: No longer letting me send or receive messages. Hasn't been updated in nearly a year.

title: Your Skype Is Fine. DON'T UPDATE!!
review: I was about to update skype when I noticed the number of 1 stars. So I checked the comments. So many people said the update is horrible, it crashes, automatically logins in and all of that. I have a kindle, as well, so that might be even worse. I think the update I have right now is fine it may glitch sometimes, but what everyone else is saying is crazy. I believe what everyone is saying about the update. If your reading my message, it doesn't matter how old your skype is. Do not update. Whatever you do, DON'T UPDATE IT!!!

title: sucks
review: I dont know what has happened with skype, used it for years. paid for middle year sub. now it wont come up. hired IT guy, he got it to work for ONE DAY. next time we start up comp it wont connect AGAIN. had IT guy work on it 3x. wont come up at all now and cant even access my numbers. skype sucks big time now

title: "Sorry, Skype doesn't work, and we won't say why"
review: Won't connect to the internet no matter what measures I try from the Skype "help center".Â  Worse, is that each time I try another solution, the Skype window comes up with an *animated* frowny-face, telling me it's "sorry", but won't give any real reason why it won't connect, or what can be done. That frowny-face really seals the disgust.

title: Ridiculously awful
review: I recently updated to this skype from the older version and regret it immensely. This "updated" skype is hands down the worst app I've ever had the misfortune of using. If you try to load a webpage on the silk browser, skype will crash. If you adjust the volume, skype will crash. If you plug in your kindle to charge, skype will crash. On top of this, if you attempt to watch a video while in a call, skype will distort the audio of the video and play increasingly loud static noises until the video is over.How a professional company managed to mangle and ruin an app so absolutely is beyond me. All I know is that I won't be using this app until these app breaking crashes and bugs are fixed.

title: Skype is good, but the app for KFHD is AWFUL!
review: I like Skype on my computer, but this app is horrible. It's not compatible with Kindle Fire HD, no matter how you look at it. Not only does the app keep losing video and crash, it makes my device crash which is always terrifying because I never know if it'll ruin my Kindle forever. I uninstalled it from my device, and will not reinstall it until I hear it it once again compatible (if it ever is again). Until then, Oovoo is a much better and more reliable free video calling app.

title: Unreliable
review: I've been using this to make business calls every week for the last 2 years. The audio only works if one person talks at a time and if both people are wearing ear buds. Picture video skips or doesn't work half the time and often disconnects. Has not updated in those 2 years and no sign of it getting fixed. Other than that it's fine.

title: Really buggy, hard to use...
review: Man, where to begin.#1 Trying to text chat while on cam is super hard because you have to keep switching between windows#2 I don't usually get text alerts if I'm surfing, making my friends think I'm ignoring them, it's buggy#3 When people try to add me, it never works, I have to add from my end#4 Kinda slow and laggy sometimes, and occasionally closes by itselfI can use it, but it's a pain sometimes...

title: Sucks
review: Every time I try to video chat on my kindle it doesn't work. It always freezes and it exits me out or you can't hear me. I fixed everything that was wrong with my kindle or thought that was. And that wasn't the problem. Please fix it so I don't have trouble in the future.

title: Annoyed and Disappointed
review: Let's just get this straight: Skype for Kindle Fire HD is probably one of the WORST apps to ever exist. The calls drop, my kindle freezes, I haveÂ  to restart kindle, I can't see their face, or I can't hear them. The only thing it does correctly is the messaging. But I don't want Skype for messaging. There are tons of messaging apps out there. I wanted it for voice calls. The updates just keep making the product worse and worse. I don't know what the developers are doing and I understand it's a tough job, but this is ridiculous.Highly disappointed.

title: Can't receive Skype voice calls
review: Everything works great... except I can't receive calls on my Fire Phone.Â  When I test, I get an error stating that "your device currently cannot receive push notifications".Â  My device can receive push notifications from other apps.... so I am not sure what is wrong.

title: Need to Have the Option of Deleting Old Conversations and Video Messages using Kindle Fire HDX
review: I have had no issues with the Skype functionality. However, I would love to have the option of deleting the old conversations and video messages. I have researched and researched and the only advice I can find is to uninstall and reinstall the program itself to delete the old conversations. This is not good and a lot of trouble. I hope the company fixes this issue.Â  I am using a Kindle Fire HDX and evidently all of the options are not there.

title: Kindle Skype is not dependable
review: I have been helping people with Skype for Kindle tablets and they have been having quirky problems. We have to delete the app and redownload it every time we want to use it. It opens but does NOT recognize itself as being online. All contacts remain dulled out and when called from another tablet or pc, shows the Kindle owner as offline. If Skype doesn't fix this, they should stop providing it for the KINDLE!! The one on my iPad works everytime--so Skype needs some Amazon help!!!

title: this app sucks
review: This app is terrible. If there was a way to rate it with minus stars I would. Main reason I bought my Kindle was to skype with my son away at college. It crashed 14 times in 40 minutes and each time I had to restart my Kindle to even try to open the app. Same thing happened 3 times last weekend so not just a one time occurrence. I'm so angry and frustrated I just gave up. Amazon, you can find a better app to include for your customers!

title: No notifications on incoming even if app open
review: Bought kindle fire HD 8 Plus and Skype number and plan just for Aunt on nursing home. Calls out fine with Alexa. But incoming calls from Skype-to-skype, cell or landline never trying device or have a notification. Receive notification if voicemail after only. Useless. No refund from Skype even though does not work. Is fine on an android device but not fire HD.

title: Kindle Fire HD SKYPE doesn't do group calls
review: Skype is a wonderful tool, and the paid susbcriptions are worth the investment, however the version installed in the Kindle Fire HD does not allow adding people/contacts/phones to a call.I was told by SKYPE technicians that the Kindle Fire HD Version does not have the same functionality as does the Android application (in spite of what this page - and others - say).Â  It is June 2013, 7 months after the Fire HD came out, and they haven't solved the bug???Its a shame that SKYPE for the Kindle Fire HD is not as capable as other SKYPE versions.

title: Disappointing
review: When I had first gotten this app, it would work fine. I was able to video chat, call and message perfectly. Now, I can barely send a message. I would write one, click send and it would say "pending" in the corner. My message wouldn't be sent. This app lags A LOT, and sometimes won't even let me sign in! From time to time some of my contacts won't show up. If I am doing something wrong, I have absolutely no idea what it is. Now I have to use my laptop on Skype instead of the easiest way. I am very disappointed and I should hope an update will fix these problems.

title: Sad.
review: No longer working on kindle. Sad.

title: Untested - Poor usability - NSA spy tool
review: Who actually tests this stuff?Â  After the recent "update" it's even harder to use my pre-existing skype contacts that are my favorites in the Skype application.Â  It's how I communicate with Skype.Â  Now I can only access my favorites if I was in recent conversation with them only so I need to walk back to my computer to use Skype on my iPhone or Kindle.Skype has always had unneeded animations and poor usability.Â  I remember from the PC and Mac Skypes, if you wanted to make a phone call you would need to click this tiny icon and wait for the animation of it to flip around a keypad.Â  It just has a poor layout just like the Horrible Windows 8.Â  I don't expect anything good to come from this software since M$ owns it.Â  Also, since it has been revealed that Skype is unsecure because it allows the government to steal your conversations.

title: Skype on Kindle no longer works
review: Since updating to the latest version of this app (Oct 2017) I can't receive calls on my Kindle Fire HD.Â  Inbound calls don't ring or appear on screen.Â  I can call out to another device AS LONG AS IT ISN'T ANOTHER KINDLE because those calls don't ring on my contacts' Kindles, either. After the fact the app on the Kindle shows a "missed call" as if it had rung and you just didn't answer the call.Â  Basically, if you are using a kindle, you can now make calls to non-kindle devices but you can not receive a call from any device of any kind.Â  The text chat feature works, so at least that's something...

title: Outdated version of App but works well
review: This version of Skype is out of date compared to what you get in the Google Play store, which means it works a little different from your phone or Android tablet. I think that is unfortunate and a littl silly.Amazon Version: 7.36Andriod version : 8.2

title: Does not include video calling
review: Skype was preinstalled on my Fire HD. It did not include the video calling feature as described and one primary reason for purchase. I uninstalled and downloaded this version which also does not have video calling. Very disappointed. App provider should correct the description and so should Amazon!

title: Useless app .....
review: I downloaded this app to my Kindle because I use Skype routinely on both my desktop and laptop.Â  I have been unsuccessful in logging into the app because it keeps telling me that I'm already on it!I uninstalled it and reinstalled the app several times to no avail.Â  My advice: don't bother.

title: Skype unavailable on Kindle
review: All I get is the Skype WiFi in the apps ... no chat and no video !!!Â  Don't need WiFi- I have that already !!!!Â  WTH is upÂ  Skype ??? I still have it on my old kindle ... can even find it in the app store on my old kindle .... but not on the new one !!!!Â  MajorÂ  suckage !!!!!!Â  Wish I could give a (-) NEGATIVE rating ... but can't decide if it would go to Skype or the Amazon App Store !!!

title: it crash my network connection
review: I am using Fire phone now. Whenever I run skype, my 3G network drop and it seems the phone lost SIM. Then the UI get to lock screen and ask me to input SIM pin number. After I input the pin, the phone try to get the 3G network signal. And drop it again shortly. And ask me to key in pin number again. Only after I close Skype, it becomes normal. It takes me so long to find out it is skype which caused the problem. I had to turn off 3G network data usage in order to keep my phone staying normal for phone call before i found the killer.

title: Crashing and volume issues
review: The main issue I have with Skype is the fact that it crashes constantly. I could be video chatting with someone or simply rotating my kindle before Skype decides it's too much for it to handle that it will crash. After the update, I also noticed I wasn't able to hear the person I called, even after raising the volume all the way up. Took me a while to realize that you can raise the volume specifically for Skype calls that you can ONLY access just as you are calling the person before they answer (you do this by pressing the volume control on the side of the tablet).PLEASE FIX THIS. It is very annoying and highly inconvenient.

title: This sucks
review: I used to use this app all the time, so that I could talk to my boyfriend and my friends since I'm away at college, but the app updated and now I can't make calls. I can't accept calls. AND THE APP KEEPS CRASHING. This is the only app I have that does this. And I'm so sad and frustrated. Yeah, I can call my friends, but I'd rather see their faces AND hear their voices. It looks like I'm going to have to fuss with and deal with Google hangouts or the Facebook video chat. Please update the app, SO THAT IT WORKS, HAS NO BUGS, AND DOESN'T CRASH. Thank you!

title: App has a mind of its own
review: i have no problems with skype on my pc, laptop and phone, however the app for kindle is CONSTANTLY logging me out. Several times throughout the day, mid conversation it just randomly decides to log out, which is really problematic.

title: Terrible!
review: I have used Skype for quite a while, and recently skype had updated. I can no longer make calls nor receive them.Â  I think the problem has to do with the update and it should be fixed soon!

title: Terrible!
review: This app worked ok when I first downloaded it, but now it crashes my Kindle. If the program even starts to work, it freezes then crashes within about 60 seconds. Completely worthless.

title: Nonstop Crashing
review: Before the update, my kindle could take video calls with no problem, recently I can't get a video call to last longer than a minute before the screen goes white and the app goes unresponsive. If I do manage to get back to the message screen without turning the kindle off, I can't call of anything without it crashing completely, so I have to turn it off and then on again. It will only take voice calls, which is very frustrating since I'm trying to keep in touch with close people across various countries and we would like to speak face to face. I have no idea what this is, and it's driving me nuts. Fix this app! I would like to be able to make video calls again, and I would like for files to show up again like it used to. Very annoyed.

title: New update is terrible I can't see
review: The new update is awful on my kindle fire hd I can't see the other person they can't see meÂ  I can't start Skype orÂ  exit itÂ  I can't accept anything is disappointing I live far from my boyfriend so Skype is a program I use daily to see him but this is such an insult to me I'm disabled and it is long for me to see him please fix this is annoying and heartbreaking.

title: rendered useless
review: The new Skype download is nearly useless. Calls always fail and the video simply never works. If you are lucky, sometimes the audio will work in the background as the software crashes. Just don't press the wait or OK for a restart, then you can at least get a few words in. But that does not always work. If you video call, it crashes immediately. Too bad, it use to work.

title: Terrible update!
review: Up until this last week Skype has been a good app.Â  If an update is going to be pushed out, shouldn't a company make sure that it'll work properly?Â  After this last update I can't use Skype to video chat with my family!Â  Terrible update.

title: crashes on kindle fire HD 7"
review: Last 6 mos ago, it was going great. But now it is really bad. I would like to keep touch my family. It is terrible picture. It's clear but jumpy camera moving around like crazy. So I won't be able to use it much.

title: Nightmare Customer Service
review: I was having trouble with skype, so I called their customer service number and long story short, the tech man was somehow able to remote control the computer I was trying to use skype on. He controlled my mouse and was able to click on my settings. When I told him to stop, he threatened me. It was a nightmarish experience and I will never have anything to do with Skype ever again.

title: Won't stop crashing
review: In the middle of all my video chats, Skype will randomly crash and go back to the main page. After it crashes and I bring it back up, I can't make calls or answer calls without it crashing again. I always have to reset my kindle. It seems to work for a little bit, sometimes only a few seconds into a video chat, but it always crashes. I have very little way to contact people back home and this is the only way get to see them for months that I am away so I would really appreciate if all the s*** that is wrong with the app would be fixed.

title: Definitely definitely buggy on HD 8.9
review: Consistently crashes and requires an entire restart of kindle, sometimes no picture on either side but sound and other times sound and picture don't match. I can usually only get about 5 minutes with no problems. My friend has older kindle and it always works, which was the primary reason I got a kindle! Very frustrating!

title: Works well for the most part, but...
review: For the most part, Skype works well on my Kindle Fire HD. Have tested it out in different locations and I've conceded at this point that my dropped calls at home are due to my questionable internet service provider. HOWEVER -- Skype ALWAYS crashes if I'm signed-in to Skype and (like most people) put the Kindle in sleep mode when not in use with it password enabled. When I receive a call and need to unlock my Kindle, Skype crashes and I receive an error message that simply reads "Skype has stopped." I wouldn't even be writing this review if it didn't happen EVERY SINGLE TIME.Another small complaint is that it takes far too long to sign in. I'm waiting in excess of 30 seconds during the sign-in process. It takes a fraction of that time on the mobile version and the PC version. It is in my personal opinion that the Kindle version needs MUCH improvement.I'd be interested to know if any others are experiencing the crashing problem or if it's just me.

title: It Suspected My Account For No Reason
review: This app is awesome! (I haven't seen Skype on here before), but it temporally suspended my account after a single day, saying that my account was 'suspected' of sending spam, when in fact it wasn't. Please, if you're a Skype admin, please fix this.

title: Cannot make phone calls anymore.
review: No longer works on kindle fire. Cannot make phone calls. It dials the number but stops and goes blank.

title: Doesn't save credentials or notify
review: This version doesn't seem to save credentials or notify.

title: No notifications or alerts
review: This app sucks No point in having this if the notification s don't work. The only time I get a notification is when I'm actively in the app!

title: New Update.
review: The new update is horrible. First of all, if you are on a video call with someone and you try to put your video on, within ten minutes the whole page will turn white and crash. Also, it constantly will say "Skype has stopped working, would you like to close it?" You have no choice in the matter. If you don't close it, the same message will keep popping up, therefore FORCING you to close it. If you have an older version of Skype, keep it. You will not be able to get your old version back if updated to this version. Also, if you want to type a long message out, your keyboard will lag like crazy. I do not recommend this update to anyone.

title: Kindle version is out-dated- but works
review: I started Skyping when I got my Fire 8.9, and the app seems to work OK, but I've had problems with the sound being delayed about a minute after the video connects.Â  Discovered this version is way out-dated when I tried a 3-way and this version does not support it.Â  I just got an email saying there's a new version for tablets, but alas no Fire update again.Â  Think I'll write Skype and push.Â  You too!

title: Please help
review: Skype was great till it stopped working earlier today. I just got home today and I send a message to a friend, and it still says "Pending". I have been waiting almost five hours for it to start working again, but it still won't. Please help me with my issue.

title: Recently gotten HORRIBLE
review: I used to get on skype almost every single day. I just recently got my internet back and i updated skype. BIG MISTAKE. I tried voice chatting with my friends in different states when not even 15 minutes into the call. It stops up. So i pull down my screen and clicked on skype where it said it had stopped up. I really want to talk to my friends but this is horrible. I am now switching to oovoo unless Microsoft can fix this utterly ridiculous app, that used to work perfectly.

title: Having a lot of trouble!
review: I don't know if this app is just needing a overhaul or what, but I'm constantly getting kicked out while in a Skype session and also having problems with it being unresponsive during a session. I only have android phones and kindle fire HDX to use Skype with, no I phone to do face time or I would use that instead! This app has been more trouble than it's worth for not only myself, but the people who have to also use it with me. Glad it's free, because it's not worth paying for.

title: Used to good but now worst than ever
review: Every update make it more unstable, lit off black screen starting the video call, than not responding. Volume control only after conversation start, before that you can only adjust an other volume, look s like the warnings. This is the only app what adjust something else what they should. No Mic sensitivity setup, on phone no camera or selection. They made a good app to pain to use, so you look for an alternative. If Google hangout stars to work on kindle, this one is gone.One star because the last version was broken too, but at least that was worked.

title: Always crashes when in Free Time
review: Using on the Kindle HDX, while not in FreeTime, the app is very sluggish and has a large delay while in calls. When trying to get it to work in FreeTime, so my daughter can Skype her grandparents, the application crashes immediately after log in.

title: Used to be great
review: I had this app on my kindle fire HD before the update and the difference is astounding. The update ruined everything! Volume won't work, video glitchy, and trouble with sign in. If you have the old version DO NOT UPGRADE! Waiting for an update with bug fixes, though i will say i like the look of the new interface. Patiently waiting a fix!

title: good and bad
review: This app is really helpful for getting in touch with friends that have moved away but it won't let me update on kindle fire and it won't let me join video calls with more than 2 people plz fix this.

title: Skype does not work on Kindle Fire HD 8.9
review: Second time in a few months Skype has come out with a new version which doesn't work.Â  Apparently Skype developers do not perform Quality Assurance, nor do they have a QA department.Â  Skype is rude and they don't care.Â  Please if you have an older version of Skype please keep it on your device.Â  Make sure your settings do not have automaticÂ  update for Skype on.Â  Mine the sound did not work but you can fix by pressing the side volume button.Â  Then the chime keeps going off and the device powers off every 2 to 4 minutes.Â  Please fix !Â  Main reason for this purchase.

title: lockup special
review: Beware of "Free" in this case.Â  It does have a significant "Cost" called lockup.Â  You will experience frequent instances where the application just freezes and you have to reboot the device.Â  I use it to communicate with family and only use it when no other device is available.Â  Very frustrating experience.

title: It's not working like 35% of the time
review: This app is absolute bulls*** for me. It keep crashing, I can't join many group calls, and there's no way for me to update it. There are times where it won't even let me send anything. Please make this app better for kindle fire users.

title: NO ALL KINDLE FIRE HD'S CAN USE SKYPE !
review: I bought the kindle fire hd because I wanted to use Skype. This is the new kindle fire he. Not only could I not use Skype on it but it did not have a camera. Amazon was called they said the older model had it but the camera had been taken off this model , would have been nice to know. They informed me I could send it back and pay about 100 dollars more. Are you kidding , when the older model had it for less. I am trying to find out if the kindle fire HDX has a camera and use Skype anyone know ?

title: Poorly Tested App
review: I am using this app on my new Kindle Fire HDX and I am not satisfied with its quality. For a few seconds immediately after the start of a video call there is thick green stinge on both the caller 's and the callee's videos. It goes away shortly after but is very annoying. The worst thing is, the app cannot do the logout properly. When I try to sign out, it crashes and when I reopen the app I am still logged in. The only way my wife could login is to uninstall the app and reinstall it! What a nuisance!

title: New mandatory update does not work
review: (Kindle Fire HD) New update crashes constantly for no reason, audio only works with headphones, and calls are 99% immediately hung up. If you read this before updating after 3.2.505.13 DO NOT update. Skype will become completely unusable. You'll know your app is updated if you get a different menu theme.

title: Don't trust them - they stole from me.
review: Setup skype on my phone and computer.Setup an account.Paid 60 bucks for a phone number that I could be called on.My account was then locked.Â  After many emails and phone calls to skype they say they cannot unlock my account and cannot give me a refund.Â  They say I violated their terms of service, but because of their terms of service that cannot tell me what part of their terms of service they think I violated.Â  I set up this account and did not make a single call before this happened.DO NOT TRUST SKYPE - THEY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY!!!

title: Skype can be better
review: There is always a lag between sound and video.Â  The sound is often distorted and I experience horrible sound quality. There is no way to adjust the microphone or speaker volume which causing horrible feedback and sound quality.Â  Please fix these issues! This version of Skype leaves so much to be desired.Â  I really hope it gets better.

title: Limited usefulness
review: App does not notify on new Fire 7 tablet or older Fire 6HD. I have to open the app and check for messages.

title: Never Update
review: When I first downloaded this app it would crash constantly. If you want to multi-task it will crash the second you come back ane messages from your computer won't sync to your Kindle for weeks. This past week an update became available and really find zed the aesthetics of it, but of course there came a major flaw. I can no longer receive audio from the other end w/o using headphones and even then I can't adjust the volume. THIS APP IS MEDIOCORE. REFRAIN FROM UPDATES.

title: no video
review: I want to stay in contact with many of God's children around the world .... an Skype was one way to see an talk.... but the video will not work on my kindle fire HDX... this is very upsetting....Many people depending on open prayer, this is not a good way to run a company....Skype needs to fix there problems .So people that have spent money's on kindle fire HDX can do the work of the father..... the camera on the kindle fire is work I g just fine.... it's the Skype that's not connecting with the video to the kindle, fire HDX...So please Skype fix the glitches in your programs.

title: Audio Problem On HD
review: I have Skype on Windows desktop, HTC DNA Droid phone, and Kindle Fire HD.Â  The audio works fine in all environments, except the Fire HD.Â  The audio on the Fire HD is very poor. Without a headphone, I am unable to hear the audio with the volume on max.Â  With a Headphone, I can just hear the conversation if I am in a quiet room.Â  So, I am force to use either my phone or desktop when I am skyping.I am quite disappointed by this, because one of the main reason for my purchase of the HD was skype. I give them 3 stars because the video works well.Please fix this audio problem.

title: App Worked Fine Until Update
review: I Can't Seem To Get The Camera To Work After Updating And It Keeps Freezing Or Booting Me Off My Video Chat.Â  Will Give The App 5 Stars When Bugs Are All Fixed.Â  I Don't Want To Sign Out And Delete This App Because It's The Only Way I Can Keep In Touch With Family.

title: Not working on my Kindle Fire HDX
review: I installed Skype on my 8.9" HDX and on my father's.Â  So far it only works on mine.When he tries to answer a call, of any type, the screen does a quick back-and-forth between the app and the home screen before dropping the call. restarting the tablet and reinstalling the app did not make any difference.Â  Have not found very useful info on the web to diagnose, let alone resolve this issue.A bit frustrating since one of the reasons for going with the HDX was the front-facing camera for Skype video calls.

title: worst update yet....
review: Version 4.4 really dropped the ball. The layout is disorganized and unwieldy and each time I get a message I have to re-sign in. Extremely disappointed, Skype. Should have just kept what you had before.....

title: wont update conversations
review: Its pretty good at first. Until i noticed i never got updates on my conversations, i thought no one was talking but instead the app would not alert me about messages, or show them, it stopped showing messages all together. Making me miss importantÂ  information details, anÂ  conversationÂ  all together. I was unaware of its doing until i opened up SKYPE on the computer 115 missed messages. For some this is the only way to contact me so i deem this unacceptable for an app to do. Extremely dissatisfied

title: crashes in kids FreeTime mode...
review: Works fine unless you run kids FreeTime mode and launch from there.Â  Opens for a split second and crashes on the Kindle Fire HDX.Â  Basically makes it so you can't let the kids talk to family without taking the Fire out of kids mode.

title: Appalling to say least
review: I cannot write how unbelievably awful the new update is but let's try shall we. It CONSTANTLY crashes not only the app its self but my whole freaking kindle! You can no longer control the volume when you have it on in the background, you could have it on nothing and still have the call blaring on full blast! When it has crashed and you restart the app it can still call, although for a video calling service you often end up with no video at all! Just freaking perfect and the best part is, there is no going back, you can no longer get an actual fully functional version of Skype. At the moment, you are better off with Oovoo!!

title: New Update isn't very good
review: I've had skype on my Kindle Fire HD 7" for a while but with the new update when I close the app it isn't giving me a notification when in my notification settings it's turned on. It freezes up a lot when I try to skype call people, and it won't let me look at my contacts, it will crash if I try.

title: Keeps freezing!
review: I love Skype and use it on my smartphone without any issues but I have yet to have more than 1 minute (if I'm lucky) on my Kindle Fire HD before it freezes. It is soooooo frustrating!! I've read some of the reviews and it seems I'm far from alone, I hope the developer keeps tabs on reviews and fixes this problem. For now I've moved on to Tango but would love to come back to Skype!

title: kid's no longer able to Skype nana and papa
review: Skype freezes and reboots kindle fire hd constantly. We are lucky if there is a minute of video chat before it crashes. There will be lots of disappointment on Christmas as all of our family lives out of state.

title: I can't sign in. I could on my computer ...
review: I can't sign in. I could on my computer, but not on the device. after ONE ATTEMPT to sign in. I get bombarded with captchca codes. I changed my password & it STILL wouldn't let me sign in. I.give.up. this is not user friendly.

title: Love it
review: I love the app because I can still chat with my friend from California with out using my phone cause I have limited amount of talk. But Skype is free! A lot of people say it lags badly and it glitch and goose back to home screen but I have no problems except for a little lag but that usually happens.ðð§

Reviewer_Name: My Pen Name is Pen Name.
title: SUCKS
review: It freezes your kindle ruins your keyboard lags apps lags your keyboard lags the app itslef makes u end calls when u didnt randonly ends calls so you get the point IT IS HORRIBLE

title: Bring back the Skype version that came with my Kindle Fire HD
review: The version of Skype that came with my Kindle Fire HD 7 (previous generation) worked splendidly.Â  Then came these nasty messages from Skype saying that I had to upgrade to the current version.Â  "had to" because I couldn't get past these messages to use Skype.Â  OK...so I upgraded.Â  Now Skype doesn't work at all on my Kindle.Â  Period.Â  Am now using Yahoo Messenger instead.Â  What a joke this new version of Skype is.Â  Clearly it was not at all well tested before being released.

title: newest update...
review: The newest update for Skype on kindle has made it very difficult to speak with my wife or my other family while deployed. It's the only means I have without buying a laptop or a fire HD. I am very disappointed with this oversight. However it does work about 1 out of 5 times on a regular fire.

title: Worthless
review: My Kindle download was fine BUT will not log in! Says no account then takes me to Microsoft page for recovery. Changed passwords three times to no avail. Not happy!!! My phone app works flawlessly.

title: UUUGGHH
review: I hate it rn! It randomly signed me out and every time I try to sign in again it says "Unable to sign in" DID THIS PLEASEð­ð£ð¡ð¤ð ð¤ð¤ð¤ð¤

title: disappointing
review: Have used this app before with limited success on an Android phone. Got it again pre-installed on my Kindle but due to usage issues I don't go on often enough to remember my password. I attempted creating a new account as it would not send a "forgot password" email and the app refused to cooperate. No matter what or how many characters I used for a password it insisted it was always too short, it managed to change my user name to something completely off the wall (which was not a result of any text autocorrect), and sadly, was just an overall useless app at a moment when it was a personally importantÂ  to have. I will be researching other video chat/text apps that I'm certain will be less headache to use.

title: after update Skype no longer works for kindle
review: Skype was fine for awhile, sometimes it would freeze or I couldn't do two things at once but recently there's a new update that it forces me to get ...now it's saying Skype is incompatible with my device wtf

title: Skype pain.
review: Well I would have thought that they would have fixed Skype by now. Mine crashed and burned big time. I uninstalled and I reinstalled. I guess I'll have to see what happens but I'm not too confident considering all the reviews.

title: Issues need to be fixed!!
review: The few times I've used skype on my kindle fire hdx, my parents let me know the image was jumpy and when using the phone to call my grandmother, she kept hearing an echo of herself. I switched to using skype on my laptop, works fine. Fix it!!

title: worse update
review: Fix Skype .... it ends my calls , it has lagged reception and it lags when I talk, its about a 4 second delay .... I can't call people either , I have to have them call me ... Cause when i call , it says connecting then drops call. And when in my Skype call it drops call randomly . And I hate this update .I'm really sad they don't fix this with so many bad reviews. Its garbage, out of all respect fix this . plenty people want the same....I think you should look into this and fix . haha real talk .

title: Only part of it works
review: So I use Skype on my computer with little problem. The app for my kindle fire HDX will let me video chat with someone. The problem is that We can both hear each other, they can see me, but I can't see them.Â  Once this problem is fixed I will change my rating. Until then it only gets 3 stars.

title: sucks
review: It was working just fine but then when i try to get on it it's telling me to get the newer version. Well i tried getting the newer version but then it said i cannot get that app because it's not for my mobile. The app said it's for android, and I'm using my android!! It sucks now don't get it. It's telling me to get the new version but it's not letting me. And the version i have now, will not let me in my account it's ridiculous...

title: Problem!
review: it was working just fine before, but now I cant even hear anyone when I call them, but they can hear me. I don't know what the problem is. I am trying to re download it to see if it will work then. Plz tell me how to fix this problem if you know how.

title: Canr even use it
review: On my kindle fire, I can't even download it! It just says open, but when I click open it just takes me back to the same oage! Pls help. Not sure if it is a app problem or a kindle problem.

title: used to work
review: App used to work great. Updated it on my kindle fire hd, as did my mom and now it won't work. To everyone saying that it works fine, good for you, but for those that it doesn't work for, this is crap. Fix it!

title: The latest version doesn't work with Kindle Fire HD 7 ...
review: The latest version doesn't work with Kindle Fire HD 7. The video chat is disabled by the default and there isn't option to turn it on.

title: Confusing
review: I have trouble operating this app; the interface is sort of confusing. The navigation is not intuitive, at least for me. It DOES work, but getting there is rather frustrating.

title: no video
review: Despite many tries, reading support post, reading comments on Kindle app page, deleting and reinstalling app I have not been able to place video calls on my kindleI know the camera works on other apps but in skype it doesn't even give you the ability to video check. I have checked the video box in settings to no avail.My cousin who also has an 8.9 HX is also not able to get the camera to work.If i find a solution to this problem i would be glad to give it 4 stars (1 star off for bad video quality.

title: does not work well on kindle fire hd
review: I was prompted to upgrade because the version i had was pretty old. The old version was by no mean perfect for video calls, but I learned to work with it. The new version is terrible. Video calls no longer work properly. I can get at most a few minutes of video before the screen would turn completely white and the call would drop. Voice calls seem to work fine, so far.

title: Junk
review: No matter how good my Internet is this program is always laggy. Terrible video quality and it will freeze and crash. Also the pip of my camera is large enough to obscure who I'm talking to, why can't I remove or shrink it? This app needs some serious fixes. Look elsewhere for video chat.

title: Does not work with Kindle HDX 8.9 sound lags behind picture
review: I haveÂ  kindle 8.9hDX skype doesn't work right. the sound lags behind the video. Skype wrote to me in their forum it is a known issue. they still haven't fixedÂ  it. If you are planning to SKYPE do not buy the KIndle HDX. Very disappointed with Amazon who dont say a word about it..

title: Needs more work
review: This app needs a lot of work. It won't stop giving me notification sounds even when I turn on quiet mode. I'm very disappointed in the quality of this app compared its counterparts.

title: OK, I guess
review: doesn't work very well. Not impressed.

title: Great, but one problem occurred
review: Skype works very well, and I can hear all of my friends clearly, but there is one problem. Skype said that there was an update, so I updated it, and then I tried going on again, but it still said there is an update. I looked again to see if there was another update, but it only said "open" instead of "update". Just to say, I haveÂ  a kindle fire HD. If you know how to fix this problem, please tell me how to fix it.

title: Breaks all the time
review: This app, while being a great application - when it's working - for connecting with your friends, has so many issues. It constantly stops working, often gives me issues with signing in and I have to restart over and over again. I have had to uninstall it numerous times in order to fix it. These problems are so awful I think it should cost a negative amount and give you money to use their godforsaken app.

title: terrible app
review: I was trying to use this on my firephone, its horrible, loud, shrieking feedback, constantly disconecting and doesnt maintain a clear picture. All in all a horrible product.

title: Doesn't show my profile picture no matter what I do.
review: I read Business Skype doesn't show a profile picture. Maybe this app is for business. I tried everything and my profile shows no picture.

title: THIS APP SUCKS DO NOT BUY
review: IÂ  downloaded the update and it ruined it all! WARNING DO NOT BUY THIS APP IT SUCKS. After I bought the update and it makes me use a email and password I can't even get to my context!!! I hate this DUMB APP .Â  If you get this app you will be sorry and don't blame it on me! Now good bye!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Completely Useless for my Kindle
review: I downloaded this app for my Kindle as a way to connect to friends around the world but the app is so outdated that you can't even make calls. Until an update becomes present, I have to say that there is no point in wasting storage for this app.

title: Incompatible
review: I really want/need this app to keep up with some of my friends who don't have phones and I can't spend all my time on the computer but when I tried to download it said it was incompatible. :( Very disappointedNote: I have a kindle fire 2013

title: Kind of ð
review: It lets me message my kindergarten teacher but when I try it doesn't work!!it should be banned!!I don't like it

title: not made for the kindle fire.
review: Works great on my computer but does not work on the kindle fire. It will shut off in the middle of a call. Of course you have to open it first which is a problem because it will either shut down or freeze the tablet. Needs an upgrade to be functional.

title: COMPLETE GARBAGE
review: COMPLETE GARBAGE! I had to uninstall it on my Kindle Fire HD 8 because the option for "keep me signed in" wasn't there even though the Skype chat agent says it's supposed to be on every platform and also because no form of sound or vibrate notifications were coming through for an incoming call. When I tried to reinstall it, it opened the first time as if it's going to successfully reinstall, but when it had downloaded and in the installing step, it stopped at around 90% and wouldn't go further. I thought it was because of a bad Wi-Fi signal, so I out it on the router directly and still didn't work. Cancelled the install attempt and tried to search for Skype again to download and experienced the whole it trying to open but closes after half a second.

title: complete and total garbage

title: Not a working app.Â  Will not allow area code to be entered
review: I am really peeved that the Skype download for Kindle Fire HD 8.9 does not allow for you to add the area/local code, so that you can obtain a number for your device on the local network.Â  This renders video chatting with other friends on Skype useless, since they have no contact number with which to reach you.Â  I tried to delete it twice and reload the application, and even tried the android application.Â  Nothing I did corrected the problem.Â  If you don't put the area code in and just have the state, like Texas, it gives you a phone area code for San Antonio, which is 5 hours away.Â  Someone needs to seriously look at this and make a correction to the app., or give us a way to fix it.Â  Skype is one of the main video chatting apps that most people use.Â  Had I known it was useless I would have spent my money on the Ipad, but i figured all i needed was to video chat and didn't need to have a camera on the back for vidoes and pictures that the Ipad includes.Â  At least Ipad can use SKYPE!Â  I'd give this app a zero if it allowed....

title: I wish I could give it less than one star.
review: I bought two Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 32G tablets for my husband and I for Christmas presents.Â  He is a marine, I thought that for his deployment this would be great for entertainment and communication.Â  This app has worked correctly once.Â  Just one single time.Â  The speakers stopped putting out what he was saying, the screen freezes, calls are "busy" over and over again (even though we confirmed the other person is not making a call).Â  I'll be deleting this App and might try to re-download, but I don't have much faith.This is separate from the Skype review - but I'm incredibly disappointed with my Kindle over all.Â  It seems that most things don't work - except for things eligible for purchase off of Amazon.Â  I am an avid PC/Android user - and I hate to say it - but I wish I had just bought an IPAD.

title: Poor quality
review: First app used on the brand new Kindle Fire HD. Connected without a problem, but the picture quality was very poor, the voice transmission was spotty at best and the call couldn't stay connected. Was it our Wifi? Well, we disconnected the Skype call and dialed up via Facetime and had no problems at all. I'd say it was the Skype.

I've had difficulty logging in at least 30 times since I've had the Skype app. Which is probably about 2 months. I am tired of going through this crap. I've even had to make several accounts because of never get an email multiple times.

title: Volume problems
review: Kindle Fire 8.9" HD. Installed Skype for tablet from the Kindle App Store. Already had a Skype account on my computer so account setup was not an issue. Audio volume is buggered. The start up sound is fine. The ring sound is low and call volume is very low. This appears to be a software problem in Skype. They need to fix this problem.THe video quality is very good with a good wi-fi connection. The microphone works well and does not appear to pick up too much surrounding noise. The person I was talking to said that the volume was fine on their end.When Skype corrects the volume problem, this will be a 5 star application. Until then 3 stars at most.A delete and second install seems to have cured the volume problem and Skype now works well.

title: No group video chat with Kindle Fire HD and Skype...
review: I am giving this app 1 measly star because I can't give it 0 stars. I have been reading online and it appears Amazon/Skype has removed the group video chat capability of Skype with Kindle. I recently signed up for Skype Premium so I could group chat with my sons who live in different states. They both have Kindle Fire HD's. What a waste of $10?! At least I didn't pay for the whole year up front, I guess. Many of the reviews about Skype I have read were posted by folds who signed up for the entire year! After about 30 minutes of trying and having various issues, we gave up and I started doing some researching. We also had various other issues with Skype when trying to video chat one-on-one. Everything from the video freezing, dropping calls, slow video, and the app crashing. I will not be renewing my Skype membership unless this issue is fixed ASAP.

title: New Updates
review: So got my kindle for Christmas and was happy that it came with this app cause I finally had a mobile Skype. Didn't enjoy the fact that if I had my keyboard up in the IMs that I couldn't see if someone was messaging me, from what my sister says she has the same problem on her phone. I learned to deal with it, simply close the keyboard randomly to check if that orange "1" is flashing. Most annoying was that even if I signed out Skype would still display me as online causing me to uninstall the app whenever I didn't want to appear online.Fast forward to today and I download Skype to find it has a new update,and a crappy one at that. Now it has "tablet mode" and "smart phone mode" which are supposed to be "optimized" for that type of device. Which is an outright lite given that I'm on a kindle and using the smartphone mode because it's the only one that flips with the screen. Why they removed the screen matching the position of the tablet but kept it for the phone is beyond me.While a complete and utter bell/whistle they even removed the profile picture that appears next to the person's name while in chat.

title: Skype/useless
review: I got a kindle to take travelling with me, partly to use Skype to keep in touch with home. All worked brilliantly till an automatic up date, supposedly making Skype better for the tablet, downloaded it's self. I've paid to have a number on Skype and do use credit to make some calls and send texts, but I've found that being a paying customer means nothing to Skype, I am evidently worthless to them.Â  It was near impossible to contact anyone at Skype, it's really hard to get to the point that you can actually communicate with someone and when I finally did they weren't helpful at all.Â  So I got in touch with Amazon, they were great and gave me a way to overcome the problems I've been having. Albeit a temporary fix.The problems I've had have included, not being able to sign in, the control panel disappearing so I cannot sign in or out (once signed out automatically there was no way to sign back in), see what credit I have or access my profile. Losing all records of any texts that I have sent and paid for. The programme constantly crashes.Having got home from travelling I have again contacted Skype to try and resolve the problem.Â  Several emails have been exchanged, they have collected data from me about the problem and now have closed the case without having resolved the problem at all. I have lost money because of the problems I've had, directly from my Skype credit, I shall never see that again.Â  Skype is a disgrace, if anything goes wrong with the programme they are useless, it appears to be a waste of time contacting them, they don't understand their own product.

title: This app is beyond garbage

What bothers me is since the updates it's like this program isn't even made for my kindle,crash crash crash crash crash. Thats the story of my life nowadays. You pretty much cannot access any other program while it's running even though it keeps it running in a pic in pic screen in the corner. If you do it will......whats that folks?......CRASH. Absolutely the most useless program on the planet. I plan to sell my kindle back to amazon as soon as I get home for the measily 56 bucks they are offering after my 7 months of ownership and I am buying a IPAD thats right I said it. At least I know face time is reliable and wont drop after 1 to two seconds of use. This is truely a pathetic product and should be an embarassment to amazon. Both the Kindle fire HD which has crashed and had to be completely restored to factory 4 times on me since I purchased and the Skype as well. NEVER AGAIN.

title: Update Ruined Skype
review: Since Skype has been updated I've faced a bunch of problems. One problem is that the volume is high, it doesn't matter if I put the volume on zero I can still hear the person on the other line loudly. Another problem that I have is that as soon as you click on the app it signs in automatically. If someone was to click on my Skype they would be able to access my messages and contacts immediately.Â  I want my privacy. Another problem is that it continuously crashes for no apparent reason. One minutes it's working and the next it's sending you a message that says "Skype is not responding would you like to close it" if you say yes it closes and if you don't the message will continue to pop up. Before the update I also noticed that Skype would just hang up my calls and I thought it was my internet connection but after reading numerous reviews I realize that I'm not the only one with this problem. Skype needs to be fixed immediately. The company should fix all the glitches before putting it back in the Appstore.

review: I was very disappointed to find that new version of the Kindle Fire HD does not have the same functions available as the older version.Â  I checked the Amazon site for the Kindle to see if Skype was available on the Kindle Fire HD and was very happy to see the statement that it was pre-installed.Â  Once I had the Kindle and downloaded the Skype program I called customer service to find out why I couldn't find the program on the Kindle.Â  It was then that I was given a very confusing explanation that the newer Fire HD did not have a camera, while the older version did, and if I wanted to use Skype, I could trade in the Kindle I just received for Christmas and pay an additional $100 for the Kindle HDX.Â  ALSO, I bought a Kindle Fire HD for my granddaughter for Christmas only to find out it isn't the same as the Kindle Fire HD as mine, even though they were both purchased from Amazon and within 2 weeks of each other, the Kindle Fire HD protective case does not fit her Kindle HD.Â  Why when you purchase 2 Kindle Fire HDs are they not the same? title: Good, but weak on handling of incoming calls.
review: I'm using this app on a Kindle Fire HD 7.Skype, in general, is excellent. This version of Skype app for Fire is only OK.It works well for making outgoing video/voice calls, and texts.If the Fire is locked, incoming calls/texts aren't notified and don't appear until you unlock and open the Skype app, at which time they appear as missed calls.IF the app is OPEN and TOPMOST on the screen (or the top app in the open-app-stack), it works fine for incoming calls. Incoming text messages appear almost instantly, but without any sound notification, so you need to watch the screen if you're expecting a message.If the app is either not running at all or not on the top of the open-app-stack, incoming calls aren't notified at all.Also, even if the app is open and topmost on the screen, calls to a Skype phone number from a mobile or landline phone (as opposed to from a Skype contact) don't appear on the Fire (but you do eventually get a "missed call" indicator).All-in-all it appears to be well behind the Skype app on other devices; I don't know if that is because development is lagging or because the Fire simply doesn't have the capability to respond to incoming notifications.

So I gave up & installed vsee and it downloaded fast and connected right away.Â  And the user interface is self-evident.

title: Clever skype, skewing your own feedback ;)
review: Skype cuts out alot, the auditory is not good, the visual is not good. I've noticed that, conveniently, skype prompts me for feedback after a call - for a long call, more than for a short call.Â  Naturally, if I have a long call, then the connection was probably sound. Otherwise, if it cuts out or the visual is so terrible, I disconnect and re-dial the person, resulting in a series of shorter calls - for which skype does not as frequently prompt me for feedback. Oooh, how convenient for you skype! Ask me for feedback coincidentally for long calls - which due to their length of time, probably went well - and refrain from prompting feedback when there is a series of short calls, demonstrating a poorly working call.Obviously, I give feedback on my own through both skype itself - and on here, like now - but still, skype, I think you are skewing your own data on purpose.

title: Very Disappointed Paying Skype Customer + Update
review: Paying Skype customer for years.Â  It was great but just gets worse.Â  Skype for my most recent Fire tablet never rings when someone calls.Â  Tried everything and then tried everything again.Â  Been through the support threads.Â  It worked fine on my older Fire.Â  It seems to be an issue with many Android and Fire tablets.Â  Also this is the worst version of Skype and hard to use. Tried a couple of free phone programs apps similar to Skype and they work just fine.Â  Very disappointed.Update.Â  Skype has had a fairly substantial update since my last review.Â  Now it rings and sometime I can answer the call successfully.Â  Often it just closes and disconnects.Â  Hard to get to messages and sometimes impossible.Â  Now when I make a call there is no ring sound. only silence until someone answers so hard to tell if it had dialed out and connected.Â  I miss the good ol' days when skype worked well.Update: Guess what... it's worse.
