title: Not good for beginners
review: I would not recommend this app for anyone who doesn't already have a basic understanding of the language they're trying to learn. It does not teach you grammar, conjugation, or sentence structure, it only teaches you vocabulary and expects you to already know the rest. I took French in both High school and college, so I have a basic understanding. If I didn't have that, this app would be useless. If you're just trying to review or keep things fresh in your mind this app will work for you.

title: Does not even sign me in.
review: I used Duolingo for a while, but then I stopped. I don't remember why. It was an AWESOME app, and I loved how it was set up, and everything about it.Â  Recently, I decided to start using it again. I still had it in my Amazon fire. I completed a few lessons offline, and it said I had to go online to do more.Â  I turned on the Wi-Fi on my fire, and it signed me out of Duolingo! I tried to sign in, but it wouldn't let me. I in installed th app, and reinstalled it. It still would not let me sign in.This was about a week ago. I still have the app on my Fire, although I will probably uninstall it.I HATE to give an app anything but a five star reveiw unless it is ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY. This, I felt was.So, to whoever reads this reveiw, please do not look at the rating and think " oh, this is a bad app. It's not worth downloading"It is, and if it is fixed i will edit my review.Duolingo is an amazingÂ  program. Download it on another app store , or use it online.It was an amazing app before it crashed.

title: Not for travel, or for serious language learning
review: Most recently, I used Duolingo to prep for a trip to Mexico.Â  It wasn't until *Level 19* that I learned how to say "I don't speak Spanish."Â  Uh?This app is not interested in teaching you how to form a sentence.Â  (Whatever you do, don't use it for German, because it doesn't teach you anything about why you use certain endings when you do; I'm fluent in German and tried it in German and it was laughable.)Â  I'd forgive it that if it taught you enough to get by in a tourist context, but it doesn't do that well, either.Â  You may learn how to ask "How much does it cost?" by Level 10 or so, but you won't understand all the numbers, so when someone comes back to you in the language with an answer, you're clueless.Â  I used it before travelling to Italy, to Spain, to France, and to Mexico, at different times, and had the same experience. With Italian and French, fortunately I'd studied them earlier and just needed a refresher.Â  With Spanish, I passed all Duolingo's lessons with aces, and went well into the upper levels, but was basically unable to understand when I got to Spain or Mexico.Â  A program that teaches neither vocabulary nor grammar in any detail is useless in practice.

review: Some levels of this game/learner are great. It's an app that makes learning languages a game and for that it does keep me coming back for now. I started 3 different languages just to see if it was across the board or just the language I chose. Spanish, Irish, and Vietnamese. I have found more mistakes in Spanish that the others but I am also not as far along in learning in the other two. So when you find a mistake report it so the next person gets a better game/learning experience.

title: No longer supported.
review: Sadly Duolingo haven't updated this app for over two years and it has now stopped working on my Kindle Fire, I can no longer log in. My 9 year son had made excellent progress with his Italian thanks to the app, now he's devastated because he can't access it any more. He can't have the Google Play version because Amazon doesn't allow Google apps to run on child profiles, so he'll just have to stop practising. Not sure why this version is still being made available for download when it's no longer supported. Update it or remove it!

title: Not at great app
review: I like duolingo but this is not the best app for learning languages. Rather just use the browser.

title: I had heard Duolingo was quite good and those who had rated this app had nothing ...
review: I can speak five languages and wanted this app to teach a friend, I had heard Duolingo was quite good and those who had rated this app had nothing but praise. So I was shocked at what I saw. For a start this app was very dictatorial, it uses games to teach, the problem is these games introduce articles of grammar in its question which it has not yet taught you. So in affect you keep getting the question wrong because the new learner has not yet learned what it is asking. secondly It does not teach the usual way of learning basic people introducing each in every day conversation. Instead it dives straight into list of words detached from everyday communication and conversation. Plus it had no repeat slowly or pronunciation guide, it just throws words at you pronounced so fast you don't understand what was said and you can not go back to a question. Don't buy it shop around, there are better ways to learn.

title: Good stand alone teacher, could do better.
review: Like the method of learning through pictures and immersion.Â  Daily reminders an leader board very motivational.Â  Microphone pickup and voice recognition very poor, sometimes works other time useless no logic to when (hence only three stars.)Â  Would like to see Mandarin available on this.

review: You can install this app from the Amazon store but it basically doesn't work on the Fire tablet as it won't allow you to get past the login screen. Other reviewers say the same thing. You would think that the developers would be embarassed.

title: Very good app but...
review: This is a very very good app, but there is an issue which drives me crazy. In the tests it is too specific in the answers required. For example it asks for a translation of "o quarto" which to any Portuguese person is "the bedroom" but the test fails you because it was looking for "the room"Then is asks for "the youth" easy I thought "o jovem" and was failed for not putting the plural. The youth is plural or singular in English.This app is very good but it is ruined by its being too pedantic.

title: Two Stars
review: It's good, but doesn't support all the languages that are available on the website or the Apple app.

title: initally great, but let down with a bang
review: I've had this on my phone and was happily learning Irish, when I inadvertently hit a button and now everything is in a different language, possibly German(?!), and I can't get my irish back. So I tried downloading to my kindle, but there is no irish option at all!! The languages seem to be limited on this version.

title: Just dreadful
review: Do NOT use Duolingo to learn a foreign language! It is okay as a bit of light-hearted fun, but is truly dreadful as am educational tool. I have only looked at the German Language Course, so this review only covers that one language. There is no teaching of grammar. German has 3 genders and 4 cases- none of this is explicitly taught. You are expected to 'absorb' this...along wit the various verb forms and tenses...the different prepositions...weak/strong nouns....word order....need I go on? You NEED to be taught the niceties of grammar!....If you have a query you can ask other users for help - but they may be just as confused as you. In some cases they most definitely are confused! I have read answers to questions that were wrong wrong WRONG!!!! ....I am actually fluent in German and would never recommend Duolingo for anyone wanting to learn the language.

title: Use it every day. Not sure if I'm really ...
review: Use it every day. Not sure if I'm really learning the language (Italian), but I can recognize words and phrases after 1.5 years of daily use.

title: Let's travel!
review: Fun presentation mixing graphics, listening/speaking and reading to immerse students in a gradual escalation of difficulty within their chosen language course. The app doesn't overexplain like a textbook, so be prepared to just dive in!You can repeat any lesson when you need to, and you receive points for completing sections that you can use to unlock supplemental lessons like idioms.

title: Please fix this, it's annoying
review: When I enter the app and try to log in it refreshes and goes back to the menu. It'sÂ  really annoying. I turned my kindle off and back on, cleared my data and uninstalled it but it still won't work.

title: Sentences are sometimes odd but good app
review: I'm currently using the app to learn 2 languages. The computer-created sentences can be a bit odd. I doubt that los pajaros leen el diario. (The birds read the newspaper.) The main thing keeping me from rating it 5 stars is that there is no alphabet tutoring for the languages. If I'm learning Spanish, it isn't an issue. But, what if I want to try Greek? What are the letters, and how are they pronounced?

title: Good learning tool
review: This is a fun way to practice language. I got it before I took a French class, and I learned a lot of vocabulary and had a head start, but I wouldn't recommend trying to learn a language just through the app because it is harder to learn the rules, conjugation, etc. You get much more out of it when you use the app alongside an actual class.

title: Fun and helpful
review: This app is FABULOUS when I can't get on my computer but still want to keep my streak going.I do have one criticism, which is that it doesn't have buttons for accented vowels, so you do get reminded "watch your accents" but at the same time, it is not helping you remember to use them since you can't put the accents in at all.

title: Not Working
review: Tried to log-in with my kindle 7. I thought it was a problem with my password but then I changed my password and I still can't log in. So it must be the app itself.

title: Pretty good
review: I already have some experience with the language I am using this for, but I find it well-done and intuitive to use. I am using this on Kindle and cannot make certain special characters required and it dings me which is more funny than annoying.

title: I want to give this five stars - if this ...
review: I want to give this five stars - if this were the iPad version, I would. However, every time my son tries to practice his Spanish, he does well until a question comes that requires him to type. At this point, the game freezes. No keyboard shows up, and he can't even click "check" (and get it wrong) to move on to the next question. It's frustrating, to say the least.

title: Great App
review: This app is easy to use. I have learned a good deal of Spanish by using it. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that I was going to try to stack languages and start learning French but the application said I wouldÂ  have to change my base language to Spanish. I wanted to keep practicing Spanish from English and practice French from Spanish.Â  Sometimes the voice recognItion is a little glitch on my Kindle Fire HD. However, I use the app every day. I would suggest it to anyone. This is the kind of thing there should be more of on the internet.

title: very fun
review: I love you get to practice spanish and Learn a lot of new words and you can go to the area where it explains if you miss something thÂ  only reason I gave it 4 stars was because some of the levels have no training instruction you have to of had some spanish to know it or you get it wrong so it doesn't teach first or explain why you got it wrong only other people learning the language but you do get to practice alot

title: Good program
review: This program is set up very well.Â  I know spanish, and so far, I haven't learned anything new, but it is good for refreshing the memory.Â  There are mistakes though.Â  I don't know how much confusion this could cause a beginner.

title: a great way to learn a new language
review: I have been using duolingo to learn Spanish. I think it is the most intuitive way to learn a language other than immersion.Â  I like that you can go back and redo lessons if you take a break from it for a few days, and brush up on what you've previously learned. Sometimes I don't understand why my answers are incorrect, though and thst can be frustrating.

title: Interesting....
review: Although I love having goals, I found this website a little off-putting when I was reminded at 11 pm that I had my quota of French yet to be met.Â  Although I had targeted 10 minutes per day for study, it many times took me 45 minutes to complete the two lessons each day, not something that inspires confidence.Â  I also found it difficult when new words or phrases would be randomly introduced without any predicate.Â  Considering that you have three possible mistakes in the course of 20 questions, new words at the end of a difficult sequence forced me to start again.Â  Slight spelling typos were also problematic when my i-Phone keyboard auto-corrected.Â  Although I love this concept, I think the program needs work.

title: Won't Work!
review: Won't work on the Kindle fire. It just keeps going back to the first screen no matter how many times I pick a language. So frustrating!

title: Fantastic app for easy learning
review: Fantastic app for easy learning...if ya want to work on it !!One major flaw for me is im learning Spanish , French and brushing up on Irish but the app regularly opens up in'learning English for Dutch speakers 'Takes a while to get back to my courses.This happens on my kindle fire 2014 hdand fire phone and for reference ipod touch 5th gen

title: Using it 32 consecutive days & counting! Need prior knowledge! You will learn spelling and grammer! But doesn't explain/teach!
review: Over 20 years ago, I lived in Italy for 4 years (not consecutive) and had several group lessons but despite the efforts of my various instructors, I just didn't have the patience to learn the grammar.Â  My knowledge of vocabulary was good enough for me to communicate and function but I never could get the hang of conjugating verbs, learning about the articles, and spelling words properly.Â  Later lived in Latin America for 4 years and that messed up my language skills big time!Â  So, now I speak both languages very poorly - just throwing out words to make a mishmash sentence.Â  A couple years ago I went back to Italy and they asked me if I could speak english because they couldn't tell if I spoke Spanish, Italian or some unknown language!Â  (Note: My native language is American English)So, I'm returning to Italy again for a 2 week vacation and I'm determined to be better this time and not embarrass myself.Â  So, I got Duolingo on Feb 20th and believe it or not, I'm truly addicted to the program!Â  I have a full time job and when I come home I'm tired and yet, every single day, I spend 1 hour to 2 hours working on these mini lessons from Duolingo!Â  Funny, they are kind of addictive.Â  They force you to learn the language by making you hear the language, speak the language, interpret the phrase back and forth between languages, to spell it properly, and put it in the correct order.Â  If you do it wrong more than 3x then, it kicks you out of the lesson and makes you start over, but the lesson is different the next time around.Â  Now, you would think one would get discouraged, I mean, I've had to redo some lessons about 6x, and yet, somehow, the way it is structured, it makes me want to keep at it and do it right!Â  I mean it is working on me, one of the most stubborn learners!So there are a multitude of topics at every level (beginning/intermediate/advanced) and within each topic they have 4-8 different minilessons in each topic.Â  It visually has a graph that shows you where you are at.Â  And, even when you think you are done with a topic (whew), every couple of days, that topic reopens and they make you practice it again so you don't forget!Â  Wow!Â  So, even with my background knowledge/vocabulary of Italian, I'm still at the very end of the beginners (Level 8; 335 words!) and I've been working hard for a month!Â  Oh, another downer is I was working on it for 12 days and suddenly it reset and told me I was back on day 1.Â  I thought it did that every 12 days but now it says I'm at 16 days. (IF ANYONE READS THIS FROM DUOLINGO; I WANT IT RESET TO FEB 20TH THAT I'VE DONE IT EVERY SINGLE DAY!).The downside is that if you have never ever studied a latin language this would be super hard for you.Â  I think if you already know a similar language like spanish and how it is structured, it will be easier for you.Â  However, if you are a person who has never studied a romance language and absolute beginner that only knows Ciao, etc..and hever had a lesson, then, you will have a hard time.Â  Also, if you are a miserable speller in your native language, learning to spell Italian will kill you because it is so difficult to get all of the vowels in the right place.Â  I have many times translated a very complicated sentence from english to Italian, only to get it counted wrong cuz I misspelled 1 letter!Â  But, it forces me to really think what I'm writing and how it all comes together to form a complete sentence.Â  Also, it really doesn't teach you the vocabulary or the grammar rules, at all.Â  I kept failing the lesson because I wasn't sure what some articles meant because they seem to mean different things at different times.Â  Yesterday, I finally broke down and got a grammar book so I can look up what all of the articles mean.Â  So, this program works for people who are already familiar.Â  I'm worried that when I get in the more immediate level, I might need to study before using this as it isn't really a good teacher - doesn't explain or introduce new concepts.Â  Good for people that really want to tighten up what they already know and go farther.

title: Doesn't work on my Fire tablet
review: I downloaded the app onto my son's Fire tablet with no issue, but when I go into the first lesson, the pictures are all blank.Â  A quick Google search tells me this is a common issue with this app on Fire devices.Â  I'm looking forward to trying again when the bug has been fixed.

title: Like it
review: Its fun, but every single time I go onto the app Food 2 is weakened. I get every single one correct! I am learning Spanish. Plus it never makes it clear when to use escribe or escriben or escribed or whatever. Plus when it says to listen then type it in I can't because I'm in bed at night or in a public place. Also the idioms is just terrible in my opinion. It was a huge waste of time. I just hate it how I never get a word wrong but I still have to redo every lesson

title: Looks good
review: I have only been using this app for two days. It is laid out pretty good, but it is difficult to judge it with only two sessions.

title: Freezes my Kindle Fire HDX
review: I really love DuoLingo, but I've given up on using this app on my Kindle Fire HDX because it freezes my entire device. I am using the app on my Android phone with no issues and using the Web site on my desktop; learning is easy and quick. But the app just doesn't work on my Kindle Fire HDX. I hope the developers fix the problem -- I'll give it 5 stars, then.

title: This is great!!!
review: I'm in 6th grade Italian, and have trouble focusing on class, and this really helps me catch up and get ahead of the rest of my class. This app helps you through not only correcting incorrect words but spelling too, and not many apps, like Rosetta Stone, so this!

review: Not liking it.Â  Too finicky.

review: Good app but it seems too bad that it doesn't include English to Greek. It has the reverse (Greek to English).

title: it was nice but i mostly use the computer
review: it was nice but i mostly use the computer. sadly after downloading i found out it dident have Japanese :(

title: Decent App
review: Very weak on realistic conversation, most other aspects are good

title: Great Until Its Not
review: I love this app, usually with language apps it's either hit or miss with most of them on the miss side. This app actually teaches you not only vocabulary but also grammar in a very concise step by step guide. I'd say it's almost like a mini Rosetta stone. My problem comes when I'm in the middle of a lesson and all of a sudden it goes back to the menu. I'm using kindle fire HDX so I don't know if that has something to do with it. It's incredibly annoying and frustrating when you have to do the same lesson five times because of crashes. I really enjoy this app, and it's actually helping me learn some Spanish but I'm going to be forced to stop if I can't move forward. Please fix this.

title: I'll come back to it

title: Italy !
review: Per favore,grazie!!! My husbands relatives are "fluent" in italian,. Dispiace. No.Â  FabulousÂ  app!!! Can'tÂ  believe its free!!! Ciao! Grazie!!

title: All-in-all Quite Pleased
review: It has been great so far. The speech recognition software is sensitive to background noise, so find a quiet space or waste a bit of time re - doing bits. I find the flexibility of the program preferable to a classroom setting. The email notifications are handy to keep me motivated, but they could be annoying to some people... mileage may vary.

review: Duolingo is an excellent supplemental tool for practice. I'm so glad it's available on Kindle Fire! Sometimes it lags a little, but that happens on the browser version too so it's not a big deal. I love Duolingo!

I like it because its a fun way to learn, but personaly, when I get a wrong answer, there is no explanation as to why my answer was wrong. Other than that, I like it, and its cool because I also have it in my cell.

review: App no longer works on my kindle.Â  it just keeps going back to the login screen every time.

title: overall good
review: This is a good app as a refresher for a language you are already familiar with. I've been studying Spanish for a long time and used this to brush up on my skills, but there are a couple things that I don't agree with grammatically. Also, they don't break down and explain things in the app.

title: I want to be more fluent in the Spanish language ...
review: I want to be more fluent in the Spanish language, but there is a problem with sounds.Â  The spoken language conflicts with the sound ofÂ  the Kindle.Â  If the volume increases or decreases, I do not hear the sentence.Â  Maybe there isÂ  a remedy for my particularÂ  problem, if so,Â  I'm willing to reassesthe program.

title: YO DUOLINGO PLEASE UPDATE YOUR APP
review: Multiple people are having the same problem as me, where they can't access their language learning because the app is out of date. This is so sad Alexa play Despacito.

title: Helped me to get an A in my college German class
review: Used this along with a college level German class. Got an A in the course, so I really think it was a plus. It was fun and did not seem like homework to use. My classmates talked about using it, but never got around to it, they missed out!

title: Mixed
review: Biggest issue I have with it isn't so much that I have trouble learning the languages (I don't), it's that it gives no platform or basis to draw from.Â  For example, I took three years of HS German and did a study abroad in Germany.Â  My German isn't good, mostly bar talk and what not.Â  So yeah, I have a basis to draw from and can "test out" of certain sections, but if I didn't know the difference between I, you, he, she, it, we, you, and they, I'd have trouble with conjugation with no help and I see this when trying the Spanish on here (I took none, and my vocab is limited to Taco Bell and Sesame Street).Â  It doesn't try to teach you the language so much as add a few words and repetition to what you already have.Â  Will I continue to use it?Â  yeah, cause I haven't found anything really good to help as an option.Â  Will I recommend this to learn a language? No.

title: Good app but will no longer open
review: This is the best app for learning languages, but unfortunately it is glitchy and will no longer let me sign in, even after I reinstalled it

title: It sticks with you, even if you don't realize it.
review: Very fun, the only reason I have issues in trying to actively recall words to speak it is because I don't have anyone to talk to. But any review I do with the app, the words are right there at the surface and I have no problem remembering. So it sticks with you.

title: No
review: No

title: Educational and Interesting
review: I've just started using this app, so am not bilingual - yet.Â  I've always wanted to learn French and now I have the chance to do so because it didn't cost an arm and a leg to get books, videos, DVD's, or cassette's.Â  I have a cassette French instructional aid, but realized I no longer own a cassette player so had been unable to use those tapes - my mother purchased them years ago and the tapes were left to me when she passed.Â  With this app I have the chance to finally learn French, and I greatly enjoyed working on lesson 1, although the description for the app did say if you got an answer wrong in the lessons it would not remove or take away any of your "hearts," and it did take one away from me when I had a typo.Â  Not sure how much the "hearts" will factor in as of yet, as I am still working on lesson 1.

title: do it everyday
review: I just started using this about a week ago, the app uses a variety of audio and visual learning techniques.Â  The weakest link in this product is the user.Â  If you use it every day and keep up with the lessons it helps.

title: nice pocketsize lessons
review: I love the small lessons that can be done in a few minutes per day, and also they say dumpling represents the lessons and it's great that we need to practice the new words before we get bombarded with new ones. But I'm disappointed that I'm still stuck on my first 9 words (after two weeks), this is starting to become boring...!

title: little difficult
review: Nouns, proper nouns and pronouns are very close to the same. Comments made by others makes this more confusing

title: I expected something totally different. I speak French and ...
review: I expected something totally different.Â  I speak French and am trying to get some of it back, as I do not use it very often.Â  This is only showing me things that I already know.Â  My mistake for not understanding that this really is for beginners.

title: Three Stars
review: I love the app! Just frustrated that I cant remove a language I chose by mistake.

title: AchieveÂ  a dream.
review: I've wanted to study German for years; but I could never afford the materials. Duolingo has made it possible for me to pursue something that I never thought I could accomplish. If learning another language is your dream this is the app for you!

title: Best language app I've found
review: Able to test out of lower levels and get to work on the lessons actually needed. Unlike other programs that tell you when your answer is incorrect, this program corrects mistakes and gives other correct options. I get to pick and choose what I most need to work on.

title: It is difficult to use for an advanced beginner and higher
review: I had heard so much about this app. I installed it and tried to use it for learning more Russian. My skills are around the intermediate area. I had to answer so many questions before I was at a level that was appropriate for me.Â  I wish that it allowed me to just jump over the beginner stuff.Â  I invested a lot of time just to begin to learn. You are able to answer a block of questions to move on, but you can make very few mistakes. I found it difficult and frustrating. I would think that it would have been difficult for me to learn Russian with no background because the grammar isn't really explained. This is important for Russian; in Romance languages maybe not so relevant. However I would recommend it if you can invest the time. I use it mainly for review.

title: Had a hard time finding Russian and it isn't a ...
review: Had a hard time finding Russian and it isn't a kindle app. Not overly impressed yet as using transliteration instead of a Cyrillic keyboard. Perhaps more MY issue that I am unable to switch between systems more rreadily.is between Cyrillic and English in the learning process. I may find Duolingo more manageable then.

title: Learn a language
review: I have been using Duolingo to learn German for more than a year, and it is a convenient way to learn a new language.Â  The apps make it easy to use Duolingo on your phone or tablet.Â  My biggest complaint is that they don't offer Japanese yet, so I had to find other places learn, and they are not as good, or they cost money.

title: conversation element
review: A conversation element would make Duolingo hard to beat. I have no idea how they could include it though.

title: Boringish
review: I like the app but you knowÂ  it's boring. Very boring

title: It's good app if you had some exposure to Spanish
review: So far .... ok.Â  However the speaker for Duolingo is too fast, too low and voice pronounciation is unclear. It's good app if you had some exposure to Spanish, then you can get through this app.

title: Same version across all devices please?
review: I absolutely love this app! The only problem is that the Kindle version and the iPhone version are not the same... I'm sure other people have the same issue as I do. For example, I'm learning Swedish but unfortunately every time I open the app on my Kindle it tells me that the language is unsupported and makes me choose a different one. I hope that the guys who do all the updating can fix this soon!

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use.Â  Just started, so not sure how effective it will be.

title: Great app!
review: This app teaches based on recall, using simple phrases and a few pictures.Â  I have been able to self-teach a few words in German already.Â  The only thing it's missing IMO is maybe a section on conjugation.Â  This app is a keeper.

title: Great app for learning a language
review: This app is intuitive and easy to use, and I've found it is a fun way to learn a language. I agree with someone else's review though that, at least for German (which I am re-learning) it helps to have at least aÂ basic knowledge of the language and I think it would be very difficult without that. But great app!

title: Wow, this app makes it FUN and SIMPLE to learn Spanish!!!
review: I have tried to learn Spanish several times without success until now!Â  Duolingo makes it so simple and natural to learn a second language.Â  I forced my daughter to try it one time and now she's hooked too!Â  Thank you Duolingo!

title: Helping me with French
review: I took it in High School.Â  I took another year in College.Â  I didn't use it.Â  I forgot it.Â  Now I can brush up on my forgotten skills.Â  It's fairly easy to use although having to switch between English and French keyboards is a bit of a pain.

title: Awesome FREE resource!!
review: This learning game is awesome. It remembers the words you have difficulty with... then uses them later in different lessons, until they stick with you. Waste no more time reading this review.. get studying!!

title: Should have been 4 1/2 stars
review: This is a great app. I would have given it 4 1/2 stars but I couldn't. The only thing wrong with it is the fact I just can't remember some of the content off the top of my head, but that's probably my problem

title: Fire Tablet unable to update
review: Works fine on other Androids but fire tablet fails to update it unable to use

title: Not for beginners.
review: I really like this app but it is NOT for beginners. I use it as a refresher but I would not recommend for someone is new to any language.

title: Fun Language App
review: I tried this on a whim because it was free. I didn't expect it to be so good. I think it is better than the Rosetta Stone Russian that I had been doing awhile back and stopped because I became frustrated because it would take awhile to figure out what I did wrong because they wouldn't tell me. When you make a mistake, this app tells you what you did wrong. The only problem I have is that I am doing it on the first generation Kindle Fire and it doesn't have an international keyboard as far as I know. I am doing German, since Russian is not offered yet on Duolingo, and I get some of the writing questions wrong because I don't use umlauts which I can't use because I don't have the keyboard.

title: Easy to use
review: This app is easy to use on my Kindle Fire. The only thing that can be a little annoying are the reminders on my phones email notification when I don't use it for a couple of days.

title: Better than Rosetta Stone
review: I was suspicious of Duolingo because it is free. But Wikipedia explained how they do it.Â  I have used Rosetta Stone before and now prefer Duolingo. If I was Rosetta Stone I would be be very worried.very worried.

title: Multiple Fluencies, now Polishing, then a Challenge
review: I graduated college with a semi fluency in Italian, having spent three summers honing the language in Italy and ended up with a Sardinian fiance. This was at the expense of my high school French. So now it's been almost 30 years.I have an American life partner who needs a language. My Italian is rusty, my French almost non existent, and my Greek eh is cosi cosi.This app is polishing my Italian.Â  When I graduate I'll start French and try to work on my Greek last. My stepson is hating Spanish, a language I've never been able to manage, that will be my 5th attempt. We shall see.My mom was resolutely single language American. Her mom spoke American, British English, Dutch and German. Her husband, my grandfather spoke British. My father was born somewhere on the spice caravan trail and had mastered 17 dialects and languages. I can only hope to become conversant in half.

title: One Star
review: App does not work on my Kindle Fire

title: So great!
review: I can not recommend this app enough!

title: Rating!!!
review: Didn't really want to submit a review, just wanted to give it 5 stars!!!

title: Less than impressed
review: I studied German in college many years ago.Â  I selected the Duolingo German option.Â  I found it difficult to clearly hear each word that was spoken.Â  Too bad that native speakers cannot say a word slowly and distinctly, then say it as in normal conversation.Â  Also, just beginning, I found strange situations.Â  The word for "boy" in German is "Der Knabe"..as a second choice "Der Junge".Â  Duolingo offers only the word "Der Junge"...which generally means "the youth"...and the article "Der" makes it male.Â  Maybe a little knowledge is not a good thing.I also found it very difficult to go where I wanted to in the program.

title: not bad..
review: It's just ok,Â  not bad... but at the same time not great. For free.....what do you expect?

title: It was kind of fun at first
review: I had to guess what the word meant, without them even telling me what it meant. And then getting it wrong.Â  It was kind of fun at first, but then, I got tired of guessing.

title: My brainiac friend helps my brain heal. :)
review: This is my baby right here. I started learning Italian after a severe stroke over three and a half years ago. It's really helped me with my recovery and memory issues.

title: fun and educational
review: It is simulations that run over and over until you get it correct. I had background in Italian already so it was more of a refresher. If you font have any background may be difficult to start but it allows you yo repeat until you get it right.

title: Not an app
review: This is not an app. It is just a shortcut to the duolingo website in the Silk browser. Very disappointing because the website is difficult to use in Silk.

title: So it was rockin' but now my kindle won't work ...
review: So it was rockin' but now my kindle won't work. No it is not due to this application, my kindle just died and it will not recharge or turn on.

title: Comparable to expensive programs
review: The program so far seems very similar to the expensive programs.Â  It has great review built in.Â  It has made my Kindle Fire freeze twice now.Â  I don't know if it is the program or my internet...which isn't the greatest.

title: Love Duolingo so much on every platform
review: Duolingo is incredible on every platform I've tried. As a linguist and language teacher, I can't recommend it enough.

title: Pictures not showing
review: Very difficult to introduce new vocab when pictures aren't working!

title: It will do.
review: Very good program, although, there is no help on the program if you have a question relating to your language. They have a help feature, but it is worthless.

title: Free no excuse not to learn a new language if you would like too!
review: No one could possibly go wrong with Duolingo!

title: Effective, but best with prior introduction to chosen language.
review: As other reviewers have stated, this app may not be ideal for learning a language without any prior knowledge of that language. This is due to a lack of grammatical instruction. However it is very useful as a refresher, or for those with a bare bones knowledge of a language. The only other con is the computer sounding voice that does not quite sound like a normal speaker. Overall I have found this app to work better for me than others I have tried.

title: Awesome
review: I got this app and started learning French with it. Because everything in French is masculine and feminine based I got confused. But then when I downloaded Duolingo that changed!

title: Two Stars
review: Makes you guess what words are before teaching you what they are. It's very frustrating.

title: works like a champ
review: Started w different app and found it cumbersome...Learning quickly...only reason for 4 star and not 5 is the app is set up to check spelling....and doesn't allow for minor errors...which makes you do session over if too many....

title: Great app and great support (was: no longer works on kindle fire)
review: The Kindle Fire OS 4.5.5 broke this app.Â  When I reported that on the duolingo site it was fixed in less than two hours and they got back to me with that update.The App itself is one of my favouritesÂ  and the Kindle is my favourite platform to use it on.I am very glad they still work together.

title: Freaking Awesome!
review: I've been using this app on my 7" Kindle Fire HD and my HTC One SV for approximately a week... maybe a week and a half now, and I absolutely love it!I'm using it to learn German... not sure what other language options there are, although I know Spanish and French are in there. So far I am hugely impressed. The app uses a combination of written, spoken, and visual cues/questions... so one question may ask me to translate a sentence from German to English, the next question might be to translate something from English to German, and the question after that may be to speak a sentence in German or to write a sentence in German that the app speaks (the app's voice is not great, but definitely serviceable)... reinforced occasionally by visual cues such as labeled pictures (i.e. a picture of a dude labeled "der Mann"... you get the idea after a bit).The teaching method works, I have to say... and this from a guy who always considered himself critically handicapped when it came to learning new languages.Â  Granted, I'm early into the program, but I am retaining a large part of each lesson, which is honestly more than I can say for my experience with Rosetta Stone.There are two cons that I've noted: First, and this may have been an individual problem, the app wouldn't let me sign in with either Google+ or Facebook... it has buttons for doing that, but they didn't work... so I had to go old-school and actually create a separate account.Â  Minor glitch, but still worth noting.Â  The second con is that in the course of the lessons, I haven't yet encountered a definitive explanation of certain rules of grammar, i.e. when to use one form or another of a verb. On one hand this is vaguely annoying, as I end up with wrong answers without being entirely certain why they're wrong; on the other hand, however, I suspect that this is actually increasing the effectiveness of the program, as this makes me really think about each word before I use it, and when I'm wrong, I really study WHY I was wrong, which ultimately increases retention of the language. So kudos for effectiveness, even if it is a bit annoying.Overall... freaking awesome.Â  Get this app.Â  I can't believe it's free, honestly, but as long as it is, get it!

title: Won't log me back in
review: The app no longer works for me. I'm not sure why but it won't log me back in

title: Its fine. But it only goes so far
review: Its fine.Â  But it only goes so far.Â  Seems to kind of dead end on you.Â  I was hoping for more.

title: it's adequate
review: I can't type special accented letters. But that has to do with me, I guess. The only downside for me is that it doesn't explain the grammar. At least not as far as I've gotten

title: It really helps you to learn vocabulary
review: This program is challenging and fun.Â  It teaches you the words and structures in repetitive exercises, but does not teachÂ  you "why" or what the rules are for the words.Â  It teaches the same way you learned as a child...by trial and error.Â  As you grew older, you were taught sentence structure, conjugation of verbs, etc, etc.Â  It can be frustrating not knowing why some words completely change meaning, or why a conjugation is not applicable in certain situations, but it is not bad.Â  I use this program on my computer and on my phone.Â  My phone has the option of checking your speach, but my computerÂ  program does not.Â  Over all, I like the program.

title: Umm needs a little something
review: I hear its good, but its not exactly great if a Japanese and Chinese course is not able to be taught from English to it. I guess I'll wait to try it. If they ever get the program from English to Japanese and Chinese.

title: Just started this program, but like it.
review: I like this program very much.Â  The program repeats any weak spots in your compression.Â  You listen to part of the lesson and say it back and then write a translation for short sentences. The program will continue to prompt you for words you use incorrectly.

title: Addictive, but fun
review: Warning! Extremely addictive.Â  Our whole family is hooked on it now.

title: Very good practice
review: It helps a lot to practice. It does evaluate wrong sometimes, however, it motivates you to keep it up.

title: Five Stars
review: If you consistently do the exercises you can't help but learn!

title: Constant renewals to play the game are intensely annoying..
review: Constant renewals to play the game are intensely annoying....even more annoying are the correct answers that are marked incorrect.

title: Good for review
review: It's no Rosetta Stone, nor is it a textbook.Â  It'll tell you when you're wrong, but it won't explain why.Â  Better as a review than for learning a language for the first time.

title: I like the idea... don't like the program
review: I never got past signing in... I didn't want all my Facebook friends to be exploited by releasing the program to use my info/friends... nor did I haveÂ  a picture that I wanted to load.Â  It wouldn't let me sign in w/o one or both.Â  I give!Â  I won't use it!

title: Good while it worked
review: It was a good supplement to my Spanish class until it stopped working (on my phone) on level 14. No response from duolingo. Can't reinstall. It just stopped for no reason.

title: And the microphone feature is not the best. I'll say it correctly but it dings me ...
review: I'm learning, but sometimes it tests you on words it hasn't taught yet. And the microphone feature is not the best. I'll say it correctly but it dings me anyway.

title: Fun and educational
review: One of my favorite ways to kill time. Me and my husband compete to see who has the higher score.

title: Thorough, fun, and easy
review: I can't believe it's free and has no annoying ads! It's the perfect complement to my conversational Spanish class.

title: This is not a good app for children who can't read or who are ...
review: This is not a good app for children who can't read or who are early in their reading development.

title: Good basic Spanish tutor.
review: Good way to pick up some of the basics.Â  The speech recognition is a bit touchy but that's about the only negative for me.Â  Could be my equipment.

title: si, si senor
review: I am having a ball! Unfortunately, my kindle fire keyboard doesn't have the line that goes above the n letter, so I always get anything including that marked as an incorrect answer. Bummer!

title: Good fun for free!
review: I am attempting to learn Spanish.Â  I am 67 years old, so this may take a while.Â  I thought Duolingo would an easy way to learn another language, until they threw in some Spanish grammar. It is not just conversational Spanish, but real life language.Â  Even if there is aÂ  disagree with translations, a drop down box allows a message can be sent to disagree with the translation.Â  Just the other day, my translation to a sentence was added as another way to translate the statement.

title: A Fun Way to Learn!

title: Brushing up on my language skills

So I thought to skip the basics and start of with the phrases. However, I could not understand the teacher's French accent. Maybe because I learned French in Holland, even though I spent every summer for six years in southern Belgium and one summer in Paris. To make a long story short, I had to start with the basics to get used to the teacher's voice and accent. Now about the app. I am happy I downloaded it, and working rapidly through the lessons. It is a great program, but I am not sure if the microphone on my Kindle Fire HDX is working or not, when it asks for pronunciation of the phrases. I'll have to figure that out later. I will add to my review later on some more, after I finish all the lessons. I plan to brush up on German next, and will check out what other languages I can learn.

title: THUMBS UP DUOLINGO!
review: Its one of the best ways to learn korean,because you have to learn all the words in one level to move onto the next,it has 4 hearts so when you get 4 things wrong you die and then you have to start over,so you learn by repeating.The only thing is that once you download it you have to download a korean keyboard for youre kindle fire,dont worry thats available on the kindle,because the game asks you to type words in korean sometimes in order to move onto the next level,very good graphics and the words come with pictures. PS:If you dont have patience this is NOT the game for you.
I've been wanting to learn Spanish and French for a while now and this app no t only tells you how to spell and translate the writing but also how to pronounce the word

title: Love it!
review: I am learning Spanish on Duolingo and I love it. It starts right from the beginning with very basic words but it does allow you to skip sections if you already know them. It allows for the fact that there may be more than one way of saying something and will mark you correct if you give any correct answer.Â  It doesn't mark you wrong for forgetting accents, although it does remind you when you get it wrong. You can report mistakes so the site/app is constantly improving. There is a discussion feature so that if you are confused about an answer you can see what other people have said about it. Often they give very detailed answers about Spanish grammar and about specific countries or situations where you would use words or phrases. The units are short so if you only have 5 minutes to spare you can complete one no problem. The only thing that is slightly inconvenient is that you have to be connected to the internet. If you have no wifi then it won't work.

title: Not good for beginners
review: I would not recommend this app for anyone who doesn't already have a basic understanding of the language they're trying to learn. It does not teach you grammar, conjugation, or sentence structure, it only teaches you vocabulary and expects you to already know the rest. I took French in both High school and college, so I have a basic understanding. If I didn't have that, this app would be useless. If you're just trying to review or keep things fresh in your mind this app will work for you.

title: Does not even sign me in.
review: I used Duolingo for a while, but then I stopped. I don't remember why. It was an AWESOME app, and I loved how it was set up, and everything about it.Â  Recently, I decided to start using it again. I still had it in my Amazon fire. I completed a few lessons offline, and it said I had to go online to do more.Â  I turned on the Wi-Fi on my fire, and it signed me out of Duolingo! I tried to sign in, but it wouldn't let me. I in installed th app, and reinstalled it. It still would not let me sign in.This was about a week ago. I still have the app on my Fire, although I will probably uninstall it.I HATE to give an app anything but a five star reveiw unless it is ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY. This, I felt was.So, to whoever reads this reveiw, please do not look at the rating and think " oh, this is a bad app. It's not worth downloading"It is, and if it is fixed i will edit my review.Duolingo is an amazingÂ  program. Download it on another app store , or use it online.It was an amazing app before it crashed.

title: Great app

title: I Wish I Could Give It Five Stars, But...
review: I love this app a lot. It has helped me very much to learn a new language, but it has an annoying flaw. I am using a Kindle Fire HDX, and it has already frozen on me 3 times in the first day. I have to restart my device just to fix it. It is amazing for teaching languages, but it needs a new update to fix the problem.

title: The VERY BEST language learning app!
review: I have had two years of French in school and used virtually every language program available. Here are my critiques:Rosetta Stone...didn't like that because it didn't present the material in a way that appealed to me or that stuck with me. Also, it frustrated me as it seemed disorganized and a backwards approach. Plus it's expensive. At least $400Â  for entire program. Pimsleur: it is pretty good actually. The one drawback to Pimsleur is that I sometimes can't understand exactly what they are saying, even after having two years of the language under my belt,Â  therefore, you don't get the concept of how the language is organized. Plus it is expensive. The pro to it though is that you can listen to the audio in your car or while cleaning house or jogging.FrenchPod: pros: you can download audio files to listen to wherever you are. The speakers haveÂ  a natural French dialog and then go over it bit by bit and explain the various uses of the words. You can alsodownload workbook pages to refer to.Cons: There us an extremely limited list of lessons, all of which are around 6 sentences to dissect. Also, there is no practice, either speaking or writing.Textbooks: Difficult. Boring.DuoLingo: pros:Â  you get to hear the audio spoken at a natural speed. Then you can slow it down so you can pick up on each word as it is enunciated. You are immersed in the language by having to type out, which forces you to remember placement of nouns and verbs etc.Â  It is formatted sort of like a game, so it doesn't feel much like work, and it is actually quite addictive. It's totally FREE! No ads either.Cons: it can get frustrating if you get an answer wrong because you miss points, so like with any "game," you might get frustrated if you're that serious about game points.I have learned FAR more with this app in 6Â  months than I EVER learned in all my previous years using other methods! It's fun and free and best of all...it works!!

title: Impossible to access if you're already on Rosetta Stone
review: I've tried to access it, and the websites for both Amazon and RS are unhelpful in overcoming this particular hurdle.Â  I find this particularly annoying because I just got an e-mail from RS telling me if I didn't pay another $65 for the next 9 months, I'd lose my valuable ability to access RS from my Kindle.Â  When I try to log in from the Kindle, it prompts me for a password that I never set up on the RS DVDs.Â  It doesn't give me any chance to create a new password or reset one.Â  Yet it won't let me create a new account because my email address is already in the system.Â  It may be a good way to lure more customers to the full service, but absolutely useless as a "perk" for people who've already paid for the full course and want a way to access on the go.Â  I don't know whether to blame Amazon or RS moreâbut somebody fell down on the job.

title: Makes Learning a New Language Easy
review: Rosetta Stone really does make learning a new language easy and feels quite natural.The Kindle ap is excellent for learning the sounds, understanding the spoken and written word of a new language.The only real downside I've noted deals with keeping track of plurals, special rules, feminine versus .masculine or neuter and first person, second person, third person usages.Â  These are there and they are practiced but they are not clearly explained.Â  A great deal must be inferred.Â  But then, this is the natural way our babies learn their languages as well.Â  None the less, after the first few sections, I did pick up an inexpensive grammar book to answer and clarify some of these questions.By the way, Rosetta Stone is NOT free, only the mobile interface application is free.Â  ButÂ  I did not expect Rosetta Stone to be free.Â  It's a well designed, well presented study program.Â  I wouldn't expect this level of quality to be free.

title: Only level 1 is free!
review: A bit of false advertising it's not free. You get the first level free that is all. Good program except for that and the writing section wasn't available for Kindle. The Kindle microphoneworked great (I forgot it even had a microphone!) The link to purchase doesn't work so I don't know how much it is. I searched Amazon and didn't see a Kindle version. I think you have to buy the computer version and then you can log on using your Kindle after you do that. It's like $300 (and that is them claiming it is 50 percent off!) That is just insane!Â  Who can afford that?! Get your act together Rosetta Stone and charge a reasonable amount and make it so you don't have to buy the computer version in order to use the Kindle to use the app. oh also I had no idea what it wanted me to do when the app first started(after making the account) it had two pictures of people saying hola (Spanish version), it wanted me to say hola. But there was no instructions to do so. A couple of episodes were like that with no instructions if you were supposed to tap on the picture or repeat the words. It took a few times to figure out what it wanted me to do.

title: Log In Issues?
review: Like others, I couldn't log in with my paid account. I believe I mistakenly did download the free app before I developed my account online through the PC version. So I uninstalled the app after I used the PC version for awhile as the app still didn't let me log in. That did the trick. Works great now. I actually prefer it over the PC version. I can take it anywhere and don't have to wear the headset that makes my ears sore. Also, on the PC version I have problems with my pronunciation being picked up clearly over the net.Â  In listening to the playback, it often sounds garbled and cuts out, therefore the program counts it as an error. This is not NOT an issue with the Kindle Fire app. Make sure you have the Kindle Fire HD or the app program is NOT compatible.Â  Loving the app.

title: Will Not Work On The New Kindle Fire HDX
review: Rosetta Stone is a great learning tool. I have subscribed to the online course for over a year now and my French has improved dramatically. However the Rosetta Course App is awful. Itâs only designed for Android Operating Systems and is incompatible with the OS on the new Kindle Fire HDX. The app will crash everytime the program tries to load after I sign in. I wish I would have known that prior to purchasing my new Kindle Fire, for being able to learn on the go was the primary reason I even purchased the new Kindle.Â  I contacted the Rosetta Stone Tech Department regarding this issue back in January and was in contact with someone there throughout the first 3 months of 2014. The issue was resolved in late March 2014 when there was an update on the App that made it work with the new Kindle Fire. I was able to use the app finally and was very happy. However Rosetta Stone continued to make updates to the App and now itâs back to not working. Iâm able to put in my username and password and then it will just crash on the load screen. I tried multiple times to uninstall and redownload the app to see if it will work, but it always does the same thing. I tried the App on my friends Kindle Fire HDX and again the same issue, the App wonât even load properly. This is a rip off! I tried contacting the Rosetta Stone Tech Department several times, was on the phone with them for hours, and I either got hung up on or had e-mails that were not returned for days or even weeks at a time. Considering how much Iâm paying for this each month this is downright unacceptable. Very unhappy with this app and with Rosetta Stoneâs tech department at the moment.

It is highly unethical wording considering the impulsive and instant method of payment on a phone or kindle. If you had not checked the website separately from the app, you would have no idea.

On the concept, I found the language learning part very 'baby' like, ie not providing much context (at all) assuming you learn by repeating sentences or words. That is a matter of preference what model you prefer for language learning. My biggest issue is the lack of proper design thinking and software quality for the mobile app

title: The learning material is good and there is a lot of it BUT ...
review: The learning material is good and there is a lot of it, but there are serious issues with the software that delivers it.The application will hang and crash from time to time.The 'Milestones' are terribly buggy and you have no idea what is expected of you. And you can't turn them off in the options, so the system keeps taking you back to them. Also you can't skip them promptly either.You can turn of the spelling questions at least, which you can't do in Babbel (yet).Some of the pictures are outright confusing (although you soon learn them) - and who thought to put white speech bubbles on a white background? Its sometimes impossible to tell who is meant to be speaking.My windows laptop and kindle fire HD do NOT synchronise - some reviews here state they do but I couldn't get it work.On the upside the speech recognition is good (That is probably the one part they didn't program).

title: Not Quite Satisfied
review: This is sort of an unfair review of TED Talks the Conference Provider (5 Stars - Controversial and enlightening). This is a review of the TED App and mechanism (Fire TV) used to watch TED Talks.I downloaded the TED App onto my Fire TV box. I have been enjoying the Curiosity Stream Videos just fine. However, when I tried the TED App I would get constant interruptions to download - because of "Network Error".I ran an experiment to eliminate various variables to reception. I used my desktop computer (intel i7 -fast) also wireless on the 5 GHz band as my Fire TV Box with 128G Memory Upgrade for Buffering, both in the same room. Both also on a 5 MBPS twisted pair internet provider feed (bandwidth concern). My PC with some video fades watched the same TED Talk all the way through without loading pauses.This leads me to conclude that there needs to be work on the TED App as far as the algorithm used for compression. Older U Tube videos also had the same issues.Â  And Yes I do need a Fiber Backbone upgrade for Bandwidth when it is available too.

title: TED App Seemingly Ungraceful With Variable Bandwidth
review: I love watching TED. I used to watch it on Netflix, but I watched them all and Netflix is slow to update their list. So I began to watch it on Youtube and playback was flawless, but the user interface for YT on the Fire TV Stick is not comprehensive enough that you can't read the descriptions. Now for the TED app on Fire TV Stick: nice interface, nice playlists, horrible playback. At best, streaming stutters (freezes and plays), at worst it stops playing or locks up all together. I would have to relaunch TED app to continue watching the talks. It is aggravating not being able to watch TED talk from beginning to end without the stopping. Oh and I forgot to say that once it freezes and continues playing, the spinning circle on the middle of the screen doesn't go away. GRRRR. It is necessary to stop playback and resume (sometimes that works) but at other times I have to quit the app and relaunch. Before you say, "your problem is your poor bandwidth", I say that condition might be true but after trying to watch TED on the TED app, I can follow that by play several TED talks in a row on YT with no problem. I think the TED app doesn't handle fluctuating bandwidth gracefully and the developers were too quick to publish the app. The TED app needs improving.

title: Waste of time
review: I think the show is one of the most ridiculous things I've ever seen . I've watched several episodes to trying figure out the purpose of it and all I can conclude is that it consists of "famous" people wanting to hear themselves talk and try to be experts on things they know very little about. One's personal experience does not an expert make .Â  Don't bother responding to my opinion as I'm not interested in yours;Â  simply because you're not an expert on me and what I know . I'm just trying to spare people from wasting their time . If you really want to learn about something , don't listen to one person talk about it , do the research yourself . The Internet has a plethora of information so that you can be well-informed with varied views and be able to form your own opinion which is more important than all of the hot air hacks on this show.

title: GreatÂ  idea...poor execution
review: I"ve installed this app on my Galaxy S2 phone & my android tablet.Â  On both devices it crashes when I try to open a folder in my recipe box.Â  Left feedbackÂ  weeks ago with developers, and they said they are aware of problem.Â  Installed new update hoping for a fix, but problem still exists.Â  I got the App hoping to have access to my favorite recipes while shopping, unfortunatelyÂ  to do thatÂ  I have to go through the hassle ofÂ  searching the whole website instead of just looking in my recipe box.Update 1/22/14Well the latest fix has come out, unfortunately it fixed nothing.Â  On both of my devices it crashes as soon as you try and log into the recipe box.Â  It is a nothing more than a glorified Website shortcut! I read about how it won't work if you installed it through Amazon, so I uninstalled it and reinstalled through The Play Store, no difference.Â  This app has serious failings; if you think you can use it for anything more than just recipe surfing you are likely to be seriously disappointed!

title: Needs improvement on all platforms
review: Let me start by saying that I have the iOS version, which is installed on both my iPhone and iPad.Â  It was as five-star app for a while, until iOS 7 was released.Â  I think they released one update that made it compatible with 7, but it came with an annoying bug - it makes you log in EVERY SINGLE TIME you want to access your recipe box, even though I had the "keep me logged in" thing checked off.Â  Very annoying.Â  I let the app developers know about this, they say they are aware of it, and it will be fixed in the next update.Â  This was months ago, I am still waiting for that update.When I saw that the Kindle Fire version was free (I paid $1.99 for the iOS version), I decided to give it a try and see if I can use it and avoid the log in issue.Â  That part worked.Â  What DOESN'T work is inside the recipe box itself.Â  When I tap on one recipe, it takes me to a completely different recipe.Â  It's not like I tapped the one next to it by mistake; it takes me to recipes that aren't even next to the one I tapped on.Â  This makes the whole recipe box feature almost useless; what is the point of having it if you can't quickly access the exact recipe you want?Â  Apps like this are supposed to make life easier, but this one in any form is more hassle than it is worth.Â  Maybe I'll try it again, if they EVER update it.Â  I'm not holding my breath waiting for that, though.Â  It's actually easier now to just go to foodnetwork.com on my device, log in there, and access my recipe box that way.

review: When I found this app I was excited. The possibility of finding some of 'Chopped' recipesÂ  made the decision easy-despite some of the reviews.When I opened the file for the 1st chef (Aaron Sanchez) I happily scanned about 80 recipes with no noticeable repeats. Same results when I opened the file for AlexandraÂ  - no obvious repeats. Then the problems began. I am unable to open the file for any other chef - the app crashes as soon as I make a selection.The good part is - all of the recipes are there; I can get to all of the recipes through the collections (TopicsÂ  and Ultimate Comfort Food), but I haven't found a way to sort the recipes in the folders making it more difficult to do more than browse the 21000 + recipes available.I have installed this app on my Kindle Fire HD and Samsung Galaxy, Soon to be removed.BTW - never found Chopped recipes, the primary reason for grabbing app!

The entire lawsuit was bogus. IMHO, an attention seeking grab by the person who sued her.Everyone makes mistakes and has to live with the consequences and I'm not saying Paula handled the whole thing well but I think she was kind of in shock and just reacted. Remember, she was agoraphobic at one time and her emotional reaction is typical of that type of disorder.Again, shame. I'll not watch Food Network again, buy any of it's merchandise or have anything to do with any chef affiliated with them. Doing what's right should never be an issue.

review: No cut and paste.Â  No reformatting.Â  It'll be there when you want it.Did you modify it when you made it?Â  Easy editing too.The search even works.Â  Title, an ingredient you have, even the cooking method.Â  You'll find it easily.Thanx C.T.

title: Awesome App for Collecting Recipes
review: SUMMARY: I have used from Thanksgiving planning through to New Year's. Wonderful! I have never found an app of any kind worth the price of a "full version" or subscription, but I will be subscribing to the full version of Chef Tap.PROS: First and foremost, extremely accurate on big name sites, and surprisingly accurate on smaller sites (see "Testing Accuracy" below). Between the clipping and recipe sizing features alone, this app is amazingly handy.There is also an easy editing feature that allows you to make it your own, as well as a notes section if you want to leave the original unsullied. I like the ability to tag and synch, but haven't played with them much.TESTING ACCURACY: I clipped 75+ recipes fromÂ  about a dozen different "big name" sites (Betty Crocker, BHG, Tablespoon, All Recipes, etc) and a half dozen or so from smaller blogging sites (Home-ec101, Acadian Table, etc). I double-checked both the ingredient and instructions on every single clip.Bottom line, the accuracy of the app is tied to how "well-formed" the source website is.Here's what I found...1. One error on a big name site - a recipe missing its last step.2. Several errors on small blogging sites - missing or duplicate ingredients or steps.2. One annoyance - several recipes that had numbered steps were missing the numbers (not the content, just the number itself). This is a step above cosmetic, because it happened almost every time, even on well-formed sites.3. A few rare, random "cosmetic" issues - duplicate titles, bad line breaks, or random bolding.However, all errors can be corrected with the editing mode. In addition, because the link is included in the clip, you can go back later in case you think something is missing.CONS:Together, the following cons mean I am frustrated every time I try to use the app. If it were not so accurate and useful, this would be enough to make me delete it and move on to something else:1. Takes too long to load - my devices are fast overall, with this app being noticeably longer loading on all of them.2. Loads back to it's "home" location instead of back to the recipe I was last looking at. By the time it opens and I remember what recipe I was going to look at, I have forgotten why.3. Synching across devices is confusing, but I suspect that is due to the limitations on the free version.

title: I USED to love this app
review: Up until today, I rated this app as 4 or 5 stars.Â  I loved it for my Kindle Fire and started using it almost exclusively when cooking.Â  Today, however, when I went to open my recipes, it wouldn't open.Â  Instead, it showed a message saying that all my recipes were there waiting for me and I could see them just as soon as I upgraded the app!I had already decided that I didn't want to upgrade because I had seen that the upgrade changed the permissions, adding some more chancy ones that I saw no need for.Â  So now they are holding my recipes hostage unless I upgrade to the new permissions!This wouldn't be so bad if all I had in there were recipes I'd imported from the net, but there were several I'd developed myself and I really hate to lose them.Â  But I also don't like giving into blackmail.Update 11/25/12 - I've upgraded my review from 2 to 3 stars. The company was responsive to our dislike of some of the permissions and backed off a bit and I gave in and upgraded because I really like this app.Â  I love having all my recipes with me on my Kindle Fire and not having to print recipes from the net when I want to use them. NICE!I DO NOT like the ads they've added.Â  I understand they need to make money, but personally, I would rather just pay for the app than have the ads. This and concern about permissions is why I still rate this app as 3 rather than 5 star.

title: Useful and user-friendly app
review: I've binders full of recipes that I've printed off over the years - now replaced by Cheftap. I can quickly download recipes from websites and paste into Cheftap. Recipes generally come across with the photos but if they don't, it's easy to copy and paste the photo into the recipe. The categories feature is really useful - you can assign each recipe to any number of user defined categories so it's really easy to find the recipe you want. Only one small complaint is that it doesn't import the nutritional information for the recipe though I suppose I could manually add this to the imported recipe.

title: Get Rid of "Night Mode"
review: Not a bad little game. Certainly more interesting then some of the other building games that you just click and wait and get pestered to spend cash on things to make the time go faster. Big plus that at least so far it has remained freeplay. My only reason for 3 stars? Night Mode. Seriously guys. I don't know whose bright idea this was, but get rid of it. You put a "flashlight" you move around with you finger over pieces you swap with the same movement. You guys never noticed in development that this causes you to waste your limited moves with unintended swaps because you were trying to look at the board?Â  What's even worse is when the flashlight gets stuck off screen at the bottom on full screen puzzles because you tried to look at the bottom row and you can't move it anywhere else to try and finish the puzzle and end up wasting more moves trying to swipe it back upwards. Useless and frustrating feature to an otherwise good game. Fix it or just get rid of it

title: Freemium Trash
review: This is a perfect example of 'freemium' trash. They know no one will buy their game out right so they make it 'free' so we all bite. They even give us free 'premium currency' which runs out all too fast. Then we either get pissed off at the slow pace of the game and quit (at no loss to the developers) or we break out our wallet (their dream). Wanting our money they do e everything to get us addicted and then they have it programmed. When we run low on our freebie premium currency all the quest items refuse to drop. Meaning you'll want to throw them $5 here or there just to be able to complete a collection and move on. Its disgusting. A game should either be free in entirety or pay to access. None of this teasing fremium crap.

I hit the pay wall on all the fixers needed to complete collections. Without collections I can't defeat the curse block, which locks out my advancement of the game. Furthermore, after many hours of play I only have 4 locations to play 3 have maxed out until experience level is achieved. In one case I will have to play through three more exp levels before moving up to new screens, which means many more hours on the same screens. The ramping calcs are bad. BUYER BEWAREð ðµð¤

title: Unimpressive, Badly Designed Match 3 Games
review: First, let me just say that this game hounds you to spend real money more than any other game I've played. It even makes spending money a quest, which is laughable. Problem is, it's just not that good.Basically, it's just a bunch of fairly simple match 3 games wrapped up in a Egyptian era package. You play to collect food, building supplies and money to expand your town in a completely structured fashion. Your energy is very limited, an everything you do is dictated almost entirely by the game. In fact, the constant interruptions by the game are nothing short of annoying.The biggest problems I have with this game (other than it constantly asking for money and not allowing for any creativity from the player) mainly have to do with the match 3 games themselves. If you finish in fewer moves than allotted, you don't receive any materials for matches made with your leftover moves, which is stupid. Also, the new items do not fall straight down when matches have been made, which means you cannot play this game strategically. Without strategy, it's down to luck (or, more accurately, money) rather than skill, and if you fail a level because you get an unlucky board, you get nothing.All in all, it feels like a scam. Games such as this one that penalize players for their own flawed design should probably be avoided.

title: One Star
review: I would put no star's, if I was aloud. It would not load into my kindle HD.

title: Small annoyances that add up to big aggravation
review: Let me preface this by saying that there's a lot this game gets right.Â  Graphics are gorgeous, sound is very good, concept is intriguing, and the story is meaty without being overdone.But the aggravation in CoE is greater than the sum of its minor annoyances.First up, it's Match 3, and so there are times when you're going to be left with squares near the top of the board that can only be matched with a lucky drop.Â  By itself, it's a minor annoyance, but that's the nature of Match 3.But then, after you pass the level, there's a chance you may not even find the object you're questing for.Â  You read that right:Â  even if you DO get past a level, you may still come away empty-handed.Â  True, you'll always get SOMETHING after a completed level; but whether or not that "something" is of any actual value, well...An example:Â  I'm looking for one specific charger that I need to finish a main story quest.Â  I've been searching where the game sends me for TWO DAYS at this point, and that ONE little item that I need, just flat-out REFUSES.Â  TO.Â  SHOW.Â  UP.Â  Again, by itself, it's a minor annoyance; low drop rates for quest items aren't unheard of.Â  But a low drop rate for quest items on the back end, after I've already had to deal with enough of a luckfest in the upfront game, adds up the annoyance in a hurry.But the topper is that it's energy-based, and you can only make so many attempts before having enough energy to take another atttempt.Â  This one item I'm looking for, is in an area that takes 11 energy; at three minutes per energy unit, that means a 33-minute cooldown if I run out.Â  By itself, it's a minor annoyance; energy meters are almost a fact of life in high-end FTP's.Â  But when you add it to the other two...Let me put this as succinctly as I can.Â  By itself, I have no issue with losing a Match 3 level to an unlucky late-stage drop.Â  By itself, I understand quest items can be hard to find.Â  By itself, I get that energy meters are the price of FTP gaming.Where I take issue, is having to wait half an hour or more, to play the same area for the twentieth time, hoping that I don't get jobbed by an unlucky drop at the end of the level, in order to, MAYBE, find a quest item that may not even show up.Individually, those are all minor annoyances.Â  In combination, though, the whole of the aggravation is much worse than the sum of the minorly annoying parts.

title: Overpriced Blood & Guts Game that Really is Not that Unique
review: OK, game developers need to eat, pay bills, and etc.Â  You can't expect their games to be truly free.Â  Thus, you really can't expect to play an online game without paying for it.Â  SO, the real question is 'how much does the game cost?'Obviously, some games are more expensive than others.Â  The best games are usually pricey.Â  BUT you should not expect an online game to be extortionate.Unfortunately, MOBILE STRIKE is the second most costly game I played on a mobile device.Â  (The Walking Dead No Man's Land is definitely the most grossly overpriced mobile game ever.)If you have more money than brains, MOBILE STRIKE is your choice.HOWEVER, other games similar to Mobile Strike are definitely more affordable....which leads to my last point.MOBILE STRIKE does have some unique features and twists...but mobile war games are as common as fleas on a dog in Spring.Â  MOBILE STRIKE is that not special.Â  It's Arnold's face that makes it stand out....which is not a reason to get sucked into a money pit.

title: Fun at first, but...
review: I have played the game about 9 months now. The social aspect is fun, and battling can be fun, however the shameless greed of the developers is ridiculous, and now with their recent introduction of headquarters level 22 costing $1,000 initially, the game has gone and censored keywords in chat. Words like protest, and boycott because those who are even the biggest of spenders are fed up with the greed. I mean, why would an American based company not even allow its valued customers to exercise their first amendment rights?!I suggest if you play this game that you only spend if you can afford to throw tens of thousands of dollars away, because you can never actually do anything in real life with your virtual army.

title: Dead Game
