title: TERRIBLE STREAMING
review: I used this to watch Champions League and Europa League Live Soccer.I have NO PROBLEM at all streaming such as Prime Video or Netflix, however connectivity for your product was really really really bad.Quite often during the game itself I would get messages that my bandwidth was low, did I want to keep watching. Answering Yes allowed me to continue with reduced picture quality...HOWEVER THE WORST PROBLEM I HAD WAS DURING "PRE-GAME", "POST-GAME" AND "HALF-TIME".....Every few minutes I would be watching studio people talking, or advertisements, and the screen would go blank, eventually coming up with an error message that the video was not currently available.At this point I hit the OK button on the error message, and the button to re-connect to the game.Often I had to repeat that at least 5 or 6 times before I finally saw the people talking (or the ads), but sure enough a few minutes later the connectivity was lost again.Â  It was extremely frustrating and annoying !!!!!!

title: CBS sports app is much better on the Roku
review: CBS sports app is much better on the Roku. I downloaded for my fire stick and could not find the content I was seeking. In particular, I was attempting to find the crossfit games that were streaming live. On the Roku, that choice was in the very middle of the home screen of the CBS sports app. On the fire stick, there was a bunch of content that was available. I think it was all prerecorded rather than live. I attempted to browse on the fire stick and could not find anything except major sport categories such as football.So much room for improvement.

The audio was multiple seconds behind the video which made it difficult because entire sentences where spoke before I actually heard them.Â  I thought maybe if I restart that would clear it up. Sadly no. The app was bad enough I just went ahead and used my over the air antenna instead. I wanted this app to work well. But it did not. I cannot recommend it at this time as a result. I suggest steer clear of this application. It was made available for the superbowl and failed.

title: The worst of the worst TV apps for me.
review: Shows me the schedule, but will not play any video. It does not even show signed of loading or trying. I press and I press and nothing. I gave up and just decided it was easier to watch highlights on ESPN than try to get this app to work. Not sure why 99% of TV apps are garbage, but maybe it's because these companies are unable to understand that people don't watch live television during primetime hours anymore. Maybe one day they will realize it's not 1950. This is a main critique on my iPhone. Using my firestick, there's no live sports options at all. I'm only showing highlights and schedule.

title: Completely useless on FireTV devices
review: This is two different apps depending on the device, so pay attention to the app description above to see if you'll be one of the 5 star or the 1 star folks. On phones and tablets it is a full featured app with live streaming and things like bracket challenges. On the Fire TV devices it's a horribly useless app where you can only stream seemingly random clips from different shows, but no live streaming. This makes one of the most useful use cases (streaming the live game that is being preempted by a game running late) for TV devices a no-go. It's not like this is a premium paid channel, so blocking from streaming while freely broadcasting makes literally no sense.

title: Never Works & All About Gambling

When it actually works, there seems to be only one host, a Greek guy who just gives gambling information as to every game, and the book-makers are the main guests. This is the sleaziest garbage sports network I have ever seen. A waste of money on every level, and a major disappointment from CBS.

review: 5-13-19 -- New update.Â  Don't get it.Â  Can't get my local programming anymore (Fox Sports Wisconsin).Â  Says I have to go to the Fox Sports Go App to do so.Â  That's great, but that's what this app is.Â  Horrible, horrible update.Â  Needs to be rescinded.Â  I have to watch on my computer now because the app for the Fire TV Stick is now junk.Â  Very disappointed and upset.

title: Why is this all of a sudden FOX SPORTS
review: This changed from Fox Sports Go to Fox Sports on my fire stick. Cant watch any local channels on this app and it was extremely difficult to find the actual Fox Sports go app. IF you search Fox Sports Go, this app pops up. Also has Fox Sports Go picture. Very Frustrating

title: Still Need to Utilize Cable Provider
review: Still have to login to your cable provider to access.Â  Doesn't help to "cut the cable cord".

title: Still does not work on Amazon Fire
review: I made the mistake of updating the foxsports app without reading reviews; now it (the foxsports app) will not load any content. It tries, then gives the "oops there is an error" with the options to try again or go back. No amount of 'try again' will work.For the skeptics, yes I have tried: signing out then back in again, uninstalling the app (and clearing all data stored), reinstalling and starting over, sign in/activate. Each time the same result.It simply does not work with amazon Fire. It does still work on Apple tv and on my Ipad (same account).So that tells me Amazon is part of the problem here. Or simply remove the app if it does not work.

title: Update to Fire TV version no longer Fox Sports Go
review: This app was updated today. It no longer functions as Fox Sports Go. I can no longer receive the regional Fox Sports Southwest channel nor view sports broadcasting on my local Fox channel. Do not update your Fox Sports Go app.

title: FOX: fix the FF and REV!
review: App only lets you FF or REW in 10 second increments.Â  And it must buffer each and every time, which takes a few seconds... So you only jump a few seconds at a time.Â  You cannot scroll forward or reverse.Â  You must hit the button over and over again.Â  EXCRUCIATING!Â  Also, if you hit the BACK button by mistake, you go back to menu and you MUST start the broadcast from the beginning!Â  No RESUME at the spot you left, you must not skip forward in 5 seconds increments, over and over and over and over.Â  Come on FOX, this is totally unacceptable.Â  A sophomoric attempt at a streaming app.

title: Do not do the May update for this app!
review: I don't know what they did in the latest update, but I can't access my local programming anymore. It defaults to the same 3 channels. It then tells you to go to Fox Sports Go to see your local sports, but that's kind of the point of the app, right??Â  Anyway, they need to fix this. What a terrible, flawed update. It looks nearly identical to the U/I of Xfinity. I guess I'll just use my laptop to watch local games instead.

title: Used to love this app. Now it's worthless.
review: New update to both fox apps have caused the error "no internet connection".All other apps work.If I let it sit I can hear live streaming audio playing in the background.A reinstall did not fix the problem.A reset of the fire stick did not fix the problem.

title: Where's the 4K NFL?
review: Latest app update states that 4K is available for NFL however when watching yesterday, there was no 4K available.Â  4K works fine on AppleTV, but still does not work on the FireTV app even though it's advertised that it does.What's new in version 3.20.0Â  * 4K live streaming is here! Watch NFL, MLB, MLS, college football games and more in 4K UHD when available.

title: Deleted within 48 hours
review: Got this as a backup for the super bowl. I get fox over an antenna and didn't want to be interrupted with occasional bad reception. So, I'm watching via the app and it starts buffering. Switch to antenna and the screen is not full but square. I cannot say the app had anything to do with that but the timing is right and it had never done so before. Ended up going to a different TV and watching over antenna. Fortunately no interruptions. For a big sports fan the app may be worth it but I won't be getting it again.

title: Buggy, kept freezing and resetting to beginning during commercial breaks.
review: Attempted to use during 1 hour free trial, and found it virtually impossible to use. Didn't like us trying to fast forward and was unstable when we did. Every time we hit the first block of commercials, the app froze during one of the commercials (not the same one each time). Tried for 20 minutes to get past this roadblock (to see the start of the archived event we were trying to watch), finally just gave up. We were using a FireStick to stream on our TV. Problem wasn't internet connection (we tested the speed).

title: A huge frustration - avoid if possible
review: Quite possibly the most frustrating app youâll ever use. You can contact the email in the app (settings - about - feedback) and get a generic response.Â  If you reply to the generic response after you have followed the instructions to no avail, you will not get a response. The authentication to you cable tv provider must not work for the app so it is basically worthless. It works fine on my iPad so Fox must have some issue with their Fire Stick app.

title: TOTALLY USELESS without cable subscription
review: I was intrigued when I installed the app and it let me watch live sports without logging in with a provider. Then it stopped 12 hours later after the preview period ended. Now it won't let me watch ANYTHING without a cable subscription.As a cord NEVER (I have never had cable so I am not technically a "cord cutter") this app is COMPLETELY and TOTALLY USELESS to me. Why not let me PAY YOU MONEY DIRECTLY with a subscription so I can watch your content? Why are you turning away money? Your incremental costs are negligible.

title: That Prime does not carry Fox Sports.
review: I dislike that Prime does not carry Fox Sports.Â  I was not able to watch the Friday night Nascar Truck Series race in Daytona and I was very disappointed.Â  When I tried to log into Fox Sports (because of course there is an app available on Prime), it told me to enter my carriers name in order to access Fox Sports.Â  If I had a "carrier", now I wouldn't need Prime, (that is how I feel anyways). I cancelled Direct TV and signed up for Prime to replace Direct TV. I am finding out that my decision might not have been a good one. I cannot get my favorite sportsGolf, which I have to pay an extra $10 per month to be able to watch, JUST SOME of the tournaments, and NASCAR, forget it, I can't see any of the races via Prime. Now I will have to pay another $53.59 for You Tube TV in order to watch the Daytona 500 on Sunday Feb 17. Why do I have Prime?, for next day delivery on my Amazon orders?Â  Excuse me, I do watch 2 shows on Prime that I like.Â  Thank you.I would very much like Amazon to consider adding at least Fox Sports to their line up. Thank you for the consideration.Â  clwilliams

title: MightÂ  be ok if it gets out of "warming up"
review: Does anybody actually try these apps? I installed and opened and all it did was twirl away in an endless warming up mode. I uninstalled, redownloaded, started again, and same result. Doesn't work at all on my Brand new Kindle Fire.

title: Does NOT work with Fire HD 10.
review: After reading that FOX Sports NOW was compatible with my Kindle Fire HD 10. I couldn't get it to work.Â  After emailing FOX about the problem, they said it was not compatible. Frustrating but no $$$ lost as it was a free app.

title: Not ready for Prime Time
review: Watched SB VIV in 4K HDR on the Amazon FireStik.Â  Problem is authorizing. Once I logged in using Hulu as my provider it locked me out as having too many streams even though no other stream was open. After I logged in to the app on my phone it allowed me to open the stream on my FireStik. Trial and error was the only way to figure it out. Engineering error.

title: only worked a bit
review: so I got this app to watch the superbowlâ¦ it worked on my new tv for a while and then it just stopped... the tv went blank,.. I shut it off and then turned on again and then all I had was the "FOX" logo on my tv screen and could hear the sound of the game, but no picture.. I was then able to at least watch it on my phone but that was kind of a bummer..

title: Waste of time and effort
review: I got this because where I live I do not have access to cable and satellite is too expensive.Â  I do however have high speed internet through a program with ATT.Â  it is their home phone with added internet.Â  This internet is only available to rural households that do not have access to cable.Â  I only get 50 gigs but it is enough for now.Anyway once app is installed you get about 5 minutes preview then you have to sign up....No problem I thought...Wrong.Â  When you sign up you have to sign in with your cable tv provider.Â  That is ridiculous.Â  If I had a cable tv provider I would have Fox and not need this app...Â  what the hell is the purpose

title: IF it works, it works fine.Â  Rare that it actually works though.
review: Was forced to update the Fox Sports Go app to the FOX SPORTS app.Â  It works almost never.Â  Local games do not show up on it, so it directs you to the Fox Sports Go app, which then directs you to go back to this app.Â  Constant errors causing you to sign out from account.Â  To resolve issues the app directs you to a help section, which is in beta and has nearly no solutions for anything.Â  Customer service for Fox is non-existent.Â  If I could give this lower than 1-Star I would.

title: âToo Many Streamsâ
review: Iâm having a weird issue.Fox Sports works on my Apple TV 4K but when I log into it on my fire stick 4K it says I have too many streams going.Â  I have logged out and quit the app on my Apple TV and Iâve also reset my fire stick to factory defaults and reset my Hulu password. Is any one else having this issue on their Fire stick 4K?Thanks!

title: HORRIBLE APP: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME
review: Downloaded the app to watch the WORLD CUP and it was just HORRIBLE! The quality isnât great, the screen freezes every 5 seconds. It was such a waste time going through the process of downloading the app as I had to go back to my regular HDMI TV to watch World Cup. Plus, I missed a portion of the game to download the app!! Horrible!! FOX SPORTS GO please do something about this immediately!

title: Needs lots of work.
review: Spotty service. Lagging picture and motion. Lots of dead spots. And this is with a high speed internet connection.

title: My Game
review: Direct TV charged m3 $40+ to get FOX Sports which worked for one time.Â  the 2nd time I tried to find a Green Bay Packers game and it was not on Fox Sports.Â  I was directed to go to another FOX channel which has been blocked out from Direct TV or AT&T for a couple of months now.Â  I was on the phone with Direct TV for nearly 2 hrs waiting for them to respond to why I couldn't get my team since I had ordered the package.Â  They said it was blocked out in Cedar Rapids.Â  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?!!?Â  I quit Fox Sports completely.

title: deceptive at best
review: I thought I had read all the small print, so last week I started watching the Cal/Stanford Big Game.Â  In the middle of the second quarter the transmission stopped and a message popped up that I was finished with my free view and would have to pay to see the rest of the game.Â  NOT HAPPY

title: I never ordered this... don't care that it's free it should not show up in my purchase
review: What is Amazon up to with this?I have no desire to have anything to do with FOX or FOX Sports and it's misleading to make it look like I ordered it... even if there was no charge.This is fishy. If I can't trust amazon to not be shady, I might have to stop shopping on this site.

title: Fox sports app is useless.
review: I went to watch the race on FS1 today. When I go to the Fox Sports app I've been using for months it takes me to a new app that I need to download, but there is no way to download the new app. This is useless, and NASCAR wonders why their viewers have declined. I know I won't be watching any sports on any Fox channel. I'm done with them.

title: Sign Up Was Not Easy
review: When trying to sign up the Fox Sports app kept asking me to enter in my service provider and none of my streaming services were included in their list. I was never able to fully complete the logging in process and yet, the app now works on my TV's. However, the whole process was unnecessary and ticked me off.

title: will not consistently stream local sports
review: This is a waste of time...it only allows you to "preview" local sports for a short amount of time until it kicks you off and requires you to log back in with a service provider-generated login.Â  I can use rabbit ears and get it for free...why would I load an app on a Firestick to watch something I would be paying for if I had a service provider....makes no sense.Â  I guess I'll just go back to free local channels.Â  Seems kind of silly that this is not a better regulated feature with so many people ditching big cable ties.....

title: commentators are horrible
review: Coverage of sports on this app is atrocious. Football is great but baseball is really really bad and usually one sided. With baseball, they've consistently missed parts of at bats because they were either still showing replays or REALLYÂ  poorly timed advertisements.

title: Just say no
review: What is the point of an app that can be used with a Amazon fire TV stick if you need cable to use it? I cut the cable years ago. I am willing to subscribe monthly to an app to watch the channel through my Fire TV, even to watch ads, but It really defeats the purpose when a subscription to a cable provider is required.

title: Buffering - unwatchable - useless
review: Unwatchable broadcast.Â  Buffering issues on the server side (I have direct gigabit ethernet access).Deleted the app - it is useless.Unfortunately - one star is lowest rating possible - I was looking for a negative value - it was that bad.

title: Great on the Fire Stick
review: I downloaded this from Dish to my Fire Stick so I could watch the FIFA Womens World Cup. The streaming has been great without any issues. When the games come on I don't have to get out of my Fire Stick to watch the games. I can also replay the games I missed using this app.

title: Audio/video lag makes frustrating viewing
review: When first opening the app, it takes a while for the videos to start up. Once a video is playing, specifically the live videos, there is a lag between the audio and video. The audio is about 3 seconds ahead of the video. This makes it very frustrating to watch because you hear fans cheering or announcers saying something and you canât even see what they are talking about until 3ish seconds later. I have had no issues with any other live video steaming on the fire stick, and have not had an issues with Fox Sports Go on any other streaming device.

title: Worked Great but I did not unsrstandhow it worked
review: I thought I could see all the FOX programming and that I could only do if I had gone through my cable provider, which I have no interest in doing. Once I got that it worked great. The stream lost itself a couple of times but not so bad I could not enjoy the Super Bowl.

title: Utterly useless
review: I got the FOX sports app for my FireTV to watch NFL games.Â  Well you can't do that without a cable TV account.Â  If I had cable TV I wouldn't need to download the app for FireTV.Â  Two thumbs down for this waste of time.

title: Research thoroughly before you buy
review: I downloaded to watch the nascar race on Sunday. I was not able to use it because I do not have a tv provider. I have a digital antenna and this will not work with it. It doesnât work with the fire stick either unless you have a tv provider. ð¡ð¡

title: Freezes A LOT
review: The app for Fox Sports was freezing a lot and would randomly kick me out of the app. It was easier to watch the games from a computer than it was the Firestick. Disappointing.

title: No good
review: Iâm not happy with the app I bought it so I could watch sports on FS1 and it wonât allow me to watch it. It says your tv provider doesnât allow the streaming of this product so why have it if I canât watch it

title: view many stations
review: I used this app because they moved the NASCAR race to FS2 which I don't have got to watch it on my Fire TV and in this app you can view FS1, FS2, soccer, racing, and other sports in the app.

title: Fox Sucks
review: Only ordered it because my satellite service dropped it would have payed subscription service fee but the money grabbing asses from Fox don't care about local fans just want big money from carriers

title: Error Code 403-PA1000
review: I tried to watch the Boise State game on 11-12-20, got this error message. "Subscription has limited access to our content"! Could no find how fix this problem or if the problem is fixable.

title: Not a stand alone app
review: Very disappointed that Fox still requires a TV provider log in in order to live stream programming.Â  Downloaded Fox Sports app onto our Fire TV and wasn't able to watch the college football games.Â  Fox could easily charge a monthly fee to live stream; instead, they're still connected to the cord.Â  Not worth downloading unless you either have a TV provider OR only want to watch non-live shows.

title: BIG disappointment!
review: Critical details omitted!Â  No where does the description state that you MUST have a TV provider.Â  If you use a smart TV with an antenna (i.e., you've "cut the cord") you CANNOT use this app.!

title: Could be better
review: The stream would cut in & out randomly, sometimes it just stopped showing a still picture for up to 10 to 30 seconds during the hight of the Deltona 500 race. Upsetting at times!

title: Great service
review: I'm in rual mid-Michigan and the Fox station here broadcasts only in 480. I was dreading watching the SuperbowlÂ  in that. When I got the notice that Fox Sports was streaming it live I jumped on it. 4 stars on the streaming because during KCs 1st scoreÂ  I lost video. Re-connected and it was great for the rest of the evening.

title: TV executives are blundering idiots
review: It is impossible to set up fox sports if your tv provider is ROKU. They donât recognize it. They are missing out on money, leaving it on the table. What idiots these mortals be.

title: Do not recommend
review: I purchased this product to be able to watch football games (which it said it did) and it did not allow me to do that. I do not need this service if it can't give me the only thing I wanted.

title: Disappointing
review: It. Ever hooked up I typed in all the codes n went to the website n it never let me hook up so I missed all the collage football.Â  The reason I bought the fire stick.Â  Disappointed!!!!

title: WHY???
review: So I downloaded the app to watch a college football game, and it prompted me to log in with my cable info, to which I have none since I live in 2019. It then allowed me to watch an hour for "free" and proceeded me to show me commercials during the game break, and it made me ask why.Â  If you are just going to show me commercials anyway why do I need a cable subscription, and if I had a cable subscription why would I watch it on your dumb app?

title: If you can't get it on TV you won't be able to stream it
review: This won't help you watch anything at home unless you can already get it through a provider. If I had a provider I wouldn't need it. Giant waste of time. Deleted the same day it was obtained.

title: Can't Use
review: This is not available to use, I no longer have cable, I'm using an antenna. It should be available to any one since it's an app, whether it would be over the internet, or product such as, Fire TV.

title: Timing
review: I have 3 fire sticks. 2 are last years model (which did update yesterday) and 1 is this years model. The newer model was streaming about 7 seconds faster than the other 2.

title: I an not a big enough sports fan to want to watch a game that is already over.
review: We thought we could receive current games, games in progress, with the Fox Sports feature, but it appeared to us the feature was for games and news about games that occurred in the past. It appears ESPN+ was about the same thing and we were not interested in it either.

title: Convenient if you are walking away from your TV for a few minutes
review: I have to be broadcasting this on my TV simultaneously in order for the application to work on my Fire tablet.Â  Long pause between actual live content on the TV and what I was viewing during the baseball game yesterday (about one batter behind).Â  OK, but not great.

title: No 4K
review: 4K does not work.Â  Perhaps DirectV is blocking it since I donât have it with my package.Â  Streaming quality is lousy even though I stream 4K on other services with no issues

title: Read before buying!
review: Turns out, you are simply paying for the app. I tried accessing Monday Night Football on my Fire TV and needed to have a TV provider, which we do not have in our home. What I don't understand is it's your TV providerÂ  includes Fox Sports why would you need the app? One would think that when you pay for an app you would have access to it so this was very disappointing and like a scam. This should be clearly stated in the description.

title: Not worth it, couldnt even use half the functions. Worthless
review: I got the app after finding out that BTN was not a separate app on fire TV. So, after downloading,Â  every thing I clicked on was slow loading or unavailable.Â  I got so annoyed,Â  i just went back to theÂ  ESPN app and watched what I wanted.

title: Fox Pay-per-view
review: Really crappy ... resolution never recovered on my FireTV. 420p on a 55" screen looks really bad.I tried reloading it.. must be that Sling 'effed up the streaming to the FireTV app.Have to blame both Amazon and Fox Sports.Why would I EVER by Fox Sports again????

title: Took my PPV money
review: I paid for the Pacquiao - Thurman PPV and tried to watch it on the app. My purchase showed but gave me an error when I tried to watch the fight. No refunds BTW. #BuyerBeware

title: Not worth the effort
review: I have a very fast internet connection (up to 1 GB down and up) and the "4K Fox broadcast was unwatchable. We went back to channel 11 (reg FOX) after the first few plays. Very disappointed

title: Disgusting network
review: The Fox Network couldn't control their hate speech in their Fox ads.Â  Someone else please buy the rights to the Superbowl so I can avoid these racists.

title: Does not work
review: Does not work, for me that is. I find most, if not all, Amazon TV programs are not accessible in my geographical region??So what is the use?

title: FOXSPORTS app DOSE NOT WORK
review: This is the worst app I have used.I had to clear the cache and data and uninstall the app and do a soft rest of my TV just to get this app to work for live event.I get an error every time I try to watch any replays or highlights using this app.If the women's World Cup viewing numbers are low, it is because this app does not work.

title: Wasn't impressed
review: Not what i was hoping for, more or less a sports update not a true streaming network for my home team. Probably will delete from smart tv and find something more in line of what i want.

title: Once this happens you will be farther ahead than trying to use this stupid app. If Fox Sports cannot build an app...

Once this happens you will be farther ahead than trying to use this stupid app. If Fox Sports cannot build an app that works, then turn the sporting events over to somebody who knows how to stream video. AGGG SOOO MAD!

title: One Star
review: hate fox noise

title: Canât sign in
review: Useless

title: Waste my time.
review: Still need to type in the cable provider so doesnât matter. Donât waste time if you only have internet and not cable tv package.

title: Make sure you pay for Live Tv
review: Wonât let me watch anything on demand unless I have a live package? Seems stupid to me. My cable company lets me watch one show & with the commercials it isnât worth it.

title: Poor streaming quality
review: Was disappointed with the stream quality. Lots of buffering even over a super fast fiber optic internet connection. Bummer!

title: ehhhhh
review: We go to bars to watch games they don't play on TV. So I went to this app to see if they have the games but Nope so it was a bummer

title: No Internet Connection
review: Downloaded and tried to use this. It seems to start and then says No Internet connection, however this screen is laid over the game that we are wanting to watch. Plus the audio is coming through just fine. Also tried FoxNow and get the same error.

title: Donât bother unless you have Pd Tv Provider
review: All of these apps suck. You need a paid tv provider such as DireCTV, Spectrum, Frontier. Well I dropped DirecTV & Spectrum for my Firestick! Big Mistake!!!

title: DO NOT UPDATE!!!!
review: I fell victim to the latest update and can no longer get the local sports I want. Have to figure out how to undo the update so I can see local sports now.

title: Not as advertised
review: This was supposed to be free and would access the Westminster Kennel Club dog show but every time I tried to see it, it said it wasn't supported through my provider.Â  Waste of time and big disappointment.

title: Requires Cable Network login.
review: What's the point of "unplugging" from cable tv and going to streaming services if I have to have a cable tv login to use the damned streaming service?

title: Did not order this
review: I do not know why these are showing up on my account.Â  The bad thing, the time that is on these orders, I am ASLEEP.

title: excellent product
review: We use it to watch ACC basketball games carried by Fox that are not shown locally. Excellent coverage and picture quality.Soooo much better than ESPN Go and the commentators are excellent!Â  They actually talk about the game. Not interested in promoting upcoming programming or themselves.

title: Fox Sports Stop is a more appropriate name.
review: Wouldn't start before the game had to reset my fire stick to get it working. Then in the last quarter with a houseful of guests the feed stops and I look like a total jerk. I'd change the name to Fox Sports Stop.

title: unable to find and watch NFL game
review: Was under the impression we could receive all NFL Games on my Firestick/Fox sportsÂ  for free.Â  Very misleading.Â  Missed the Washington game - Soooooo disappointed

title: Didn't work
review: I downloaded the app, selected my provider, but every time I went to use it, I got a message that there had been some sort of difficulty and it couldn't start. Visiting the foxsports help website did not prove enlightening in the least.

title: Did not work with my DirectTV Now

title: Channel not working
review: I have not been able to use this channel.Â  I put the code in that was sent to me and could not go any further.Â  It didn't accept the code that was sent to me.

review: Not much selection, must pay for external FOX subscription, does not include very many full games

title: Low volume issues
review: Occasionally will not load-gets stuck on "warming up" screen- and requires an uninstall/reinstall when this happens.Â  Biggest issue is the low volume.Â  All other streaming apps on this device have no volume issues but this app is very low..until a commercial comes on.Â  Commercials are way louder than any game I've watched on this app.

title: Republican lies!!
review: Dislike the lies and Ignorance of FOX!!!Fact Check .....They actually make you stupider watching FOX news!!

title: Frustrated
review: Canât get it to work.Â  It keeps wanting me to sign in thru the fire stick to my tv provider which is Amazon.Â  There is no Amazon listed in the selection on the fox sportsÂ  website.Â  Have never had this issue with any of the other fire stick apps.Â  Hmmm

title: sucked
review: couldn't watch what I wanted to. if I want to watch old ball games I would record them. it said you could stream live but that wasn't true.

title: An Amazon trap
review: Amazon says you can download the app because you own it -- BS -- if your network provided doesn't appear on Fox Go list, you don't watch squat. SO why bother to own Firestick!!

title: Way too many ads!
review: Great picture and streaming quality. Putting-up with the continuous banter was one thing but letting Fox slam as many ads on at half time was typical Fox. Almost as an afterthought there was a small amount of recap and commentary squeezed in. Shame.

title: Fix this Update
review: Update on May 13 is horrible.Â  Before this update i was able to watch Fox Sports Go on my Kindle. Now the app redirects me to Fox website which needs so much buffering. Awful update that renders this app useless to me.

title: poor image quality w lots of skips
review: poor image quality w lots of skips, occasional slo-mo streaming. Thought poor image quality may be my wifi signal, but a Netflix flick immediately after streamed smoothly. Also hard to figure out how to get rid of CC, which was on by default and greatly annoying for being 10s ahead of the video, but eventually found the right button to shut off on the Amzn remote.

title: Terrible! Would give zero stars if I could
review: Did not work well at all for streaming superbowl LI for me at all.Â  Terrible! Would give zero stars if I could

title: Good!
review: Not the best looking stream, but it's free!Â  For those who don't have cable TV, that's a big plus

title: Never connected
review: Worthless unless you have a cable connection. DSL providers are either not listed or refuse service when you attempt to connect. Wasted two hours trying everything suggested to access.

title: Good to know when in doubt watch Regular antenna TV.
review: Got fed up with the way the picture look cuz of poor streaming quality. Had to switch to Fox 40 antenna. Way better picture

title: Set up is a nightmare
review: Get ready to type in all manner of passwords, confirmation codes, and other crap.Â  Frustrating!

title: Awful, constantly drops and reloads. Just terrible.
review: Awful, constantly drops and reloads. Just terrible.Â  It's not my internet as all of my other Apps work with out any issue at all!

title: 45 minute preview
review: After installing the app, I was given 45 minute preview. This is not enough time to decide to keep and pay for it.

title: Stopwatch

title: Unless you plan to watch live, don't bother
review: This is the worst app I've ever purchased. It's terrible on every platform. I've tried SlingTV, Spectrum, and Fire Stick. Live tv is ok, but it glitches quite often and kicks you back to its home screen. The absolute worst part is the replay feature, though, which I'd imagine is the reason most people purchase it in the first place. You can only fast forward 10 seconds at a time. That means that If you only want to see the third period, the 4th quarter, or the last three innings, you have to click that button around 700 times to get there. 700 times!!!! Once you get to where you want to start, pray the app doesn't decide to just shut down and kick you back to the fire stick home screen (which it does ALL THE TIME). Because, guess what? It doesn't remember where you stopped! Looks like you've got 700 more clicks in your future. C'mon, Fox. This is the 21st Century and this app is a POS.

For some reason, Soccer in the US loves to pair with this crappy service/station.Â  No matter where I try to watch it, what platform I try to watch it on, if I am wireless, if I am hardwired into a network. The video ALWAYS ends up being crappy.Â  It will be a beautiful video for about 2 minutes and then it will spend the next 10 minutes being a blur of colors that you wouldn't even know what you were looking at had you not already been told. I am so disappointed in this app. Like I said, it could be the app (on all platforms) or it could just be the back end infrastructure they have set up.Either way, something, somewhere is broken with every one of these Fox Sports Apps I have come across

review: Absolute Garbage!Â  There are 2 options for watching world cup games.Â  Live which is at times upto 1 minute behind actually live and watch from beginning.Â  If you watch from beginning, sometimes there are hours of pregame that you have to fast forward 10 seconds at a time.Â  There's no minute jump, 5 minute jump or time search.Â  This means that if there are 2 hours of pregame, you have to hit the remote 720 times to get to the actual beginning of the game.Â  Why don't the break the games up into 1st and 2nd half?Â  Also, the highlights are in reverse order.Â  So if you go to the first highlight, it's caption is something like France's 3rd game winning goal.Â  Seriously WTF?

title: This app made me hate using my FireTV Stick!
review: Massively frustrating! The screenshot in the Amazon App Store should be a gif of turquoise circle spinning! This app consistently freezes after 30-60 seconds with every game I watch. After it freezes, I'll hit the back button, select the game I want to watch again, it will play for 30 seconds and BAM - spinning turquoise circle! Sometimes, if you wait for a minute or two, it will eventually start playing again for another 30 seconds, and then freezes again.In my experience, this is the WORST streaming app from any cable channel or broadcast network. I have such a negative attitude towards this app that it's bled over to my feelings about my FireTV Stick. Since the NBA season started this year, I've been using my FireTV Stick less and less and using my Roku more. Now, I almost never use my FireTV Stick. The only time try to use it when I try to watch the Mavericks play.Â  I noticed that I was using the Roku almost exclusively a while back, but I couldn't really figure out why. Outside of FSGO, I was using mostly the same apps on both devices. But the more I thought about it, the more I came to realize that it's because this app is making me associate a bad experience with using my FireTv.

title: The Buggiest Streaming Application for Amazon Fire Stick I've Ever Used.
review: While the application will cost you no money, using it will exact its own (far greater) cost to your sanity.Incredibly buggy, at least on the Fire Stick.Â  Unable to select my cable provider (Cox Communications is the third-largest provider in the nation, so its omission is somewhat curious) in the list of available providers, even after supplying my ZIP code.Â  Randomly refreshes upcoming programming while browsing, which freezes everything for a moment, then deposits you at the beginning of the list again.Â  Is apparently incapable of keeping time, as programming that would unlock at a given hour would continue to display that error when selected even well after the appointed time had passed.

title: Super Bust
review: Downloaded it to watch the Super Bowl using my Amazon Fire Stick. The stream regularly stalled. So I switched to the Fox Sports Go website, and the stream there worked most of the time, but it showed different commercials than what was being aired on TV. (The big-budget commercials are one of the reasons to watch the game.) The stream then cut out completely in the 4th quarter of the game. I couldn't even get the stalling version on the Fire Stick. So I switched over to the Spanish version of Fox Sports Go to watch the rest of the game. Quite an awful Super Bowl viewing experience. Obviously, this is not an app I'll use again. Who needs a sports app that cuts out the ends of games?

title: Streams good, but menu navigation and error messages or poor
review: It works, and streaming performance is good, but main menu navigation is ridiculously slow. Specifically, when you first start the app, it takes significantly longer than it should (compared to other similar apps) to load and display the current channel content.Â  I think it tries to authenticate you first before displaying channel content, and the authentication process is slow.Additionally, error messages (when they happen, which isn't frequent) can be poorly worded / confusing.Â  For example, while other channels worked great, I once got a "Server could not be reached" message when trying to view a particular sports event.Â  Through trial and error, I figured out what it actually meant was that event was blacked out due to my location.

title: ... is Fox Sports Go so I can watch my favorite baseball team
review: Just purchased new Amazon FireTV Stick and first app I installed is Fox Sports Go so I can watch my favorite baseball team. Unfortunately, regardless of what live game or show I watch on this app, it consistently freezes and then continues and repeats that process, at least once or twice a minute. I can run Fox Sports Go app on my iPhone connected to the same WiFi router and it works without ever freezing or delay. I have 100Mb fiber connection with AT&T and a NightHawk wireless router. I get consistent download speeds of ~125Mb and under 10ms for latency, so its not the network (first thing that is blamed). I've watched shows on Amazon Prime on the same FireTV stick without any issues. I've restarted the FireTV stick, and even re-installed the Fox Sports Go app, no change.

title: FoxSports GO demanding provider, then UserID & PW, but won't accept UserID
review: Today, and today only, SAT 2015-10-31, FOX Sports GO won't let me log on.Â  It pops for me to select my provider, then enter a UserID & PW, but won't accept my UserID.Â  I checked w/my provider and UserID is fine, and can log onto their website fine. This is not a password issue. Since it's ONLY FOX Sports GO that does this (I can access ESPN and all others checked via Amazon Fire TV Stick fine), I'm presuming this to be a Fox Sports GO issue.Â  That, or the app has been hacked by a phishing app of some kind.Â  Can't watch OU today, that's a BIG deal in Oklahoma.
