title: Frequent channel buffering and pixelated video
review: I was pretty excited when I first tried Fubo TV.Â  They have a wide selection of channels including the local sports channels I no longer have with my limited cable lineup.Â  Unfortunately, during my free trial period I experienced a lot of problems with the video being pixelated.Â  I thought it was just one channel, so I switched to the Weather Channel.Â  It worked well for a while, but then began to do the same thing.Â  This issue occurred while at my vacation house.Â  When I got home I installed the app on my Amazon TV.Â  There were no pixelation issues but no matter what channel I watch, at some point the video freezes and buffers.Â  This some times only occurs for a few seconds and other times I have to close and re-open the app.Â  It's too bad this channel doesn't appear ready for Prime Time.Â  I was looking forward to consolidating my video on Fubo and getting rid of Hulu and Sling.Â  Looks like at the end of the month I'll be getting rid of Fubo.

title: Piece of garbage!
review: I purchased this so I'd be able to watch the Olympics in my room as I only stream TV in my room. I also wanted to evaluate it as a possibility of eliminating my satellite TV as it's cheaper. If I didn't want to try and finish the Olympics I would have canceled it on the first day! It has continually buffered. It seems to want to buffer 3 to 4 times a minute most times just long enough for you to miss something! It also locks up all the time. In addition it will sometimes give me the message that I have to many connections, which would be remarkable since I only have it in this one TV and no one else even knows I have it! Explain to me how a single connection can be to many? In short.... Absolutely horrid service!

title: Terrible app and service
review: Terrible app and service.Â  The only one I have ever experienced that was worse was SlingTV.Â  Both buffer constantly, freeze, and require reboots often.Â  I ordered this to watch NBC Sports Network so I was seeing all the 2018 Winter Olympics.Â  Don't count on watching your favorite competition without lots of interruptions.Â  I literally couldn't watch a single Luge run (all under one minute runs) without it buffering at least once if not more often.That's truly pathetic.Â  We have a stable and speedy connection and have no issues with amazon prime, netflix, youtube, and a myriad of other streaming types of content.If you're looking for a streaming service app, this one is a real drag.Â  Don't subscribe to these folks...Â  Run, don't walk away...

title: What A Joke
review: FuboTV is absolute garbage. The service made watching TV and movies a frustrating experience. Constant playback issues, content freezing regularly and forcing you to restart the app, the inability to fast forward and rewind content... the list goes on.And the best part? They want as much as $90/month for content that has ADVERTISEMENTS. You can get that with Hulu for $10/month â and even that is stupid when there are so many other providers out there who offer ad-free content if you're willing to pay just a little. I have no idea how FuboTV is even still in business.

title: Too expensive and cumbersome.
review: We go fubo for watching European soccer, and it's not worth it.Too expensive. At $45, you might as well get cable with DVD. That's a little more, but you have a lot more options.Too cumbersome. You have to record ahead of time. No on-demand. If you want to watch, e.g. "La Liga", you never know what game is going to show at a certain time.While living in Europe, we had dazn for sports streaming. That was less than half the price, everything was on demand (meaning you don't need to plan ahead and record) and you knew exactly which game was showing when. Too bad dazn isn't available here.

title: All the Sports - Time Blocks May End Your Viewing
review: Absolutely every sport you can imagine is on Fubo. No exceptions. Even the most obscure sports were available. Ultimately, we discontinued use of FuboTV for one reason. Each game or event has a specific amount of time. Until the program starts, you can't select it. When the time ends, REGARDLESS of whether your sporting event is finished, the stream stops. Period. No saved recording, no continued watching, it's just done.We switched to YouTubeTV and found we had none of the same issues. Sport options are severely diminished, but if you're looking for something that will stream all major football games, YouTubeTV is the way to go.If you're into Soccer/Cycling/F1 Racing/etc, Fubo is way better for you, but may result in missing the last parts of a game.

title: Terrible experience on FireTV Stick.
review: this app is terrible on my FireTV Stick.Â  90% of the time i try to start watching one of my DVRed shows, it just kicks me back out to my DVR list.Â  also i have to force quit the app a lot because it gets stuck on a black screen.as for when i'm actually able to watch a show, it works okay.Â  the resolution isn't as good as i was hoping; it's only 720p which doesn't look great on a big screen.Â  and there are lots of gaps in my DVR recordings.Â  it's almost as if someone is periodically hitting a "30 second skip ahead" button or something.Â  will not be renewing my subscription when my trial runs out.

title: Cancelled before 7 day trial ended.
review: 1.Â  Pricing is deceptive.Â  Advertised at $54.99 but you are forced to take 2 add-ons at signup that increases price to $59.99.Â  2.Â  Large portion of the channels air classic TV.Â  Can get these for free with other apps.Â  3.Â  Experienced technical issues.Â  One time the audio began repeating. Tried changing channel,Â  closing app, turning off fire stick, unplug fire stick from tv, etc.Â  Audio continued.Â  Was like a horror movie.Â  Finally unplugged fire stick from outlet.Â  That worked.Â  Another time both TVs suddenly displayed a message that we had reached maximum devices.Â  Plan allowed 3.Â  Only 2 even had the app.Â  Same day,Â  little Later, streaming stopped during a live broadcast.Â  Was 10 minutes before I could get program back on.Â  Horrible 5 day experience.

title: Not quite ready for primetime
review: I'm currently in the FuboTV seven day trial. Thus far, I've found a few bugs in the Fire TV app. (At least, if you're using the Fire TV Game Controller.) Pause, fast forward and reverse do not work. On the game controller, pressing the "A" button pauses Amazon, Sling, DirecTV Now and Playstation Vue playback. It does not, however, work with Fubo. Additionally, if you exit playback mid-program, there is no "resume" feature. Conversely, playback on a PC has no problems whatsoever. I just much prefer watching TV on an actual TV. (And yeah, I know, I can "cast" from my computer.)DVR recordings are limited to only 10. That's something I can live with because I'm only recording motorcycle racing on Bein Sports. That said, if I was using Fubo as my primary streaming service, that would be a deal breaker.As for image/video quality, there are no issues. It's on par with all of the other streaming services (aside from Amazon with their AMAZING UHD 4K playback.)I suspect FuboTV will fix their Fire TV app quickly, so I'll probably try them again in a few months. They are definitely on the right track, but the Fire TV app is certainly in its infancy.

title: Flasely Advertised the Eagles vs Cowboys Game
review: It was advertised on Google search engine that the Eagles vs Cowboys game could be viewed on FuboTV. After signing up for the free trial, logged into the website and could not find the games broadcast on a search on the FuboTV website. I immediately cancelled the free trial subscription and after cancelling, I still continue to get emails about their services and links to reactivate the service. I have emailed them to confirm my cancellation (no response) and requested that no further contacted is needed because I do not deal with any company that advertises one thing and does not provide the actual solicited service. If the game that I was looking to view was blacked out or not available, it should have been indicated in the advertisement. I signed up and provided my credit card for services that were not provided. FuboTV completely wasted my time and after I cancelled the service, I am still receiving emails stating: Your trial is still activeIf you're no longer interested in watching fuboTV and you'd like to end your trial early, visit 'My Account Page' and click 'Cancel Subscription' and follow the steps to cancel. To visit 'My Account Page', click here.I have already cancelled FuboTV and not interested in hearing from FuboTV since I missed watching the game I wanted to watch already.

title: Glitchy
review: We do not like this app and will be cancelling. It does fine for live tv but if you try to watch a series it is horrible. When you pay as much as you do for this app and then they force you to watch 7 commercials every 5 minutes it gets old really fast. You cannot pause it during a commercial break either so if you have to leave the room you will feel like a kid again when you have to hightail it back in to watch.Â  If you pause the episode you are watching it will error out and then 9 times out of 10 you have to restart from the beginning. It will not let you pick up where you left off.Â  Forget trying to ff or rewind. It doesn't work. Also, if you are watching a series and you pick an episode you have already seen when you try to go back it exits out of the app instead of just the episode so you have to find your way all the back through. There are way better apps for way less money.

title: terrible user interface, unreliable streaming, slow to connect, lower res "HD"
review: Boy do I regret believing the reviews on Fubo.Â  Yes, they have some sports coverage that's hard to get elsewhere.Â  But it's not worth it.Firstly the user interface is really really bad.Â  Who designed this thing?Â  It's clunky, allows very little customization, gives limited information about shows, makes it difficult to change channels, etc. etc.Then you find that it takes some time after you switch to a new channel to get a non-blurry picture.Â  What?Â  Are you running this out of your basement, Fubo?And every so often there's an outage.Â  Unexplained and usually unreported, but there you go, you can't get that stream now.Â  Has happened to me more than once, and usually right when there was a "I don't want to miss this" event.Â  I've stopped keeping track.Finally, all the so-called HD streams are really at 720p, not 1080p.Â  There's one "experimental" 4K channel, rarely has anything on it.Yeah, I've already cancelled my service, just waiting for the current sub to drain.Â  (Yes, drain is the right term.)Â  I'm considering Hulu -- it has most of the channels I want, and works well with Fire boxes. I'll miss the occasional La Liga and Ligue 1 and Serie A matches I was able to catch, but I can't justify Fubo for access to the few games I have time to watch.

title: Junk doesn't work and bilks you after you cancel
review: This has to be the crappiest app I have ever downloaded for streaming. It froze up every 20 seconds, did not have the BS how's to watch on channels you you pay for, reduced quality picture . Just a horrible experience. This App makes Amazon look bad. I'm still ticked off I paid for a month of service and received about 30 minutes of crashing d streaming. Amazon needs ton dump this app off their firestick

title: Don't bother if you have Amazon Fire TV
review: Amazon Fire TV implementation is terrible. No entry for "Settings" at the top. The navigation between features is much less useful than any other alternative internet TV offering that I've seen. Like when you press the menu button on Playstation Vue, you see the current show, the next couple of shows, and can switch to the Guide if you want. On Fubo, you press the menu button and you can change the video resolution, worthless. They really need to work on navigation for users with Fire TV. About the only thing that you get for live TV are select, the arrow buttons, and return. I assume the Roku is much better, not going to pay $100 to find out, though. The only plus is that the local stations seem to work well. Not the stuttering that I see on Playstation Vue local channel, or all the myriad of problems with the local stations on Hulu with Live TV. But the navigation with Fire TV is so bad, I can't use it.What I'd really like to do is rearrange the guide to put all the sports channels together at the bottom of the guide, instead of having some at the top, and another group at the bottom. Really wacky the way that the channels are arranged. Some are alphabetical like you'd like (the non-sports ones), and the sports channels are just disorganized.But in the end it doesn't matter. Unless I can find another way to use this app without the Fire TV, ain't going to happen.

title: Some Problems But No Show Stoppers
review: I must say from the start that the only reason I purchased this app for to watch the Giro d'Italia (Italy's version of the Tour de France). I use NBC Sports Gold to watch cycling but the Giro was not a covered race. A quick Google search led me to fubotv. I primarily watch TV through FireTV so I downloaded the fubotv app and then subscribed through my computer. I have been using fubotv for less than a week. Based upon that experience I offer the following observations.I am able to watch the Giro as I desired. There are quite a few other channels available but I have not watch any, for reasons to be discussed below. The picture quality is fine and as with all internet apps it is dependent on you internet speed/quality.My biggest disappointment is the limited capacity of the "DVR" feature. While it is true you can "record" shows for later viewing you are limited to three "recording" total. Also, you must watch those recording within 72 hours of there recording, after which they will be deleted. This limitation has prevented me from recording any thing other than the Giro (which is a 21 day race) which explains why I have on experience with other channels. This wouldn't be too bad except the DVR does not provide the ability to record a "season". Rather, I have to go the desktop each day and set the DVR to record the next program (in my case, the next race three days in the future). A "Season" or "Record All" option sure would be nice.Another limitation, at least from the FireTV standpoint, is that you can't set the DVR to record a show from your TV. You can access the DVR to play a recording but to set new recordings you must use a computer. Also, the schedule on the FireTV fubotv app is limited to about 12 hours in the future.Finally, I have noticed that when the app is paused and then resumed there is a lot of buffering time before the show starts again. I don't believe this is a ISP problem as the buffering is much longer than with PBS, NBC Sports Gold, HBO Now or YouTube.Bottom line, I am pleased to be able to watch the Giro "legally". The fubotv allows me to do this. The grips above are really are more observations than show stoppers. With that said, to get cycling with the DVR feature I am paying more than $40 per month. I will cancel my subscription after the Giro is done, not because of the app but because I really don't have any interest in the other channels. If fubotv offers some programming that your looking for I would go for it.

title: fuboTV Live
review: Good channel selection--I have 100 mbps and high download speeds--or so I pay my cable provider for high speed...do not think I get...as Fubo TV live jumps, shakes....always have to reset/restart to get good pic for a bit--about every few minutes--seemed to work fine for HGTV but not for sports...so not sure about fubo tv live at this time...not sure it is worth full price of $34.99--I might keep for a month--while on special...but if it keeps jumping around, then not keeping--would be nice to watch soccer--so far just used for a NFL game and a HGTV show--if it continues to jump/shake during sports--not worth it.

title: Goodbye Comcast!
review: Fubo has lots of channels and gave me the option of adding on the NFL network.Â  The streaming works fine on my TCL Roku TVs and the only drawback I see so far is much of the content is in 720p and not true HD. Also 4k content is very limited. Sometimes they broadcast Fox NFL games in 4k. My TCL struggles with that channel but my Amazon fire tv works fine with Fox NFL 4k. With the Fubo app, I can install it on my iphone and all my apple devices so I can watch tv anywhere.Â  You can even stream it on a Windows laptop through the website.I did the free week trial before I finally selected Fubo as I didn't know anyone using the service so I was skeptical. We're saving about $100 a month by cancelling Comcast's phone and cable.Â  For the savings, I can put up with the lower resolution.

title: Zero customer service
review: This was the worst app I have ever encountered. I could never get on. When I tried to get help there was no place to email or contactÂ  the website just kept directing me to their help site. They had a phone number you could call but it kept rolling over and making me choose an option every five minutes. Needless to say, I chose this app to see a football game, and I started one hour early to do so,Â  and I never got to see any of the game. I donât even know who to contact to get out of my trial period.Horrible horrible customer service. I will be surprised if anyone actually subscribes to this service.

title: this for the latest update
review: got the latest update and this is great!....everything works great....and 500 hours DVR!....they seem to have fixed all the bugs from the earlier app version....and I did spend time with Fubotv support about some of the problems....and they seem to have listen very well.... to me it's well worth the money......and not having espn in no problem for me....they have all the channels I want...and the DVR!.......much better now with this update.....have tried all the others but to me no one beats Fubo....just saying.....

title: FuboTV repeatedly charged my credit card - User Beware
review: Do NOT use FuboTV! I signed up for their free trial access and canceled the same day because they hardly any of my MLS games. The next month, out of the blue, they started randomly charging my credit card (which you had to give them for the free trail.) There was one charge for $384 from FuboTV!! I emailed their support immediately. They replied that they see the charges but needed my expiration date on my CC repeatedly to confirm. I wasn't going to give them any more CC info, so I went to my CC company to dispute the charges and they blocked FuboTV from any further activity. I can surmise that either they got hacked and didn't want to own it, or they are involved in illicit behavior. Either way, their "support" was not willing to do anything about it, even though they saw the problem. User Beware!

title: Useless. I bought it because I wanted to watch ...
review: Useless. I bought it because I wanted to watch an important soccer game for World Cup qualifiers. It crashed down and could not see even any channel at all. It kept saying that I didn't have network and yet my other apps like Sling or Amazon were fine. I understand that this happen to many people too. First Bad impressions are difficult to forget.

title: Disappointed with service
review: I signed up for this App to be able to watch the San Diego Fleet football teams games . After going through the process of signing up, when I attempted to watch the home opener onÂ  Sunday February 17 , your App informed me that that particular game was unavailable. You selling point had been that I WOULD be able to watch AAF games .Very disappointing. I will not continue to use this App .David Cameron

title: $55 and there are still commercials
review: For one thing, the least expensive package is $55 and there are still commercials. During the free 7 day trial, I used this to watch the last season of Schitt's Creek before Netflix gets it. For that price, I expected there to be no commercials but there were tons of them. I don't get it. Why pay to watch commercials?I tried to cast it using the app on my phone but the quality was terrible. Using the app via FireTV was much better but the the sound would sometimes not be synced exactly, it would be a little off.I did not use this to watch sports which I understand is their main thing, so in the end this app just wasn't for me.

title: The most channels Sports and Non - are in this app
review: I have used Sling, Pluto, Hulu, and a few others - attempting to replicate the amount of channels you would have with satellite, and I am happy to say with this APP I have done it.Â  On Sling - they advertise local channels but you don't get all of them - with Fubo you do.Â  Sling you have about 50 hours DVR - here you have 500.Â  Sling does not have Oxygen, WE and a few other channels that I like and that are included here.Sports - I don't' care - but if you do - there is a ton to choose from.I did only give them 4 stars however for 2 reasons:A.Â  The volume on some commercials is crazy loud so you have to run and turn the tv down when they come on.B.Â  There is no continue watching or way of going to the last show you were watching from the Home Screen.Â  If you are not in your recordings - then selecting continue watching - you would not see anything else you had been in the middle of.Â  So when I pause and go back into the app - I have to manually search for the last show I was streaming, or watching to continue and have to remember that.Â  HULU, PLUTO, SLING all have that feature so if you were watching a show 2 days ago - you can find it rather than searching - and that makes a real difference!

title: Fubo is the tv of 2020
review: At $65 a month, Iâm not really cutting my cable bill when you factor in internet. BUT Iâd rather pay these guys than the cable company who just canât seem to update to lower prices or offer you less and pay less.We have kids and this is simple to use and has all the stuff they want (âneedâ lol). Way easier to use than the dumb cable boxes and still have the option to record and DVR.Itâs also got golf channel which isnât on one of the SLING packages. Therefore you have to get both if you have kids because none of the kids channels are on the sports one.Give it a try; you wonât be upset.

title: SCAM SCAM, DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT CARD INFO
review: I signed up and then cancelled a few days later. Then found out that my credit card got charged. They deny me ever attempting to cancel the 'service'.Â  So not only did they scam me out of my money, they are also calling me a liar.Make screen shots when you do cancel so you have proof.

title: There's a Sneaky Catch to This Service.
review: I think FuboTv is a very good service that provides great channels, including MSG so I can watch my Devils lose mercilessly every other day, BUT!!!!! Beware, there's a sneaky stipulation to their service.Â  You are unable to stream FuboTV on 2 devices at the same time if you are on 2 different wifi networks.Â  Example: my sister has a house and I have a house.Â  The home network is my house, therefore if she wants to watch fubo on a roku/firestick/ smart tv app/ apple tv / xbox at her house while im watching it at my house it is not allowed. This rule only applies to TV Devices.Â  So in that case she or I would need to stop using the firestick to watch fubo and start watching on our phones or laptops.Â  Extremely inconvenient for people using the same account in 2 different homes.Â  I spoke to fubo about it and they said there's nothing they can do and it's part of their contract.They need to make it so that we can pay maybe like $5 extra per month to add a TV Device outside of the home network cuz this is going to make me cancel their service.

title: All Good, THEN NOTHING!
review: I thought things were going well, good reception, clear picture. Then it paused like it was uploading more content, then stopped completely! After rebooting the internet and the TV, the channel said the content was no longer available in my area and it quit broadcasting...... Indians vs Yankees game #1. I'm not sure what took place, but I will seriously consider cancelling any further subscription services.

title: Do not waste your time
review: I gave it a 1 so I could write the review. I have tried two other streaming services and had minimal issues. This is by far the worst thing I have ever tried. Couldn't watch at all. Over a 2 day period nothing would play.

title: Didn't Finish The Game
review: So I'm watching my game and the stream ends wit 10 minutes to go. It switched to another game. When I tried to go back and watch it, it said "Gamed Ended" even though it didn't. I missed my team coming back in the last few minutes to win.What a joke.Â  You sell a sports streaming service yet streams cut out? Terrible.

title: So glad there was a free trial
review: The interface was confusing to me as a first time user which was a huge turnoff. There just simply wasn't enough value for me to pay $45 every month. I have live TV through a different service at $20/month and since it includes ESPN, I get the majority of sporting events that I like. I would not recommend this service.

title: Way Too Expensive
review: This is an extremely expensive streaming service. BTW, they don't carry ABC as a local. Plenty of Euro football though. 59.99 a month is ridiculous. Streaming services are slowly creeping up to cable prices. Stop them. Don't buy this content. There are other services, like Sling, which is much more affordable. Doing doesn't carry local stations but a decent antenna will solve that problem for you.

title: Problems with receiving channels & out of market games
review: I tried FUBO tv. I first problem was I could not get out of market NFL games. The second problem I could not get ESPN. I contacted their technical support spent 55 minutes on phone, he could not fix the problem. He said the he would elevate the support call. Did not here back from support. Cancelled service. The problem was that when I wentÂ  into ESPN, I would just have spinning circle and then get rebooted out the FUBO, then would screwup Fire TV.When I uninstalled the APP, rebooted, everything went back to normal and has been working great!

title: If you have time to deal with all these inconveniences and miss the sporting events you really want towatch, then this is a good
review: Not reliable application. Live streaming LAGS during main sports event (Real Madrid vs Barcelona),Â  DVR records wrong events (requested to record Mexico vs Jamaica, recorded a boxing fight), becomes unresponsive even if application is deleted and reinstalled. When you ask for technical assistance, you are ALWAYS told to delete and reinstall app and to check with your internet provider, contact your device vendor (i.e. Amazon, Chromecast, Roku, AppleTv, AndroidTV, etc).Â  Most viewing issues or wrong DVR recordings are FUBOTV issues. If you have time to deal with all these inconveniences and miss the sporting events you really want to watch, then this is a good app.

title: No Customer Service!
review: Yet another service that throws software together overnight and puts it out to the general public to see who bites. They do not have a customer service department. You can not call them. There is a robot that will respond to emails days later that makes you thinks someone is responding. The user interface is poorly designed and they Do Not care to make it better. Just here to collect money. It is really sad that there is not one streaming service out there that is good today, Not one! It's all about collecting that money!

title: Technical Difficulties
review: I continually struggled logging into Fubo app from both my Firestick and cell phone.Â  It kept saying that the username or password was incorrect.Â  However, I could log into my account with those same credentials.Â  I dropped it.

title: Fubo great system needs TBS and TNT
review: Ok this system is better than YouTubeâs system.Â  I like the split view for sports.Â  You can watch 2 games at once.Â  I had the red zone on one channel and the local game on another.Now the issues. They do not have TBS TNT CNN all the channels AT&T own.Â  They also do not carry my local ABC channel in Charleston SC.I have yet to decide on either Spectrum YouTube or Fubo.Â  If Fubo had TBS TNT and my local ABC it would be no contest.Â  CNN who the hell watches it anyways.

title: Buggy app lowers value of subscription
review: FuboTV is functional and may be worth it for you if you have limited options to watch the programming they offer.Â  The app however could use a lot of improvement to make the service more appealing.Â  My experience has been the appÂ  freezes from time to time when using the DVR function requiring a forced stop to reset the app. Functionality in DVR and in the program guide is weak.Â  Streaming slows from time to time causing lower resolution.

title: No local channels!
review: I would give it 5 stars if it had all local channelsÂ  or at least regional national networks.Â  CBS, Fox and ABC.Â  None of these can show live shows. They claim to have all the sports and yet I would miss half the college games and all the live NFL.Â  That made the service useless. CBS is the most important because they have most of the prime time shows i watch. I am not going to wait days or weeksÂ  to view repeats. Hulu's quality is not as good but it has all the local channels.

title: Disappointed
review: We are very disappointed because we thought we could get all of the NY Giants games (we've lost Fox on Direct TV). It sounded like the game on Sunday 9/22 would be streamed, but it wasn't.Â  We also found it difficult to navigate the app, but that could be our lack of experience.Â  All in all, we ended up paying for a month's viewing that we won't use and have discontinued the service. In our opinion, it was a case of false or misleading advertising.

title: Waste of money
review: Get an amazon fire stick, download kodi, pay $10 a month to iptv realm and get 1000% more channels, all HD.Â  No blackouts on local sports teams.Â  It's sad that in america these crap companies have to blackout sports forcing us to give our money to oversees providers that don't have to play the games.

title: I'm ditching FuboTv and going to Hulu January 2020
review: Both of my subscriptions were just pre-paid for January but I'm getting rid of Fubo on January 24. The product was ok but had issues with subscriptions from day one. I held on for five months now but am sick and tired of when they update their software that I have to go through and reactivate most of the channels that are included. My current configuration is Firestick TV 4K with Fubo and Sling Orange for ESPN. I should have dropped both of these in September and stuck with Hulu only. I have had multiple FuboTv issues with my subscription especially Showtime and wasn't able to receive or activate multiple channels for weeks. FuboTv SOFTWARE IS BROKEN and desperately needs to be fix.

title: Worst resolution of any streaming service available.
review: Over priced for the terrible qualify.Â  Lacking major channels, I couldn't stand the constant blurred, grainy picture.Â  It looked worse than a 80's home video made by a 5 year old. Not worth the cost. It should be crystal clear resolution not grainy and blurred. Couldn't stand the free trial, canceled. I will not be a fubotv customer.

title: Fine if you don't have cable
review: A long way to go before I cut my cable.Â  Very clutsy interface and not user friendly.Â  Had lots of pixilation and drop in picture quality.Â  Support is poor.Â  NO ABC so my wife hated it.Â  Some of the games I wanted to watch were not available but I could stream them on my iPad.Â  Cloud service is basic and problematic -- can't fast forward while recording in session, cant programs until they are scheduled.Thought I hated my cable until this!

title: works fairly wellÂ  but cannot abide the commercials
review: For the most part this worked very well, a bit confusing about changing channels and viewing options. It was a wake up call as to how bad commercials are and how often they occur. I will not continue and will go back to streaming without commercials. This is not an issue with Fubo but rather an observation of just how bad live TV has become. Most commercials absolutely insult ones intelligence!

title: FuBarTV
review: Does not work 95% of the time. If you would like to watch this on your firetv stick, understand that under peak load this app will not even start. When this app does work (games no one is interested in) expect lag, poor image quality, and tearing. Autogoooool. Stop wasting our time FuBaRTV.

title: At least 50% of the time you want to use ...
review: At least 50% of the time you want to use it, it will error sayingÂ  "Sorry. We can't play this content at this time."

title: My Mistake
review: This is the slowest and most difficult app of the roughly 50 downloaded on my Amazon Fire stick. It also did not offer all of the NFL games I was hoping to watch. I cancelled this option after my trial period because I could not believe how few shows it offered. I kept thinking there was something I had missed. It turned out the only thing I was missing was the shows I wanted to watch.

title: I had high expectations, but Fubo did not deliver
review: I tried a free week trial of Fubo to watch Seahawks football games on the east coast. The first game was live but it was fuzzy in the second half and the second game I couldnât watch live.Â  When I tried to watch it later, after I recorded it, I had to search around to find it, after I set Fubo to record it, and the ending was cut off.I also watched other shows but I experienced sounds and visuals not matching.Â  The biggest disappointment is not being able to watch old shows when I click on it. It shows the Fubo air date even though the original episode aired years ago.I wonât be subscribing due to all these issues which is disappointing because I read good things about Fubo for sports. Addendum : had issues cancelling.Â  Donât cancel through the website or through email, call!!!

title: Unreliable streaming.Â  Poor customer service.
review: Horrible streaming.Â  Feed kept losing sound, then freezing, then going to a white screen before sending you back to the fubo home screen.Â  You have to reset the channel every 5-7 mins.I have fast and reliable internet service and no issues with the fire stick.Customer service only offered a partial refund $20/60.00 USD monthly advanced feeÂ  (which could take up to 2 weeks to come back to me) and to close the account.Â  They said it could take up to 24 hours for a supervisor to call me back.Â  Unacceptable.Not worth the money.

title: Fubo is a ok service, minus all the glitches
review: Futbi is a good tv package for the price. My complaint is the streaming quality; we have excellent internet service, and despite that thereâs a few glitches from time to time, like you hear two different audio at the same time. I deleted the app and reinstalled it, but that didnât fix it. Also, when you type on the search bar, it wonât let you go back to the home screen. I feel so frustrated that I might cancel this service.

title: Works flawlessly-no buffering ever
review: They should add more channels such as ESPN and then it'd be great. We use it mostly for the local channels but it does have quite a few regular cable channels. I chose this streaming service over ALL the others out there after I tried them all. What I've learned is no streaming service can compete with satellite service but then again it's less than half the cost.

title: Not as advertised
review: Signed up to get live NFL games, but was only able to access the same game that I can see locally on my cable. Did not give access to other NFL games on at the same time showing in other regions. Waste of time.

title: 3 people found this helpful
review: Report abuse

title: This application was a completely disappointment. I downloaded it on my Fire Stick
review: This application was a complete disappointment. I downloaded it on my Fire Stick, and signed for the free trial, and after that it wouldn't go into the whatever is next. It keep saying: Server error. I really encourage them to first try if the server is available before making anyone going trough the signing process. Really bad user experience. I had to go online after that to remove my subscription. And I tried two times.

title: Service did not work, tried to cancel, could ...
review: Service did not work, tried to cancel, could not reach them and was charged for a service I did NOT use. Complete rubbish.

title: Just kind of MEH for TV....
review: On the outset, it is the best for the price charged, with a LOT of channels at less than $50 a month, however the service does have some hefty programming problems.Â  First, its very sports oriented, and since we do not watch/carefor sports, that aspect is a waste of $$ for us.Â  Second, (We did not notice this before signing up)Â  there is simply NO ABC at all, so we still have to use our old antenna to get ABC.Â  Lastly, tho we do not speak Spanish, there are several Spanish only channels forced on us as well, again, another waste of $$ on us.

title: Editing is AWFUL
review: I was trying to watch a movie and was jarred by the cuts to commercial in the middle of sentences.Â  It' as though they have specific times for commercials, regardless of what's happening on screen.Â  Very jarring, and caused me to simply leave the movie and the network.

title: Great service, terrible guide interface
review: Do not like that the menu button does not provide guide access. Have to hit back arrow instead.Also don't like that you can't just return to show that I was watching. I have to click through the whole guide to find it again. It should also run "live" PIP while searching guide.These issues keep me looking for something better.

title: Avoid this, wait until work out the bugs. Terrible performance.
review: Awful feed, choppy and freezes constantly. Sling doesn't do this on the same internet connection, Direct TV doesn't do this either. Also, the DVR just doesn't work. I couldn't watch a single match.

title: I cut the cord
review: This streaming service allowed me to cut the cord with DirecTv. I am able to stream the sports I watch and with the plus package my wife and kids get the programing they watch. DVR service is great. The navigation could be improved but it works just fine. Only bummer is no ESPN. But I can get the ESPN+ streaming service for $5/mo. All together I am getting everything I was getting with DirecTV at $90 less cost. I use all Amazon Fire devices.

title: Canceling was a problem
review: I tried fubo and it was fine, but I decided to go with another streaming service. Fubo was supposed to send me an email before my trial ended, but never did. I wound up paying a month before I could cancel. It wouldnât let me login to my account to cancel, so I had to call the service number after doing a search on the internet. You never talk to a human, but you can cancel by following the steps of the voice response system. Not a friendly streaming service for sure, account wise!

title: Pretty Good Alternative to Cable/Satellite TV Offerings
review: Likes:500 hour cloud-DVRGuide provides snapshot of current/upcoming broadcasts (shows, movies, etc...)Easy setupWide variety of channels (The ones that most people would watch)Dislikes:No 30 second skip-forward (Found in other providers' DVR options)No 10 second skip-backward (Found in other providers' DVR options)No configurable setting to limit number of recorded show (e.g. Only keep last 5)Fast-Forward/Fast-Backward with Amazon Fire remote is clunky and inconsistentNo 4k recordingNetwork channel ABC missing from channel offering.Â  Not a huge deal since ABC offers subpar programming anyhow :)

title: Very confused!
review: When we went to use this app we had to sign in & we had to go on line & make a account with them which I guess is right but now itâs not free app through Amazon. I guess I donât understand how come we have to pay when our fire stick & Amazon say itâs free to have. I think I would like to know more about the stick & other channels & there set up & how to sign up with them , then how there free.

title: Fits My Need
review: I had Fubo a couple of years ago on my computer, but there was too much buffering due in part to our rural internet service. We just got a smart TV, so I tried it again with Fire Stick, and we have not had any buffering problems. Monthly price has remained steady, and less expensive than many other services.

title: Football blackouts still apply.
review: I am in a different state and wanted to watch the pre-season game for my home football team that happened to be playing the team for the state I was visiting.Â  It picked-up on my location and wouldn't let me watch due to blackout rules for the location where I was. Waste of my time.

title: Buffering issues
review: Interface is great. easy to use but im having some buffering issues. i dont have this type of problem with other steaming services like netflix, hulu, etc but i guess maybe the difference is this is live TV? it was terrible while watching the superbowl. my kids are getting frustrated also while watching their shows Nick jr, etc. likely going to cancel.

title: Not a free sports service
review: Downloaded this because my husband read you could watch live sports for free.Â  You actually need a cable provider to watch the sports.Â  Not exactly a free sports service.

title: Kept freezing up
review: I tried fuboTV for 3 days with their 7 day free trial.Â  Very disappointed.Â  It kept freezing up and we had to wait, wait, wait.Â  Then I unplugged the Amazon Firestick I used for fubo, plugged my cable box back in and the problem went away with my cable service (with no fuboTV service).fuboTV needs a few more years to get its act together.

title: Be aware and careful when you get a Firestick TV.
review: I do not like this product as it is too difficult to navigate and I could not find the channel I was subscribed to get so I am cancelling my entire CSpire account and going back to my old cable.Â  This is actually terrible for us old folks to try and simply watch television.Â  Please be aware when they try to sell you on fibre optic high speed internet and tv service.Â  Make sure you know exactly what you are getting and how to make it work.

title: Confused and disappointed
review: Did not activate.Â  I wish in the description of these 'apps' it said whether you'd have to pay a subscription fee or be subscribed to a cable service

title: Se Hablo Espanol?? If so you will like this for watching sports!
review: garbage, didn;t work well and the sports were in spanish for some reason. Useless

title: Great streaming service
review: Iâve tried several different streaming services and FuboTV has worked the best for us. We get lots of channels and most sports networks except for ESPN but thatâs not a game changer for us. I was using Roku to stream but had way too many issues with it. Switched back to my Amazon fire stick and have had no problems.

title: Misleading advertising
review: I did not want to pay for an additional TV service. I was searching for a way to view NBC which was deled from my current cable provider.Â  I never downloaded this app for the 7-day free trial.Â  I cannot locate the option to cancel. It is advertised that you may cancel at any time but how?Â  I deleted this app but received a receipt for the purchase in the amount of $.00 via email.Â  I fear my credit card will be automatically charged after 7 days even though I did not download the app. It should not be this difficult to cancel.Â  DO NOT review this app.Â  This is a nightmare!!

title: DVR Limitations
review: My only complaint, but it hindered us greatly was the inability to watch content that you were recording simultaneously.Â  Example, if you started recording something and then wanted to start viewing it perhaps 15-30 after it started, you couldn't.Â  You had to wait until about an hour after the entire program was recorded to watch.

title: Not bad, just not for me
review: The service is too expensive to be considered a cord cutting alternative. I realize it has tons of sports which are not cheap but I still don't think it's a good cord cutting option. The video quality is sub-par in my opinion. Despite having a very fast internet connection, the video seemed to buffer everytime I opened an event. Additionally, the video seemed to lag and get choppy during the fast moving times of sports games or TV. Overall the service is not bad, just not what I was looking for.

title: OK but no ESPN, ABC or Disney is a deal breaker. YTTV has more sports for less money.
review: Love that FuboTV has NFL Network and a 7-day guide, but hate that they do not carry ESPN, ABC, or anything else owned by Disney. I realize that they will raise prices if they ever add those, so I would hate that too. I do not recommend over YTTV which does have ESPN, ABC and Disney channels, more sports and unlimited DVR space included for less money.

title: Due diligence
review: They advertise all over the internet that you can get access to specific NFL games but when you sign up, they are nowhere to be found.....more costly than actual cable.

title: Much Needed Improvement
review: Stream had constant issues despite internet connectivity being consistent on fire stick.Didn't have the same issue via my phone so a bit odd to say the least.UI is clean cut and simple to navigate but still can't get over how much issues there are.

title: Constantly loses signal.
review: Paying $44 a month for fubo is ridiculous. It plays the selected channel for about 1 minute before it loses signal and I have to exit out to the main screen and reload the selected channel. I shouldnât have to do that with amount of money Iâm paying. It makes no sense that when it loses signal, it will not regain it again unless I reload the channel. I know itâs not my internet because I donât have problems with any other devices. Very unhappy.

title: Higher priced plans and Poor Navigation
review: I signed up for the week-long trial. I used once and cancelled the next day. Navigation is very poor and not user friendly. Has a good channel line-up, but cost is pushing the limits but now about the same as Hulu Live TV and Youtube TV. Just not willing to pay that much for a not-so-great experience.

title: Too expensive
review: I enjoyed this service, but in less than a year, they're raising the price $10/month for channels that don't interest me. I am ending my subscription this month as the price is more than my DirecTV used to charge me. Very disappointed and unable to get any response over the phone or via email to customer service. If you sign up now, your cost will increase in August by $10.

title: terrible
review: We're trying different streaming services. Fubo is by far the worst. It constantly hangs, and the picture is bad. It's also the most expensive. Terrible.

title: Local channel not available??
review: Current PlayStation Vue customer looking for replacement streaming service.Â  Decided to try Fubo because they offer BET channel.Â  After signing up for trial, I saw my local ABC station is unavailable.Â  I cancelled trial after two days.Â  Not sure why it isnât offered; tried to search rather internet for a reason to avail.Â  If you watch local TV, tread carefully.

title: Not worth the cost.
review: Cost is just too high.Â  Not a service I would pay for.Â  Alot of these live t.v. steaming packages have the same problems that caused me to cut the cord.Â  Channels I don't want are bundled with few I do at a price I'm not willing to pay.

title: Not as advertised
review: I have it one star because you can't give any fewer. I signed up for this to watch the Kentucky Derby, after they advertised they were airing it, only to find out they were only airing the preliminary races and not the derby. After the nightmare of the sign up process, I was very unhappy to find out I could not watch the race. Canceled immediately.

title: Content is good if you can get it working correctly
review: Works ok. Had problems with pausing a video and having it start completely over and you can't fast forward. Also had problems with it recording shows that were labeled wrong. I clicked on the show that I recorded and it's a different show, under the show I thought it was', title. I like the channels it has though... when they work and don't show the loading circle.

title: Best replacement for former Playstation Vue subscribers!
review: I used Playstation Vue for a couple of years but when they announced that they were ending the service, I switched to Fubo! Not only does it have everything that Vue had (except ABC & ESPN) but it is HALF the cost! Can't be more pleased with this App. Has all of your sports needs (except ESPN) covered! NFL Redzone is included!

title: Needs some work
review: Pricey! I have +DVRÂ  Many times the sound doesnât match the lips and when I stop and restart it the sound is still going and I canât get it to stop so I have to go onto a different network like amazon prime to make it stop then I can go back and restart it. Itâs a PAIN in the neck!Â  They need to fix that problem.

title: One Star
review: This app was not user friendly, it was difficult to maneuver from channel to channel

title: It's ok
review: Hate the fact you can't watch a channel while you scroll through another channel.Â  Also unlike youtube tv on your phone you can't watch it while you are multitasking using another app. Only plus it has the MSG channel.

title: has buffering issues
review: Tried watching sports, hgtv and a movie. In each case, one of two things would happen every 5-10 minutes1. video freezes while audio continues, then video "jumps" to the current location of the audio. You miss several seconds of video2. video and audio repeat the last several seconds of what you watched. So, as you're watching a show, suddenly you're rewatching the last 5 seconds or so. It happens quite oftenNB: have a dedicated 60 mpbs internet line; watching via FireTV Stick, located about 3 feet from the router. No other devices consuming wifi or internet at the time.I've since read that this is an issue with FuboTV. I don't experience these problems with Netflix, Prime video, Hulu, Youtube or when casting from a mobile deviceThat being said, the interface is horrible. I preferred my MediaOne (or whatever it was in those days) cable interface in the 90's to this. No search capability at all. Can't continue to watch a show while scrolling for another. No last channel or favorites concepts. So, in 2 days, prior to the end of the trial, I'll switch to Sling and compare.

title: Wasnât what I expected!
review: Was disappointed when It continually stalled when I used it. I Could not find many get programs I wanted to watch. I was hoping to see many college football games since I no longer subscribe to cable or direct TV.

title: Confusion
review: Along with many other web offers, I found this one to be very difficult to understand, and even more difficult to access. Plus, the terms, such as "when will my offer be renewed?" were very difficult to determine.

title: Would be nice, if it did anything.
review: Nothing worked. None of the links. The connection would time out trying to connect, in WiFi and without. When it finally loaded and I clicked on any of the channels, they said the link was broken. Definitely not worth $30 a month.

title: Cancelled trial subscription after a few hours
review: Although the price and offering sounded good at first, there were several show stoppers. There is no ABC service currently. I missed that when reviewing available channels. The web interface for fubo.tv would cause my browser to freeze. The additional charge for DVR services seemed excessive. I cancelled the trial subscription before I had a chance to give that a try.

title: Pic quality sub par for sports
review: Picture quality for sports not good at all. Worse than youtubetv which is poor as well. Picture looks less than 720 for most sporting events. They only have FOX 4K which isnât enough to get me to sign up at this time. They also donât have TBS, TNT, and regional FOX sports networks. Expensive and DVR is limited unless you want to pay even more. Will let free trial expire. May look into it in the future if 4K offerings are expanded.

title: NOOOO!!!
review: We never could get it downloaded.Â  Hopefully I have cancelled this app.Â  It's impossible to know.Â  There's no place to send and email to cancel the 7 day free-trial.Â  I intend to fight it if they charge me.

title: Very poor channel guide
review: Glitch. Glitch. Glitch. Buffering. Buffering. Buffering. Very poor channel guide. Worth the free 7 day trial ... after that, your wasting your money.

title: Scam do not order!
review: Can't cancel my "free" trial - they have done everything possible to scam money for subscription I don't want. Was just trying to get my dad on it to watch a football game, and now I can't get off of it.

title: Too much money for the few I'd watch
review: The stream quality wasn't great. Buggered and stalled from time to time even froze. My biggest problem is the price. $700 a yr for the same collection of channels everyone is offering of which you only watch maybe 10.

title: Too expensive
review: I found this service to be so-so and too expensive for the price/channels available.Â  Cord cutting is supposed to be cheaper than the cable companies.Â  Fubotv makes we want to go back to my cable box.

title: Did not like the user interface
review: Very annoying to watch part of a movie and then to come back later and not have that movie resume at the point you stopped.Â  Happened more than one and the forward feature was "unavailable".Â  Not my cup of tea.

title: Fubo tv may be pretty much be for soccer fans.
review: Fubo tv did not meet my expectations in any way. The cloud dvr especially sucked as it did not let me watch a recording while it recorded. It only let me do so after it was done which is ridiculous if you ask me. Not to mention some of the major free local networks not included. Hello Fubo, if I could but an HD antenna and get these, why would they not be part of the package???

title: SUCH A DISAPPOINTMENT
review: I didÂ  Free Trial hoping to be able to watch my NFL football team play, since it advertisements say that you can! WRONG! This is not much different than having your regular local TV Channels, UNLESS you want to pay extra for other channels, STILL NO WAY to watch my NFL games!! VERY DISAPPOINTED, CANCELLED FREE TRIAL AN HOUR AFTER SIGNING UP! WASTE OF TIME..

title: Fubo TV vs. Youtube TV
review: While my husband requires CNN Live and MSNBC Live, there is enough content on Amazon Prime ($13 monthly), Hulu ($15 monthly), and Peacock TV (Premium Membership $10 monthly w/no commercials).Â  Fubo TV at about $64 monthly is not worth the pricetag any more than Youtube TV is worth its $64 monthly nut providing CNN Live, MSNB Live and NBCSN (Premier League).

title: I would love this streaming service if.......
review: Rated it 3 stars because of the lack of ESPN.Â  The local and "cable" channel line up is solid - do you know I would actually pay more per month for this service if they offered ESPN?Â  Too many prime time events to miss with no ESPN - which is the deal breaker for me.Â  If and when they bring on ESPN, I'll be switching to fubo TV, for picture quality, ease of use and streaming quality.Â  If ESPN is not on your wish list, go with fubo TV.

title: Room For Improvement
review: The lack of major sports channels, and an interface that needs improvement are the main reasons I decided not to continue with FuboTV.Â  For example, when you navigate back to the Guide, you lose the present channel's sound and picture.

title: DON'T DO 7 DAY TRIAL VERY CONFUSING
review: DON'T DO 7 DAY TRIAL VERY CONFUSING doesn't Bring you to parts of the app where you cant get out of the trail until it shows up on your bank statement $64.00/monthly. And is somehow ties to ESPN. Even called tech support they had no answers??? Hours on the phone-still not resolved. More hours on the phone today. Major point; There is NO one place you can find everything you can find about ALL of your apps on Amazon five TV. SO if you get charged first get the bank transaction number. Then call Amazon and they say they will take it off.

title: Missing regular TV stations
review: No Pbs ch 11 no bounce stationNo WCIU ch 26 those are common stations on regular TVOther than that its a very good service!Id subscribe if they had regular tv stations

title: Best watch after mid-night
review: It is sad day for Soccer fans, especially for European soccer fans, who cut the cord and rely on streaming services. As of today, there are only two options in the market: Sling TV or Fubo TV. PlayStation Vue used to carry beIN Sports but dropped earlier this year. beIN sports are not even on the list for YouTube TV, Direct TV, or any other major streaming services. If you want to watch UEFA CL, La Liga, or English PL, etc., you are stuck.I have used Vue, Sling, Fubo - Vue is the best and Fubo is the worst, simply because the service is highly unreliable: 1) the streaming quality is like 480i (ok, maybe 720i if it is past midnight), totally destroying the joy of the sports if you are a fan 2) during busy hours, you will get the "spinning circle of death", the streaming just won't even start 3) the DVR recording space is extremely limited as compared to YouTube TV and Vue (both unlimited), and it happened regularly that Fubo TV only recorded half of the game or not recorded it at all despite your instructionI hope YouTube TV or Amazon add beIN Sport soon, I just can't wait to drop this horrible service.

title: Need To Learn Before Using
review: Being somewhat older than most, it will take me some time to get use to this streaming service. Has all the channels we want. I am not sure how to pull up a menu yet for listings.Â  Again, mostly me being new to streaming.

title: crashes, guide isn't running with the programs
review: once you select a program, if you want to watch something else and go back to the guide, it has to update to the current time. this takes time and you miss some of your program. sometimes the quality of the program is blurred, as I test my internet speed while this happens, my internet speed is 100+mps

title: Stop, go, Re wind, FF
review: Your buffering blows big time. Changing from Home, Sports, Movies, Guide, and Recordings is behind Direct, Charter, Spectrum and my rabbit eared antenna. It's 2020, bitches!! Hire programmers that can work algorithms, instead of the submicronic English lit majors you hired to meet your diversity quotient..

title: Inaccurate channel descriptions.
review: In the app description, it mentioned sports channels are based upon the zip code entered in the user account. This was not the case, and only local channels where I was currently watching at the time were available. Not worth it at all.

title: Don't be conned. Read the small print.
review: This is not good. Reinstated my account for $60+ to watch Man. U. vs LASK. Discovered it was only in Spanish. Even though the payment was still pending on my card, they refused to refund my payment. Be warned!

title: Every thing was good, but no CBS channel
review: Everything was good, but no CBS channel, no CW channel, the main reason I got it was to watch the Houston Astros on AT&T sports channel, but it doesn't look like there is going to be any baseball I canceled it

title: not meeting the expectations I was looking for.. ...
review: not meeting the expectations I was looking for ... have been having issues with signal and missed watching important soccer games .. still cannot reply upon it and I am now considering shifting to cable again

title: NO to Fubo
review: Fubo is a joke. Worst app/download I've ever used. Way over priced for the product provided. Beware.

title: Fubotv
review: It is not that easy to use as there are more steps in deleting the recordings and other functions - I was thinking of switching from Hulu to FuboTV but now I have to think over again.

title: Not the easiest to use
review: Kind of a pain to use.Â  With the fire stick I had to go to my computer to enter a code to get the video to work. Then when I tried to activate it on another tv (with another trip to my pc to enter a code) it killed the stream on my first tv even though it says you can watch on multiple devices at once.

title: Well worth it!!!
review: This has been perfect.Â  We were skeptical since they donât seem to have the following to convince us that it was a viable option.Â  However, in Hawaii, we lost CBS and FOX because of the inability of DirecTV to negotiate contracts and we had to find something.Â  This has worked out great!!!

title: Couldnât watch
review: This app is lame. We wanted to watch the World Cup. We click on this app and it requires you to go online and enter a code. I was using our TV thru amazon fire and didnât want to mess with getting out my laptop. I hate apps / shows that advertise on amazon fire but you really canât watch them - itâs frustrating

title: What a Joke !!!!
review: You have got to big kidding me !!!! Cut the the cordÂ  they say , cable too expensive .... over $50.00 plus dollars to even get to watcha decent tv show and forget sports even more money .... movies old reruns same as tv shows .. What a load of CRAP !!!!

title: So far so good
review: I think I get more for my money with Fubo than Sling. I'm getting my local baseball games (which Sling stopped carrying in August), CBS which I was paying extra for AND The Weather Channel.

title: I can't get it to work
review: It keeps asking me to sign in, does not, will not recognize any email I provide. Will not allow me to set up an acct. Useless app as far as I am concerned. Going to uninstall it.

title: Fubo- not as good as PlayStation Vue.
review: Fubo has the ability to stream in 1080, but other than that, it is pretty primate compared to Slng, DirecTV Now, and PlayStation Vue. The worst part of it is the DVR recording set up. It can only be done using a computer. So far, I haven't figured out how to set up a recurring session. The likelyâ reason is because the limit is only 3 recordings. I switched from PlayStation Vue because of a 2 month 40% cut offer from Fubo. After a day of Fubo, I would say 40% off isn't enough.

title: Not for Cord Cutters!
review: I heard I could watch NFL Football games on Fubo TV, I just didnât realize it cost as much as it did. In the end I decided to ânotâ sign up with them, so I canât give any good or bad testimony.

title: This app charges you same as any cable company would
review: This app alone with the cheapest package is about the same price as basic cable . if you get a decent sports package it can cost twice as much as satellite tv.Â  However one single good thing is No contracts its month to month payments cancel anytime

title: Not cheap
review: They are not any cheaper than cable or Verizon for same number of channels. They should also disclose cost on TV ads. I deleted as soon downloading and seeing the prices on s as fire TV

title: Very little 4K content and only gave me HD.
review: Tried to get the 4K super bowl broadcast but would not give me the 4K HDR stream. The app was just reporting my screen size as 1920x1080 which is just HD resolution. Other 4K streams on fuboTV were only HD as well. Not entirely sure it was all fuboTVs fault. May be a problem with the fire stick 4K. I tried everything to get this to work and I know a lot about this stuff. I finally got the 4K HDR stream by just installing the FOX Sports app on the fire stick. That worked great.

title: Unsatisfatory
review: Never able to stream it. Am not inter stead in it. Too much trouble and Amazon Customer Service could not help or resolve the problem. I do not want to subscribe to it.

title: Quite Pricey!
review: I thought I would try Fubo tv since I just cut the cord. I just wanted the Paramount Network channel. $54.99 per month is a bit pricey though. I think Iâll be canceling prior to the end of the 7 day trial.

title: High price
review: It's one of the most expensive streaming services it does provide the channels we want but the menu is terrible no one thing bad it's just a bad menu set up all around

title: Try to get a free trial before you commit. Might not be worth it.Â  nightmare for me.
review: The only app/streaming service I have that constantly freezes.Â  Also, if you are watching a live event that runs past the scheduled broadcast time slot, you cannot exit the channel and relaunch the live feed. your only option is to launch the replay which starts from the beginning of the broadcast with NO fast forward capabilities.Â  The stream was freezing throughout the 3rd period of an NHL broadcast and I could not relaunch the live broadcast. I constantly missed the last minutes of NHL games.Â  my frustration level with this service is thru the roof. good luck with this service.

title: Way too many commercials
review: More than 20 commercials in a one hour show. Considering the monthly cost I canât see how they can justify that much advertising without the ability to skip commercials.

title: Would be great if it were reliable.
review: Got the trial a couple days ago to see how reliable it was. There's a great variety of sports channels to watch from, and the mobile app is really neat, but while watching Brazil x Colombia the app experienced an error and I couldn't watch anymore games that day, so all in all a complete waste of time and disappointing to say the least. The firecast TV app also displayed the wrong time zone for some reason and wasn't as refined as the mobile app.

title: Best of the bunch for me
review: Tried most other streaming services and this works the best for me with FireStick. Your expected "Cable" type channels including your Locals. Lots of sports channels but No NFL. Best DVR of the bunch WITH FF/RWD! No extra added commercials. BUT it doesn't have an easy way to set up a Repeat/Series Recording Schedule :(

title: Cuts out of what it is airing-not worth the $$.
review: Was consider changing from Hulu since price was going up but and this offered NFL.Â  Picture had a slight lag and Fubo stopped showing the game when there was 5 minutes left at the end!Â  Tried to go back and Fubos app said game had ended and it hadnât!Â  If thatâs the way they air, I dint want it -so cancelled!!!

title: Just OK
review: This is the first live streaming service we have tried. The channel selection is almost exactly what we want, with the exception of a local non-network channel and ESPN. The main problem is changing channels. As far as we can tell, you have to go return to the channel menu each time you want to change channels. Very inconvenient compared to DirecTV, which is just too expensive.

title: Tricks to install on FireStick
review: One Star rating for being highly ranked in Stick "free" apps, but requiring a monthly subscription that's more than the cost of the hardware. That's not really a free app.

title: More than I needed
review: It was a bit more expensive than I was looking for especially when I had to at extra to get the PAC-12 network. I will be looking at Sling for a lower cost option.

title: Nice pic lousy DVR
review: The picture quality is great but the cloud recording did not show where you are. Also, the channels are difficult to get to. Finally, loading on my phone killed all streaming video. Not sure why.

title: 2nd Month and the Price is Raised
review: One month into it and they're raising the price to 64.99 a month so I can watch things I don't care to watch! As soon as baseball season is over so is Fubo!

title: Poor Signal Constant Scolling :-(
review: Poor streaming signal quality.Â  I have Netflix and Amazon Prime movies and have no problems viewing movies without weak signal scrolling.Â  With FuboTV movies and recordings I find that viewings are constantly being interrupted by a weak signal and constant scrolling.Â  Not happy at all.Â  I'm thinking of terminating my service.

title: Lots of good channels
review: A great alternative to Vue. Only thing I have trouble with is the DVR. Some shows allow you to record new episodes of the series, but we usually use it to watch wrestling and there is no Record Series option for any of the shows.

title: Insecure

title: Not impressed

Navigation is a bit akward .Â  Will most likely join later this year.

title: overpriced

I have an fire stick and watch Pluto tv tubi ..for news!!

Also, no ABC/ESPN/Disney family of channels. And it's too damn expensive for what you get & how polished the Smart TV app is.

review: Although I like the selection of Fubo soccer coverage, that is where my praise ends. None of my other streaming apps perform so poorly. The incessant buffering while watching live TV is just terrible. Imagine trying to watch Redzone on Sunday and ooops too bad, you cant because today fubo just doesn't work today. Or right in the middle of a match, the screen seizes up and you miss the rest of the game because the app keeps quitting. That's Fubo. Ive had it almost a year and it has not improved at all. In fact the same problems persist.Â  The interface is unwieldy and wastes alot of time just trying to go back and forth between channels. Sadly even the DVR goes into buffering fits that just leave you exasperated. HUGE disappointment.

title: A ripp off
review: I do not recommend it, I gave it 1 star because I can't give 0, very frustrating to sign in, is a hustle. I am in the 7 day trial I will not continue. ItÂ  took me more than 3 times to sign in, trying to watch the clasico. I went back to bein on sling tv, which is not that good neither, but I think I preferred it over Fubo. II took me some time to sign up, I kept receiving a message saying that my email was invalid, finally I was able to sign up, then I went through a lot to of problems to sign in, then after I signed in it went off, I had to do it all over again,Â  I was in and off again, I went back to Sling TV again it is not a 100% better than Fubo but a lot better I got Bein on Sling TV and I was able to watch El Clasico with no problem. I read negative reviews on Fubo TV I should had paid attention. Do not waste your time and money on Fubo.Up date, the trial period passed with out I being able to watched anything on Fubo TV. But beforeÂ  I finally was able to sign in, after I received an email offering me $10.00 credit for my trouble forwards the 1st, month membership fee . Well, I didn't see any credit on my account and just after that a genius at Fubo TV changed my password sent me an email indicating to follow the info in the email to sign in, The only info in the email was my email, no password or link to reset my password, tried to reset my password myself, I received a message indicating that an email will be sent with a link to reset my password, never received it and I tried several times, no response from Fubo either, Terrible Customer and Technical service the worst most frustrating site and service I had come across in my life. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MOST IMPORTANTLY YOUR MONEY!!!!!!

title: $20 for first 2 months is the only good thing.
review: The best thing about Fubo is the price during the special price. 2 Months for $20 can not be beat. They make it far too difficult to record and watch stuff though. Every time you want to change channels you must go back to main screen and start from the top. The lack of channels is also a problem for us. I like that they have a few must have channels, but the ones missing hurt badly when nothing you want to watch is on those 3 or 4 channels and like I said before, Recording is too much trouble to even mess with. So it gets 3* from me and that is being generous only due to price during the first 2 months. Will go a different route soon.

title: I can't watch my NFL team on the road
review: One of the reasons I wanted to give this a try is to watch Pac-12 and Seahawk games when I was in Palm Springs.Â  It looks like I will be able to watch Pac-12 games, but not the Seahawks, and so I think I'll find another service that will work for me.Â  I'm disappointed, because it worked well.

title: Crap
review: Awful quality. Sometimes it DVRs the wrong game. Sometimes the recorded game skips around every few seconds, so that it's impossible to watch. Sometimes it skips ahead and shows you the later score, and then skips back, ruining the game. For the cost, I would expect more. In my opinion, this is just another example of a company for which there is no real competitor exploiting its position in the market by delivering terrible service, just because they can get away with it. You're better off going to your favourite team's website and subscribing to their streaming service if they have one. It's cheaper and more reliable.

title: Free trials are the new way to scam people.
review: Free trials are the new way to scam people. They purposely make it confusing and provide little record on your account actions whether you cancelled or not

title: Find something better
review: Tried this out as a discounted service. The amount of channels were disappointing and the quality of the TV froze and pixelated often. Watching LIVE football games also lagged quite a bit behind LIVE TV.Â  Canceled my service after the trial price ended.

title: Cable TV provider requirements make me mad
review: Not real happy that yet another app on Amazon requires a cable TV provider in order to access it. Wasn't able to use it, so I deleted it and I have moved on.
