review: All the streaming apps through Amazon Prime are a waste! Once you download and get to feeling real good that you can access other programming, you must log in to your TV Provider.... Direct TV, Dish, Frontier, etc. Well if i already had a TV provider, what the hell would i need this app for? Stupid Stupid Stupid! Simply Put.... if you want this, you must already be subscribing to a TV service that offers this.... so basically it's not needed.

title: Itâs a streaming app that did what it was suppose to.
review: I downloaded this app because the garbage DirecTV app wouldnât stream the in market baseball games (Mets) that I was paying to see. After downloading the app, you click on the tv provider and you can watch the games. Not sure why some providers donât include the option while streaming on your phone or other device.

title: Misleading
review: Don't purchase the NBC Sports Gold Premier League Pass - it is misleading. You get the impression that you can watch all 380 games live without a cable or satellite connection. But guess what? You can only watch 140 games live. For the other games, the app takes you to a screen where you have to login with a cable/satellite provider. In other words, you can't watch all the games without a cable or satellite service.

title: Horrible! Only allows 30mins of live watch time.
review: I wish I could give this zero.Â  I downloaded to be able to watch the Olympics on my Fire TV. I only got 30mins of live watch time and then you had to purchase something.Â  What a rip off. I bought a cheap antenna for my TV and watched it that way.Â  It's not worth downloading this app, I immediately deleted it.

title: Nbc stinks
review: Directv, Nbc and Tenga cannot reach an agreement so I have missed 2 Steelers games and the most recent monday nigjt football on Directv.Â  Tried the app but want to tie me back into diredtv to login to watch. Of course denied access.Â  No use for nbc in my life.

title: ONLY USABLE WITH CABLE
review: When trying to activate the app, you are required to sign in with your carrier.Â  They are not talking about the carrier of your internet, rather which company allows usage of apps on your devices.Â  The Sports Gold is the app for streaming devices i.e. Roku, Fire TV, Apple TV, etc.

title: Thumbs down for NBC sports
review: NBC sports is a scam. We shouldnât have to pay extra to watch supercross or motocross live. You guys are ruining the sport by holding the coverage at ransom for no reason. Find a better way to sell ad space and bring coverage back live and without restriction

title: DO NOT SUNSCRIBE.
review: If I could give this zero stars, I would. We are in the process of trying to get our money back. We had been happily watching premier league soccer on nbc sports until they rolled out this stupid subscription. We ONLY subscribed because we were unable to watch a game that we did not want to miss. We were under the impression that we would have access to every single game via Amazon/NBC Sports gold. NOT TRUE. Half of the Boxing Day games are unavailable on replay...the biggest match day of the year. ð YOU ARE DOING IT WRONG NBC/AMAZON.

title: have to have an existing cable account to access, tortures you running same commercials excessively
review: love watching Premier league soccer on this ,but frustrating when you have to keep logging on with an existing cable tv account (I use my son's account) to watch. great for the games, drives you nuts to see the same d---m commercials to the point that I actually hate the products and people when they are between games or events

title: A total and complete waste of time
review: First, you get a 20 minute preview after download.Â  I intended to watch the closing ceremonies but they were longer than 20 mins.Exactly the same feed as NBC broadcast.Â  Commercials are just full-boarded, no moving video and no audio.Â  Sound quality worse than cable.NBC continues to set the bar for the rest of the industry.Â  No one does it worse.

title: Way too expensive
review: The streaming and content is good. Itâs the outrageous price you have to pay for each genre of sports. They could at least throw in some general games and things for the price required for one section. I love motocross but I wonât get suckered into paying $100 to watch it next year.

title: Disappointed.
review: Wanting to watch a sports program on something larger than my computer screen, I downloaded the NBC Sports app to my Fire TV.Â  When I tried to activate the app, it refused to accept my login information.Â  After several attempts, I gave up, uninstalled the app and went back to watching on my small computer screen.

title: Two thumbs down
review: It isn't Amazon's fault.Â  All of these content providers that require cable or satellite subscriptions needed to wake up and smell the coffee.Â  People are tired of paying for channels/content they will never watch, and being taken to the cleaners to boot.Â  Here's a novel idea for a business model: Give people a real choice about content, charge them reasonably to access those choices, then watch the money roll in.Â  Unfortunately, that will put a lot of marginal (read fringe) content out of business.Â  Too bad.

title: Doesn't work on Fire TV
review: Spent a good 45 minutes today trying to get this to work. It made me get an activation code. Then it made me log into my comcast account. Then it said I had successfully activated. But then when I try to watch anything, it says it isn't included in my cable package. NBC is basic cable, people. What a useless waste of time. Was hoping to watch some of the Olympics. If it isn't included, it should say that at the beginning before putting me through the whole useless activation process. Really disappointing and makes me think less of the Fire TV (which honestly hasn't really wowed me yet).

title: This App with its restrictions is useless for these people
review: This app only works for folks with a cable contract.Â  The market for the app(people that would use it) are the Hulu,Netflix,FireTV,Apple Tv subscribers.Â  This App with its restrictions is useless for these people. NBC is not able to be viewed be a growing population, yet they do nothing about it.Â  I almost do not miss NBC anymore.

title: What Happened!
review: Disappointing access! We missed all of the first half of the Manchester United soccer game we had been looking forward to. Our son said the station had changed access passwords & there was no way to make contact. After our son finally managed to get the program running it still cut out for a few minutes during the second half. Hoping it will be better next time.

title: Makes no sense
review: It makes no sense why you need a cable login for broadcast tv. The ads still play. Itâs no different than tuning in the old fashioned way except with the small convenience of not hooking up an antenna.

title: Majority of games unavailable
review: As everyone else mentioned, you do need to have a cable subscription to access this app. However, even after I entered the cable info, which has the NBC sports package, I get errors when I choose to watch games ("Unable to play this asset"). This mostly happens for EPL. When I log in through my computer, the match plays as it should, but it will not load through the firestick app. Very frustrating.

title: Terrible
review: Donât waste your time even if you are cutting the cord. Easily 30% of content is commercials one cannot skip. Just DVR the programs and delay your watching by 30 minutes: at least you can skip the odious commercials

title: Disappointing...
review: More cr*p from NBCsn. Doesn't work in unison with Spectrum and I suspect with others.Â  Not swiping cable either, to the tune of $100+.Neither my Fire 10 or phone work correctly. Comeon NBCSN & Spectrum, get it together, your app licks.

title: App is OK, but can't use without a package subscription
review: The app seems OK, but unfortunately you have to have a streaming service subscription, with NBC Sports as part of a larger package.Â  You do not seem to be able to subscribe just to NBC Sports as you can with HBO and other providers through Amazon.Â  In our case, to get NBC Sports as part of our satellite subscription, we would have had to pay 3X each month.Â  It's a shame you can individually subscribe to HBO but not NBC Sports.

title: Not working for weeks now
review: I keep getting "an error has occurred" when trying to access.

title: NBC failed these Olympics and the athletes...
review: This has been the worst Olympic coverage EVER. The Games have been good but NBC seems to have only about 6 advertisers in the Northeastern market so they play the same ads every 10 minutes. The announcing has been terrible. Too much BS and not enough competition. Puff pieces on every athlete that ever suffered from a hangnail or got hugged too much or not enough or sad childhood or blah blah blah...just awful coverage. These are athletes judged on their abilities to perform not Kardishians being judged on back stories, fashion choices or political agendas...

title: Terrible app
review: After the first quarter of the game, which had terrible picture quality and froze often, the app quit working and never got going again. Not an option moving forward as far as Iâm concerned.

title: Unhappy
review: I thought I would be able to get this using my Fire Stick and my HD antenna. Unfortunately it does not. It requires me to have some sort of cable or satellite service that I pay for. Iâm very unhappy about this! I got the NBC SN when I had satellite, and the point is to eliminate that expense!

title: I was not satisfied with the coverage of the Olympics
review: I was not satisfied with the coverage of the Olympics. Happy to see Katie Couric but didn't like the coverage on the events. I couldn't tell what was beginning what was ending. Everything in pieces. Previous years you could turn on the channel and watch olympics 24/7.

title: Amazon Fire & NBC need to Talk! Not working!!!
review: Was able to see 30 minutes "free" with LOTS of commercials and then when we to tried hooking up to anazon fire, it did not allowing us to even with passwords and multiple attempts. Crazy thing is I can watch live on my ipad for free that took 15 seconds to load app. So two questions why did I pay for amazon fire and why isNBC is play commercial every 5 minutes are they making it such a pain to do so? If I was sending tons of money on my commercials I would want as much exposure as posible! Not sure who is the stupidest in this situation, me for buying amazon fire or NBC? Please advise.

title: Pleased but Disappointed
review: I looked forward to seeing the KC Chiefs playing their last preseason game against the Packers. Upon "revving" up the fire stick and the NBC Sports station, I found that the game was NOT being streamed live! Although, I was not pleased being unable to watch what I wanted, but I cannot deny the great quality provided by the service.

title: useless app, activation code comes on the screen on ...
review: useless app, activation code comes on the screen on Tv and you enter it into your laptop, then it says you need another code so you type that in, can't get past this using Amazon Fire TV box. After 3 dAY OF trying I deleted it. I installed the app on my table and it works. I have installed 30 something apps on the fire tv box, this is not my first rodeo

title: Not worth the effort
review: Olympic coverage is constantly buffering, even during the commercials. And when content is playing, half the time the screen is so blurry it's practically unwatchable. All of these problems occur even though I have average speeds of ~150Mbps, so the bandwidth problem is on NBC's end. Additionally, the app interface is repetitive and difficult to navigate to the content I want to actually see.

title: Frustrating in the Extreme â- Shame on NBC
review: OMG how frustrating!Â  I just wanted to watch the Olympics, a few days every few years, but NBC decided I must have a cable provider.Â  Ok, I ordered a month of Sling.Â  But I have to reauthenticate EVERY SINGLE TIME i want to use the app.Â  And it never works the first time.Â  I want NBC to know that this is leaving a bad taste for the whole network.Â  VERY UNHAPPY.

title: Useless app
review: This app is virtually useless unless you pay for cable or satellite TV service. And if you do then what are you doing trying to watch it on Amazon for? All apps that require paid TV service should be band from the App Store. The reason you bought the Amazon Fire stick in the first place was so that you wouldn't have to pay for TV service. And if you do pay for service you'd be watching that service, not trying to get it on the fire stick.

title: Pain to constantly validate your tv subscription
review: App works but having to constantlyÂ  validate your tv subscription is a pain. Fix that or just make it available and more people would use it.

title: Great for watching highlights and events; Opening Ceremony is locked and it does not allow to pay per view; requires a cable sub
review: Allows you to view all sports events and highlights.Â  Really like this app.Does not allow you to view the opening ceremonies or live events, nor gives you the option of paying for the programming that is locked and requires a cable subscription.Â  Seems they are still holding to the OLD DEAD model of cable TV for as long as they can and haven't understood the future is different and I should be allowed to pay for the content I want, and refuse to buy a cable subscription...

title: Worst TV app ever.
review: Although I was able to authenticate through my Playstation Vue subscription, the app is absolute crap. There is no rewind feature, and the viewer is inundated with the same commercial every few minutes - often interrupting the athlete's performance. Note to sponsors - I WILL NEVER, EVER BUY TIDE OR SHOP AT OLD NAVY AGAIN BECAUSE I'M SO SICK OF HEARING YOUR NAME. Complete epic fail!!! ð

title: Hulu has it
review: The only way to get the Olympics that I found so far is to Hulu and that will give you NBC Sports it cost $50 for the month and then you can just cancel it works for me. I don't understand why Amazon and Netflix don't offer it at least let you sign up with NBC for a fee.

title: Bummer
review: My husband wanted this channel really bad with the Fire stick but unless you are streaming TV with the Fire stick you can' t watch it

title: I downloaded this APP to watch the winter Paralympics because ...
review: I downloaded this APP to watch the winter Paralympics because according to CBS website, its where it was showing.Â  Well, NOPE.Â  At first it showed on the preview but when I clicked on it, no access.Â  VERY disappointing since my brother was in the snowboarding event and I didn't get to see him compete.

title: Doesn't function.
review: Keeps asking me for my provider to sign in.Â  I gave NBC sports $100 because I have no provider.Â  Contacted them twice.Â  No response.Â  It cut me off just minutes into the race.Â  That's 3 weeks in a row it has done that.

title: I do not watch sports
review: over rated, over paid, not interested in a players political bs. NBC & all other sports channels should condemn players bad attitudes & shameless behavior. pay the military what they make

title: Its just cable on Fire Stick
review: No point if you do not have cable - you get a few minutes preview and then poofThese companies need alternatives to cable = the futurePay per view?

title: I wasn't happy to have to download something to watch golf!!!!
review: I am upset to have to download something to watch golf. I think you'll lose a bunch of followers if you continue with Peacock or any other download.I know I won't go through the frustration again.

title: Glitchy
review: I very much like that I can stream Sunday night football... but it is SO glitchy!Â  Often throughout programming, it buffers and repeats what has already been played - which in and of itself is annoying but then when this happens a few times, the lag between what is being watched and real time is considerable. When they figure out how to fix this, I think itâll be a decent app.

title: Not good unless you have cable servy
review: I was hoping to be able to access the content but Iâm still required to have cable service. I would pay a monthly fee to be able to watch sports but the only option is to pay above $30-40 to be able to access sports.

title: VERY POOR
review: I'm not gojjng to pay for it. Once you download and open to watch, pick out something and start it you get this 30 minute countdown timer. It's called a preview, then you have to pay. Very poor not letting people know it will be a pay app

title: Failed to show all three American men fs at olympics!
review: Olympic coverage is bizzare. Switching in mid event, sometimes to another channel, sometimes at a later time. The 4 hour blocks make it necessary to waste tape space on sledding to get SOME of a skating event. And not showing Vincent Zhou's skate? There were THREE American men competing. Was is too difficult to show them all?

title: NOT RELIABLE FOR LIVE CONTENT ON FIRE TV STICK
review: While the app is technically "working" it is painful to get content to update and when it does, seems inaccurate.Â  on live and upcoming, nbc graphic with 4 simulcast/simulstreams to olympics, selecting a different top left icon, doesn't resolve the problem, simply takes me to all olympic content.Â  i can see live & upcomingÂ  women's british open, etc. but no live nascar.Â  i must continually sign out/in and re "activate" to get new content to display.Â  i have restarted my fire tv stick several times, i do have access via provider.Â  i am able to confirm through a web browser the programming and content.Â  it is simply to unreliable to use with fire tv stick for "live" content.

title: Doesnât work and get no customer support
review: I downloaded this to watch the Blazer games, however, I have not been able to get it to work so I have spent $35 bucks on a season pass that I have not been able to use yet. I contacted âcustomer supportâ for help and the only thing âEricâ could do is accuse me of downloading the wrong app., (uh I have the right app genius, how about providing some real support). Anyhow, not happy since havenât been able to actually use it and have received zero support.

title: One Star
review: The app is free but you must have a cable or sat subscription. Why bother?

title: Great app for cordcutters.
review: App has access to many different sports events and allows you to go back and watch events that you missed on one of NBC 's sports lineups. The only problem I have had is having to restart a streamed program that I was watching abruptly stopped and closed the app.

title: Pixelated POS
review: Absolute waste of money. We pay for the NBC Sports Gold so we can watch bike and track (and the olympics). The app never retains our filters or preferred settings. Volume doesnât stay constant when switching to commercials - oh yeah, commercials! The same ones over and over and over... The app will randomly crash on occasion (at the worst moments!! And then you have to start the video all over again) and is pixelated (not an internet issue, all other apps/streaming work fine). Very frustrating.

title: Did not allow for local NBC SN network - missed the game
review: We are switching off of Fios onto Youtube TV, and cannot get a specific NBC NC channel when there's a blocked game.So I tried through the NBC SN app.Womp. Missed the game. Thanks. :/

title: poor design
review: if i am watching nbcSn and Premier League Live is on.Â  When a soccer match starts on nbcSn (the same channel) a screen pops up saying "coverage has concluded" and it has...on Premier League Live...but i didnt change channels...it should just continue on with coverage of the damn channel.Â  Instead, i have to walk by the TV see that coverage has concluded and by the time i go back to the menu and find the match i want to watch...ive missed 15 minutes.Â  Its just a poor design.

title: And he's on it!
review: Since we are all banned from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway this year, NBCSG at least brings much of the action to the flat screen. Worth 40 bucks?Â  When the alternative is being ignorant about the teams and cars come race day, I went for it.

title: not worth it
review: got this for football season and really have limited amount of games.Â  not worth the price in my opinion. I wouldn't waste theÂ  money if I knew then what I know now

title: Pitiful Coverage of the Olympics
review: The Olympic coverage is pitiful. It is not about the commentators but the athletes. The talk incessantly over the performance & the music & it becomes a jumble that is uncomfortable to witness. They also manipulate the coverage that is history by the time they choose to show it.

title: Very poor picture quality
review: We downloaded for the Super Bowl because we do not pick up NBC through antenna. The entire game was very grainy. It was as if we were watching the game through an old analog TV from 1988. It also had moments where it had to buffer, but that wasnât too bad. I just donât understand why the picture quality was so poor.

title: useless!!
review: wanted to see my UK soccer matches.couldNOT interface at all.No proper instructions could be found!!will cancel

title: Indy 500 coverage was pathetic!!!
review: Can't believe I paid $40 and had to watch commercial after commercial and interrupting the race. The race window should be larger than the advertiser window.

title: Came through when DISH didn't
review: I was hesitant to try NBC Sports because of all the terrible experiences I had with FOX sports.Â  My fears were unjustified.Â  We enjoyed the game.Nice work

title: False Advertising at it's best
review: They tout you can watch the NHL Playoffs on the app.. Only problem is that you can't.. Unless you pay for their PREMIUM service.Â  Something they don't mention in the NHL Ads..

title: Amazon and the NFL suck.
review: Got it for the Cowboy game.Â  Went through the steps, logged in with my cable company where I get my internet, it said "success" you are now connected and can watch NBC Sports!Â  Freaking liars.Â  Apparently I have to have TV as well to access it.Â  IF I HAD TV I WOULD NOT HAVE BOUGHT THE FIRE TV FROM AMAZON!!!!!!!!Â  BUNCH OF DAMN CROOKS.Â  Like I am going to go down that road again.Â  Piss on the NFL.Â  Done with them.

title: This was a disservice to pro Motocross and Supercross.
review: This was one of the weakest strems I've paid for. Usability was a challenge. When it stopped showing the main competition, it went to still shots and it was hard to know where things were in the competition next. There was only background sound. The interface was very large on the best of equipment, even with commercial internet from my business. When Supercross went to NBC with this program it lost a lot of viewers and I understand why.

title: Waste of Time.
review: Why would I need this App if I already have a tv provider. Waste of time and space. It asks you to register with your cable or satelite tv provider. No need for this if you already have cable tv.

title: NBC SPORTS FEELS LIKE A SCAM
review: When we got our first fire stick (1st gen), we didn't need to provide who our cable provider was in order to watch the content. Now with the new fire tv sticks, it asked us about permissions and now we're limited on what we can watch. Very disappointed.

title: Not worth the trouble
review: Many technical difficulties getting it setup for events stayed we could watch at no charge.Â  Once setup and select the event we wanted, app stated game was not available in our area.Â  Deleted and got a different sports app.Â  Not worth the aggravation!

title: No cable/dish provider, can't get this network.
review: I don't have cable. I was hoping I could use the Fire Stick to get this network. However, you have to have a cable provider to be able to get this network.Â  Waste of time.

title: Slightly disappointing
review: using it for the Olympics and find the process awkward. The highlights and full event items are not listed in newest first order, so I constantly have to scroll across to get to the most recent events. When watching a series of clips, sometimes the app sends me back to the first one in the list instead of continuing forward. Some events have no commentary which is either nice, or difficult if you want to really understand what is going on. It is fair but not fantastic. I feel a little let down.

title: Cable provider is not supported
review: This app is one that you need to sign in under your cable provider for it to work. My cable provider, Charter/Spectrum is not supported for this app so I am unable to use it. Very disappointed!

title: What a waste of time and energy
review: This app does not work unless you already have it on cable or satellite!Â  The reason we wanted it was because we were not gong to ever be tied to those expensive companies again.This is a why bother app.Â  Don't waste your time.

title: Not useful since NBC won't take the activation code
review: Loaded this on my FIRE-TV and went to the NBCSports dot COM/Activate page.Â  Selected FIRE TV and XFINITY; No matter what I tried, NBC will not take the activation code.Â  Rebooted the FIRE, requested new code multiple times, nothing.Â  Highly disappointing.

title: Streaming needs a lot of work
review: absolutely abysmal streaming experience, granted it was the superbowl, however one would think NBC sports would be prepared.The delays were 3-6 minutes, occasionally longer, and there was a buffering every 45 seconds.Read that again...every...45...seconds...Astonishingly poor experience

title: Purchased the Fire Stick to watch 2016 Olympics on my ...
review: Purchased the Fire Stick to watch 2016 Olympics on my TV.Â  I have the app on my android devices and can watch live events full coverage and complete archived events.Â  However, with the Fire Stick, I can only watch highlights from NBC Sports coverage.Â  Even after I logged in with my cable provider and entered the required code.Â  The stick works for NetFlix, but I already had a device the ran NetFlix.Â  I feel I was cheated because there was no indication that I could not use this app for the desired purpose.Â  It has the same logo, the same name.Â  But it's NOT the same app.

title: More show for NBC ratings than sport!
review: The format presented by NBC in Olympic coverage is a turn off and its focus on events is scatter shot... The personal stories before and after each and every event are tiresome and cut into coverage of the sport itself. Sadly in the end the coverage is all showbiz and little of the sport itself!

title: App does not work
review: Paid for the gold PLL pass for the app and it suddenly stopped loading. Keeps saying An Error Has Occured. Will not allow sign in. Customer service keeps telling me to do same thing over and over.

title: Worthless
review: I have Time Warner for basic channels, but don't want to pay a ton for channels I won't need.Â  Turns out, since I don't subscribe to the package that includes a bunch of garbage channels that also includes NBC Sports, I can't use this app. I know it's a CYA for the providers so they can keep people attached to cable, but I'm just going to cancel it all and get one of these small internet only providers for a quarter of the price if I can't watch on here. Look at all the add revenue they're missing on the Olympics by blocking anyone without a higher tier sports package.

title: NBC sports
review: This channel is not that great. They play games by carrying some of the games and not the rest. So you have to purchase another channel. Would not recommend.

title: You want to stand alone, cut the cord. Baaaah sheep
review: Need to make this stand alone and cut the cable bill. This is the way of The future. This app is useless without your cable provider so itâs just useless.

title: Waste of money
review: Waste of money!Â  NBC sports has terrible camera work, horrible commentary, and you watch a blank screen instead of commercials.....

title: Free preview time limits
review: I wanted to see if I could get the Sunday night NFL game.Â  I can never get NBC on the airwaves in Orlando, FL.Â  No problem with the other networks.Â  You get 45 minutes free, but if you log out, the timer keeps going, which SUCKS!!

title: useless
review: I used the supplied codes two time and could not get on to watch the hockey game; just a waste of time and very disappointing. How do I delete this site from my TV?

title: After I downloaded the app I found out you have ...
review: After I downloaded the app I found out you have to have a cable provider before you can watch the Olympics with this.Â  I am a cord cutter and refuse to pay $150 for cable tv when I may get to watch 6hours a week of television.Â  I get all I need over the air and with my Fire TV box, I can stream lots of movies.Â  &(^%**^&^ NBC!!!Why did NBC not put an in App purchase so I could have paid to watch all the coverage on the event....no that would have made too much sense!

title: JOKE OF AN APP!
review: Wanted to stream the nfl game and it only provides a 45 minute preview?Â  I'll be god damned if I'm gonna pay to watch something that should be broadcast locally!Â  It's no wonder people resort to hacking into broadcasts!

title: Didn't work for me
review: I'm not sure whether it was my internet connection or the NBC Sports feed, but the Super Bowl was buffering so badly that it was 10 to 15 minutes behind over-the-air broadcast before halftime.Â  I eventually gave up and watched the game on an older TV with an indoor over-the-air antenna.

title: Very disappointed!
review: I called Amazon to find out about upgrading my fire stick so I could see swimming and gymnastics. 2.5 hours later... I found out local NBC channels are not available. I spoke to Amazon, fire stick, NBC, then Sling. How about a message that this channel is not available in my area when I click on it instead of having me go through all the activate this channel... Then not being able to connect online, which led me to try to do it over the phone, no one knows what to do then pass me on to someone else over and over? Very disappointed!

title: Not useful to watch sports on.Â  Very frustrating.
review: Very inconsistent and frustrating to watch sports on.Â  Videos regularly don't load or hang midway through.Â  Also requires payment to, in theory, watch a limited selection of heavily curated videos.

title: Waste of time
review: I may cancel my prime membership over the difficulty using this app. It's useless to watch and right before a game starts, it's throws up a requirement to enter my log in information for my provider, which I don't have any longer. Total waste of my time and effort. Amazon has to do a better job of explaining what is included in prime and what is not, and what can be accessed.Not happy at all

title: I tried to watch a Nascar race when logged in ...
review: I tried to watch a Nascar race when logged in with a provider account.Â  It kept telling me that my parental controls would not allow me to watch.Â  They were all turned off.Â  The app absolutely did not work for me at all.

title: Bad quality.
review: This particular channel had bad stream quality and picture quality. Other channels streamed just fine on my gigabit connection. All except this one.

title: Amazon Fire Stick Download
review: Amazon Fire Stick Download.Â  It's either a live game, or you watch it the next day.Â  Some sports talk shows too.Â  That's it.

title: Not my cup of tea!
review: Have to watch everything all the way through. You canât download anything and if you stop you have start over. Wonât renew.

title: Worst App Iâve Ever Used
review: Absolutely the worst app I ever dealt with on the Fire TV. Every time I try to access the app, I worry it wonât work. I have 3 TVs throughout my house and every time the app just says error occurred and is not useable. I canât wait until someone else has the premier league because I am so done with NBC and all itâs dumb fees and unusable app.

title: No good unless you have a cable or satellite provider
review: This app works on your Fire TV or Fire stick ONLY if you have an existing cable or TV provider.So if you DO have the aforementioned, chances are you have NBC sports?Yet another "Free" app that doesn't work.Amazon needs to realize that most people who own the Fire TV are "cord cutters" and don't have cable or satellite subscriptions.

title: Cable users only....
review: Very frustrated I have to have cable service to use this app...... Very disappointed!

title: Sports "Section" is always the last to Fall!
review: Might be the worst of the major networks (including cable, ESPN, etc.) when it comes to broadcasting sports.Â  I acquired it because the app was free and I wanted to watch an NFL playoff game NBC had rights to. Winter Olympics coverage is really bad.

title: Didnât work well on our lg smart tv
review: It would only play for a short period of time on my smart tv and then it threw me out claiming I had to go through my tv provider. We stream everything and the provider for the internet said they couldnât provide that. The commercials were only dead air, no countdown, nothing. The forward & reverse did not work for the Olympics. It was way too annoying to deal with.

title: Buffering issue
review: Watched the nascar race yesterday using my amazon fire stick. Not sure if the constant buffering was nbc, or the device, but I saw the race...

title: App doesn't work on FireTV
review: I've used this app on myÂ  Ipad & on a PC, it worked. Now after downloading app, registering my cable subscription service, you get a triangle shaped error message. What a piece of crap. I'm sure NBC will kick the can over to FireTV & claim it's not they're issue. Reviews of the app are littered with similar stories, you'd think the developers would read the comments once in a while to see how well the app is received, not this one.

title: Works great
review: Came in handy when the Cable broadcast of sporting event suffered from digital breakup. The app through My firestick ran great! Just a couple minutes delayed.

title: Disappointing
review: I downloaded the NBC Sports App so that I could watch the Sunday Night Football.Â  The app it self works fine but it won't allow me to watch the live Sunday Night Footbal.Â  Very disappointing....

title: It crashed quite a few times until I took the ...
review: It crashed quite a few times until I took the fire stick out and plugged it back in. Then it cooperated for the most part but would still crash at times. I mainly got it to watch the Olympics.Â  I don't know if they normally show 10,000 commercials but they certainly did during the Olympics

title: Awful
review: I am a Notre Dame fan and love Sunday night football and this app is not remotely good for streaming. I would say that about every five minutes it does the circle of death during the stream. None of the other sports apps do this. I have no problems with the Fox Sports app or WatchESPN. I don't know how this app has so many problems with the large amount of people that will stream games off of this app.

title: With the technology available today they could easily check that fact or ask a question before it ...
review: I can't believe they let you download an app that will not work if you don't have a provider.Â  With the technology available today they could easily check that fact or ask a question before it lets you download something that is worthless.

title: Doesn't include the Olympic Channel
review: Doesn't include the Olympic Channel.Â  Looks OK for what it is, but I was hoping to have a fire stick end-run for Comcast.Â  I was assured by Comcast, when revising a package, that Olympic Channel was included with NBC Sports at the basic level.Â  Nope.Â  First experiment with cord cutting, fail.

title: Poorly Optimized
review: Not optimized, allowed me to watch a hockey game that was not local whatsoever, but when I tried to watch the Pittsburgh Penguins play the Philadelphia Flyers it said I was out the region. Odd since I live in Pennsylvania where both teams are from...

title: this app is just plain horrible. What happened to me last night is a ...
review: this app is just plain horrible.Â  What happened to me last night is a regular occurrence for anything I watch.Rangers vs. Sabers hockey game.Â  Great, I'm from ny but live out of the area.Â  The app continuously buffers every 10 minutes for a period of 5-10 minutes.Â  It usually continues where it left off, however it will also catch up and poof end of the game, or missed goal.This happens all the time.

title: There but Not There
review: Would not open on my Fire

title: Great soccer coverage of the Premier league
review: I love the soccer coverage in fact it's the only reason I subscribe, however I understand the need for ads. But the same ad over and over again is very irritating, especially at half time to the point we actually turn the tv off during intermition

title: This app has been notorious about disconnecting at random times ...
review: This app has been notorious about disconnecting at random times, even though my network connection is stable.Â  This would not be that big of a deal, as reconnecting is only two button clicks, except for the fact that every time you access a "new" stream, an advertisement is played.Â  Hopefully, with the advertising money they are taking in on each of these disconnections, they can work to patch up the servers that apparently cannot handle high user traffic.

title: Fire Stick rejects this app
review: Why does Amazon have two apps here?Â  One says it will upload to my Fire Stick.Â  Yet when I try to enter the verification code for our cable TV provider, it says it can't open the app.Â  The app works on my phone so I know the issue is NOT my cable TV provider. The app has worked in the past and now it will not.Â  I tried to upload the other NBC Sports app, but that particular one has a red x by my Fire Stick option on my Amazon account and it says it will not work.Â  Very frustrating during these Olympic weeks.Â  No answers from Amazon.Â  I hope someone from Amazon sees this review and answers the question why my Fire Stick won't accept the app and WHY are there two separate apps on their site? I have never had trouble with other new apps that I have loaded on my Fire Stick. I believe that the issue on my Fire Stick is Amazon related.Â  Amazon, do you have an answer? Note the attached screenshot of the Amazon site: two apps with two different sets of reviews. One loads and won't verify as a usable app. The other won't even acknowledge my Fire Stick.

title: Very disappointed at NBC's on demand service for the winter olympics
review: Very disappointed at NBC's on demand service for the winter olympics. I live in the UK back in 2012 when the summer olympics were being held in London and Sky's on demand / interactive coverage was second to none. They had so many interactive/on demand channels/services that you could almost see every single event as it happened live, even to the extent where there were some events where they didn't even have a commentator. The NBC coverage of this years winter olympics was a joke.

title: Streaming the Super Bowl - Epic Fail!
review: I downloaded this app to my Amazon Firestick to watch the Super Bowl. This WAS NOT a good experience!Â  One of the best parts of the Super Bowl is the commercials.Â  Some played, but most of the time a generic wallpaper popped up to stand by with a picture of the Opening Ceremony of the Super Bowl.Â  Then, when the game came back on, the lag and delay was SO BAD that I could hear my neighbors cheering or booing and it took 5 minutesÂ  before I could watch that play.Â  Overall, a BAD experience and made me want to go back to cable.Â  Please work on this, I really want to watch the Winter Olympics, but without the delay and constant waiting.

title: Works, video quality is good, a few glitches.
review: EDIT: dropping a star.Â  Was trying to use this to watch the Olympics, but the interface is really not good; a lot of events are labeled as "live," but then when you click on them you get a "slate" (TV jargon) about the event being over; every item you can select starts with a commercial, and then you watch the commercial and end up with a finished event or, often enough, video playback issues that require you to restart it (getting the commercial again) and then getting another fail.Â  Then there's the titles they were choose.... instead of X vs Y in SPORT as the title, they'd spoil it by saying X defeats Y in SPORT.Â  The only reason to get this app is because you have no other choices.It worked, and it's not terrible.Â  We watched the olympic opening ceremony last night; the video quality was generally very good, but there were occasional quality drops, and after some time we'd lose the stream entirely, causing us to go back to the home screen and re-select the video feed; it seems to always start off with a commercial - so you're missing content while you re-acquire the stream.This happened after a couple of hours, so I figured if it would stream that long without a glitch, then it's acceptable - but then it started happening more frequently.Â  After the third time we switched to another TV that had the cable box on it and just watched the rest uninterrupted.I'd give it one star if I were rating the coverage, though!

title: A good start on an NBC sports app, but with plenty of room for improvement.
review: The NBC sports app is a huge improvement over the prime-time coverage, but the app still needs work. It can be difficult to navigate among events; the olympics ended up being a single string of several thousand individual events, with no search option, and a paucity of informative labeling. To recognize the individual sports you had to identify the thumbnail image -- there was no accompanying text describing the event. Playback was generally good, with nice high resolution imagery, but from time to time the feed would fail or compression artifacts would interfere. I don't have any trouble with this streaming most video, so I have to assume it is the app or (more likely) the back-side server. There is no option to watch an event part way and then return to it at the same point, and searching and scrolling functions are awkward. Still, despite these problems, this is how I chose to watch the Olympics; the prime time broadcast is dead to me.

I assumed it would allow me to watch via my Amazon Fire TV device and I would be obliged to watch commercials for advertisers who have paid for time during the Olympics. No big deal, I can live with the advertising.But no, apparently you still have to have a Cable TV service with your internet provider! I entered the activation code and got a message saying I was successful. But when I tried to watch anything from the Olympics I get a message that this content is not authorized!Then what the heck is the point of the App?Â  Just a head's up to NBC Sports but there are a lot of Americans who don't want to pay a small fortune for Cable TV service when we only watch a couple of shows and not very often!

title: Not useful if the app times out with "Are You Still Watching"
review: I'm afraid I won't be able to use this, which saddens me, because my dog really does watch it when I have it on.Â  The app makes a big play about it being useful for when dogs are home alone for hours at a time, and this was my intended use as well.Â  Unfortunately, after only a relatively short period - an hour or so (I didn't time it), the live stream paused and a prompt popped up asking if I was still watching.Â  Granted my dog is fairly smart, but I don't think she would be able to respond to it in such a way that the streaming would resume.Â  I'm afraid I'll need to cancel my subscription.

title: Stopped Working Got No Help
review: Me and my dog enjoyed this through Amazon Fire TV and it suddenly stopped working. I have paid for a month but can't access it. I have called Amazon twice and e-mailed DogTV. Nothing has helped. I have reset my Fire TV and deleted and installed the app multiple times. I am WILLING to pay and I can't get help. Sucks.

title: The content may be good but the service has errors and shuts down constantly ...
review: Awful. The content may be good but the service has errors and shuts down constantly so leaving it on while I am gone is a waste. I even blamed my internet and got that fixed but it is this app. My poor dog has awful anxiety and when it shut off tonight and left him hearing outside voiced and cars he freaked out and destroyed my front door. Plus DogTV is charging me for two subscriptions and they never fixed it or even rpelied to my emails. They do not have any telephone numbers only emails. Such a shame they couldn't just be a good service.

title: It's great as long as it's connected
review: My new puppy LOVES to watch DogTV.Â  It's great as long as it's connected.Â  I have no troubles w/internet connection/download speeds for HBO, Showtime and any other Amazon show.Â  ONLY DOGTV!Â  Not sure what the problem is.Â  A bit irritating when I have to leave the house and puppy is alone and I can't get it to connect.Â  I end up turning into Animal Planet instead.Â  Not sure if I will maintain subscription.

title: Good content, awful technology
review: My dog loves to watch DogTV, but this Fire version only streams for a few minutes before it kicks the viewer out to the Fire home screen.Â  DogTV's technology has been a glitchy mess from Day 1 on PC, but this version is intolerable. Tried the Help link that was sent with their reciept; worthless. The ratings on the help page showed "0 people found this helpful."But, again, DogTV's customer service has always been worthless, also.

title: Great Idea...Terrible App
review: Worst app ever.Â  And too bad because the idea is great.Â  Dogs actually watch it, however here is the rub.Â  First, tech support is terrible.Â  And it's not just me - reviews all over the Internet about how poor the customer service is.Â  Second, getting the app to work property took me hours.Â  Third, live feed freezes regularly, then you have to start it over again.Â  Based on my research, this appears to have been an issue for the last two years.

title: Must have!!!!
review: My dog gets sad when I go to work and nests in my bed. Well she developed the bad habit of ripping sheets... despite going for walks before I leave for work. So I bought a tv for the bedroom and got dogtv for her and she just loves it. I mean seriously. She watches it and loves it. The exposure part of the day where the content is designed to helping lessen doggie angst.... works. My girl used to run away from or attack the vacuum... now, she lays on the bed and just watches me. No freaking out!!!! Itâs a good investment.

title: App needs a lot of work, not user friendly
review: I wanted to like this service.Â  But it was glitchy, hard to understand the app to get it to work.Â  Multiple clicks to try to get the sections to activate.Â  Iâm no slouch to understanding the works of most apps and services, but this one was pretty bad and unresponsive.Â  Maybe I should have asked my Border Collie.Â  I cancelled the service.Â  Maybe when they get their app working properly I might try again.

title: DogTV turned anxious pups into calm couch potatoes
review: I have an anxious pittie and a mischievous beagle at home. Typically, they have humans since we also have a large family, but occasionally, we go where they cannot so they are left home. The first few times were hard, neighbors let us know of the pitties cries and the beagle howls. Also, they trashed the place.Â  We found don't and now when we have to leave them home, we come home to calm dogs. No more cries or howls and no more messes.

title: Great, but needs IT to fix the bugs.
review: Our dog loves Dog TV but it stops and buffers all the time and if you are not there with the remote to start it, then it's no use.Â  If we leave it on when we have to leave our dog home alone, we can check our security camera and it is always stopped within 10 or 15 minutes of us leaving.Â  It's not our internet since it doesn't do that when we watch a movie or binge watch a show.Â  Dog TV needs to fix the problemÂ  or we will cancel.

title: I DID NOT ORDER DOGTV.Â  REMOVE FROM MY ACCOUNT IMMEDIATELY.
review: Apparently, this is another channel/app like YouTube TV that makes it literally impossible to unsubscribe.Â  I love dogs, but I have no idea what content is worth $10 a month to amuse a pet.Â  I was curious -- I clicked on it and backed out immediately when I saw DogTV was not a free channel, but I bet I'll get charged for it anyway and have to fight with Amazon for the next 6 months to get charges removed.

title: Dog TV menu did not function as-advertised
review: After downloading the app we were given 3 options.Â  The 3 never provided a "gateway" for Dog TV to play & we could only watch 3 'commercials' for Dog TV.Â  Since we'd already downloaded & installed the app - this was kinda nonsense. No big deal - we hadn't heard of this app & only wanted to check it out.Â  Within 20 minutes on installing - we uninstalled this app.

title: My doggie was not interested
review: This was a TV channel it wasn't something to wear I wasn't impressed with it I couldn't get my dog interested in it I even sat here in front of the TV and forced him to watch it at least one episode he had no interest in looking at the TV or listening to anything on there sorry not a good fit for us!

title: They wonât cancel despite my request!

I even get billed TWO TIMES EVERY MONTH because I accidentally clicked the purchase button twice. I am beyond frustrated and only now realized thereâs this review function. It might be good for somebodyâs pet, but not mine. All Iâve received is acknowledgement of my request, no follow through. I donât have $20 each month to throw away as Iâve never turned DOGTV on after the first day. Bummer.

title: "Playback Error" Constantly!
review: Love the content....when it works. I have a firestick and will turn it on just before I leave the house. I usually still have just a few short things to do before leaving. its about 10-15 minutes before it stops playing and says there is a "Playback Error".Â  Even if I restart it, by the time I get home this same thing is on my screen because it happened again while I was away so my tv is just sitting there on and completely pointless. I know it's not my internet because we can run 3 cell phones connected to our wifi + play xbox on line + watch our firestick flawlessly ALL AT THE SAME TIME. So when I leave my house with DOG TV on and NOTHING else is connected to the internet and the firestick is 5 feet away from the modem and I still get the message "Playback Error" I know it has to do with the app/DOGTV. Such a disappointment and a waste of money.

title: Stops streaming ALL THE TIME. Support never responds.
review: Your app is the best and worst app there is. My dogs love it, but it is completely buggy. It is the only app in the App Store that routinely stops working. The re-subscribe prompt doesnât work. I have to re-subscribe, delete and re-install the app to get it working again. You lost my subscription a week ago because of this after it stopped working again only a week after I re-installed it. Itâs beyond frustrating. I watch on Apple TV. Epic developer FAIL. ð

title: Double billed, can't get a refund and they won't fix it
review: I love DOGTV service and so do my animals. But they recently changed their service, and I was unable to access channel although I am being billed monthly. After several customer service emails and phone calls, they decidedÂ  I needed to create my account again, but, they strangely already had my credit card and I had to pay ahead for a year this time. NOW they refuse to fix it, telling me I paid through ROKU and have no recourse and will not get a refun. Too bad because my animals love it, but they have really frustrated and been unprofessional in refusing to help me solve this problem. Don't do it!!

title: When iPhone app connects strange messages appear
review: Initially connecting an iPhone using the Screen Mirroring companion App to the Fire Stick Screen Mirroring App the connection works but after a couple of minutes a message appears on the TV that there is an error described as unauthorized use. You can't get rid of that message even when you exit the Fire Stick App. The only way to get rid of the message is to actually reboot the Fire Stick. Although there is nu charge for the Screen Mirroring Fire Stick App I had to pay for the companion iPhone version which turned out to be two different applications from that company. So I have invested money in something that DOES NOT WORK. The company's answer was I had to wait for a new update in their application. They should have refunded my money for the iPhone apps.

title: Keeps dropping
review: I got things connected, and not 20 seconds later it wanted to show another ad.Â  When that happened, the screen sharing from my fire tablet stopped showing up on my fire stick and did not return.Â  The app on the tablet claimed it was still casting, but it was not.Â  I had to forcibly kill the service and restart it, only for it to do the same thing less than a minute later.Â  What good is a service that disconnects before you can even stream anything?

title: Yesssss!
review: Finally a mirroring app that works! Hallelujah! I had to try a few to find one that works, but finally did.Â  Iâm able to use this app on my phone and amazon fire stick to mirror things from my phone to my TV - you do have to be connected to the same WiFi with both devices and it canât be a public WiFi connection or it wonât work.There was a little bit of trial and error that I had to go through along the way - but the end result was worth it!

title: Did what it is supposed to do but not what I wanted
review: Iâve wanted a way to display video from a mobile device on my TV via my fire stick for some time. This app will display the mobile device screen but will not âcastâ a video. I never realized there was a difference between screen mirroring and casting video. On my Apple devices, which always just work, one function, screen mirroring, does both. After years of trying to make this work with the fire stick, I amd giving up and buying an Apple TV ...

title: Audio and Video latency challenges
review: Audio did not transfer to the TV speakers, the audio only came out of my phone.Â  Maybe this is a setting but I would expect it to automatically transfer audio with the video.Â  Other than this, there was a significant lag in the video mirroring.Â  I didnât want to spend the $2 to begin with, but it still beat my family huddling around my iPhone watching the video that was needed for my kids distant learning (COVID).

review: It runs a scan & then makes you buy the full program. I don't mind paying for things but it really upsets me when they don't say that it's a paid app up front. To say it's free, run a scan, and then hold the results & options to remedy any problems is shady af.

title: Disappointed

title: Sceptical
review: I'm sceptical of any device that requires its users to rate it before getting additional apps. I'm also sceptical of apps that don't work. After I cleaned it and it supposedly deleted all the garbage, I tried to rate it by pushing the rating button. Instead I was sent to the cleaning screen. I pushed the button, expecting no garbage since it had just been disposed of, when to my surprise, it still had the same amount of garbage as before. Go figure!!!

title: Junk
review: This app does not work. Bait and switch!Looks at your kindle and then tells you that you have to download another app you pay for to get it to do anything.My Kindle Fire HD 8 (Fifth Generation) is dyingMy constant companion, my Kindle Fire is in its death throes. It is very sad to watch.I bought my first Kindle (the generation 3) in late 2010 and immediately fell in love with it. I loaded it up with Amazonâs E-books. It was only black and white with limited internet capability but it was a great device. I really liked the chicklet style keyboard. I still have that first kindle today and it is still working. What a fun device!Â  On the 28th of September 2011, I upgraded to the new Kindle Fire Full Color 7â with Multi-touch display and Wi-Fi. This gave me greater connectivity to the internet and the books were slightly easier to read. Finally, in 2013 I ordered the latest Kindle Fire HD 8 (Fifth Generation) which had better contrast and an 8.9â screen. Amazon also claimed that it had 15% faster page loads. It has a 167 PPI display and was the lightest Kindle at 5.98 ounces until 2016's Kindle Oasis. This is the one that became my companion. This is the one that is dying at three years old, a mere child. We will get to the culprit who I accuse of committing this slow, painful and tortuous death in just a minute.On the 14th of December this year Amazon sent out an update Fire OS 5.3.2.1. This free software update added the Amazon âRapidsâ app plus some other general improvements and performance enhancements. Well, since I hadnât ordered the âRapidsâ app, just before Christmas (22 December 2016), I decided to uninstall the app. My Kindle Fire, which had been operating beautifully in all modes before, now began to display some quirkiness. Just minor annoyances at first: a very slight delay when calling up a book, the battery recharging at a bit slower speed, auto-connect to my Wi-Fi was intermittent, and my Tumblr App was failing to load pictures. Then I made my first mistake (that day). In order to uninstall the âRapidsâ app I went through the normal âuninstallâ procedure and found that I could not uninstall or delete the âRapidsâ app. I decided I needed a stronger uninstaller and went on the Amazon web site and downloaded an âuninstallerâ app. When that didnât work I decided that perhaps I needed a virus checker and malware cleaner. So I went back to the Amazon web site and ordered Malware and Virus Cleaner for Fire devices (OxCleaner) as soon as I ran this one it showed I had several pieces of Malware, Megabytes of trash, and 97 virus errors on my Kindle. For just $4.49 -- it recommended that I down load another app Malware and Virus Cleaner to actually clean up my Kindle. Yet another app Optimizer & Trash Cleaner Tool for Kindle Fire Tablets was also recommended to clean the âtrashâ as well as the viruses. Like a fool, I bit on this deal and downloaded the $4.49 program. I ran it and within seconds it came back to inform me that everything was âhunky doryâ â my Kindle was âgood to goâ. Suddenly, I noticed my Kindle battery was draining much faster than usual but besides that everything seemed okay. Just to make sure I performed a 40 second off/on switch reset to give my Kindle a fresh start.Shortly after this I noticed that one of my books did not open and I called an Amazon Customer service representative. Julius D. was extremely helpful and very patient with me and we spent nearly an hour on the phone as he guided me through several attempts to fix my Kindle. The only area he seemed unfamiliar with was what the âRapidsâ app was and how to uninstall it. Outside of that he took me through nearly every procedure possible to fix the device except a total factory reset. After that I contacted two other customer representatives who were unable to provide a satisfactory explanation for how to get rid of âRapidsâ. It was then that my Kindle began to die. In its death throes it constantly threw up black screens; it seemed to take forever to go from one screen to the next and often just went to black screen; the battery would drain in a matter of minutes and recharging took hours; I had to re-download books that had been there before, it began struggling to open a book and my little kindle just went to a white or black screen. (Choke!) In spite of all the problems I began experiencing with other programs, the persistent âRapidsâ app just stayed where it was and it would open intermittently. I began to conclude that the âRapidsâ app was the culprit that was killing my kindle. I âaskedâ, no,Â  âpleadedâ with several customer service representatives to delete this app. Amazons policy was that if they put this poison app on my kindle there was absolutely NO way to remove it. This was the first time since I had signed in to Amazon since 1994 that their customer-centric commitment failed. It had failed totally and now my faithful companion, my Kindle, was dying a slow and excruciating death. It had taken the poison pill and there was no antidote. âGood bye, Kindle I loved you with all my heart.âYes, I am buying a new one, but it is just so very sad to see an old friend go.

title: It works!
review: I don't have a lot to say this early after download iing, but I have been using my Fire 7 Very lightly, no games, or downloads, only for Kindle, Audible, Amazon shopping, as a base for my Echo's software and a few very reputable apps. I have had it for 3 months. But I knew it needed cleaning up as it was getting a bit sluggish, but more than that it was starting to stop running apps time after time. After looking at all of the utilities available, I chose this simply because it was designed by the same guys who engineer the Kindle & Fire, made specifically for my tablet. Made sense to me. It is simple, straight forward and your done. The upgrade to remove viruses & such was about $4. With 20% off if paid with Amazon coins. So it caught 6 potential viruses and cleaned a ton of junk off of it. I paid with my Amazon coins so really didn't cost anything nor will it again because now I have that upgrade. And my machine is like new. Once you get it it is good for all of your devices on your account. "What a deal!"

title: No Problems!
review: After using a popular cleaner, booster, virus scanning program for several years it occured to me that on three different tablets - and a zillion scans -not one virus had ever been detected. Upon noticing this application was designed for Kindle Fire tablets I thought I'd give it a go. On the first scan two viruses were found, cleaned, and eliminated. Today fourteen more were discovered! The process is lightning fast - no long wait. My Kindle Fire is working great.Â  Plus, I like the fact that this application is providing a higher level of protection for my tablet. There's a huge investment of money, time, and irreplaceable information on my tablet. It's foolish not to protect it.

title: Fixed Licensing Issue
review: Overall this is a great app that I've used for about 3 years.Â  I have multiple Foscam cameras and the app has worked well from my phones, tablets and Fire TV devices.Â  My biggest complaints would be: (1) there is no side-by-side two camera view on widescreen displays, and (2) the network auto-detect gets some settings wrong for my cameras.Â  But once configured, this app has worked reliably for me.I previously wrote a negative review citing problems with this app after updating my Samsung Galaxy Note 5 to the latest version of Android.Â  However, after some digging I found that the problem was with with Amazon.Â  There was a major hiccup with Amazon's licensing system that caused problems with many apps, not just TinyCam Monitor.The solution was to remove my phone from my list of Amazon registered devices, then re-register it.Â  Anyone facing the same issue can remove their device by going to Amazon.com, Your Account > Your Apps and Devices.Â  Then go to the Amazon app store on your device and you will be prompted to log in which will fix the registration.Â  If the app still doesn't work then you can try reinstalling it.----------------------------------ORIGINAL REVIEW:This used to work perfectly until the most recent update.Â  Now I get an prompt about an internal error and not having a network connection followed by an error about not having a license (both of which are wrong).Â  The software is broken and won't let me move past the errors.I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling a dozen times with no luck.Â  Also, the Amazon app store says that I need to update the app even though I'm running the latest version.Strangely, I was able to install the free version of this app and it works fine.Â  Only the paid version is broken.Samsung Galaxy Note 5 with Android 6

title: Glitches and No Response From Support - UPDATE
review: UPDATE - I raised my review by one star, as the App was updated and I reinstalled it to test the newer version. Some of the cursor navigation glitches have been fixed. The interface seems a bit more responsive now and the focus follows the command accurately. Now you can actually edit your individual camera setup details.The frame rate is still very slow and suffers from drop-outs despite being used in a Gbit wired LAN.This App is not ready for prime time in my opinion. It has numerous glitches, such as the inability to get to certain options from the camera setup menu (the cursor just jumps up to the header instead of going "right"), and the "back" button doesn't always go back or to where you expect it to take you.Also, when you change some options, the changes do not "stick", so when you go back to that screen, it is not configured as you expected, but has defaulted to a different value.I wrote an email to the 'support" developer, but all I got was crickets.Maybe if you have a really simple system, this might work for you, but on my 6 camera setup, it's slow, buggy, and crude. I'm going to uninstall it.

title: Won't Connect... no "generic" camera setting
review: I bought this camera [...]. Based on the reviews, different brands/models are shipped to different people, and the one I got has absolutely no brand or model markings anywhere on the camera, included CD (and software on CD), or box. No instructions either. Using the Android app, IP Cam Viewer (a competitor for tinyCam Monitor), the camera brand and model came up automatically as "Unknown Brand", "IPCAM1,IPCAM2". Everything works perfectly in that app, connected on first try and hasn't had any problems since. I bought tinyCam Monitor Pro, since there was no way to actually try it out (the "test drive" amazon thing isn't going to work for actually seeing if the app will connect to a networked camera.... or at least, it wouldn't connect to mine), and I wanted to use the additional motion detection and recording features not found in IP Cam Viewer. However, I can't connect to the camera, I'm assuming since there is no comparable setting to the "Unknown Brand" option in IP Cam Viewer, and the app doesn't know how to communicate with it. Everything else is set the same as it is in IP Cam Viewer... same address, port, etc. I've tried all the camera brands/models that I've seen mentioned in the reviews for my camera, but I keep getting "Video Failed (socket closed)" and "Video Failed (404 - not found)" errors. So weak.

title: Very difficult to set up
review: First off, the motion alerts do not work unless the app is running in the background.Â  If the app is running, you can set it up to record automatically, but leaving it on will be at the expense of ram and battery life.I spent hours trying to get the app to work outside my home WIFI.Â  I figured out how to set the IP address on my camera so it is not dynamic, then figured out how to use port forwarding on my router, and had to set up a temporary DDNS address for my public IP just to make that happen.Â  It worked for two days, then a two second power outage reset something and I can't pull up feed on my phone anymore.Â  I dont feel like figuring it out at this point.The camera I'm using is a Foscam F19893P V2, for reference.The customer service is non existent.Â  I emailed them several times.Â  They only responded when I asked for a refund just to tell me I would not get one.The free foscam app that it came with works fine inside and outside my WIFI as long as my home internet is running and my phone has bars.Â  I wanted a a way to automatically record on motion, so I downloaded ISpy on my laptop for that.Â  It's a free open-source program.Â  Only issue is I have to leave my laptop on all the time until I come up with another solution.

title: IMO TinyCam has a superior operating interface than Amcrest Video Pro
review: Here's how to set up an Amcrest IP Cam with TinyCam.IMO TinyCam has a superior operating interface than Amcrest Video Pro. Just my humble opinion.WARNING: There is one import issue I have with TinyCam Montor. When you close out of it on your Android cell phone(at least older ones)... it doesn't actually close the program, and that sucker will run in the background sucking up your data GB, and also the power in your battery. Do yourself a favor, and download a decent APP Killer, to prevent this, and remember to kill TinyCam when you're done using it.=========================================================================Setting up an Amcrest IP2M-841 on TinyCamMonitor Pro on Android Cell Phone or Tablet.=========================================================================Note that you need to set up port forwarding (HTTP & RSTP Ports) in your Router and your Amcrest Camera before being able to remotely access the camera with TinyCam Monitor Pro (usingÂ  CameraDomainName.amcrestddns.com). I have an in depth discussion & instructions on setting up port forwarding, and setting up the Amcrest in my review of the Amcrest IP2M-841.Check my reviews to find that if you're interested. In that review, we used example numbers for the HTTP and RSTP forwarded ports, and gave them some pretend numbers for example's sake. The numbers were HTTP PORT = 12345Â  RSTP PORT = 23456.I make reference to these pretend numbers in these instructions.======================Instructions======================Make sure WiFi on the android device is turned on,and logged into the network that your Amcrest I/P Camera is on.From the drop down menu at top left, select "Manage Camera"Click the "+" to add a camera, and then "Scan Network".It should see your camera. Select your camera and tap "+" again.Then it shows your camera selected in a list with any other cameras (TinyCam Monitor comes with a default of several webcams.I simply un-check them because it sucks up data...BIGTIME.Hold your finger on your camera and a drop down list pops up... select "Edit Camera".It shows your cameras I/P address and HTTP port automatically (assuming yo already set up your port forwarding.Select Camera Name, and give it whatever name you like.Select Camera Vendor, and click Amcrest from the drop down list.Select Camera Model and pick IP2M-841 from the dropdown list.Select Username, and enter the username you use for logging into camera (please tell me you changed it from admin)Select Password, and enter the Password you use for logging into camera (please tell me you changed it from admin)Select the RSTP port and change it from the default value to the number you picked (in our example it was 23456).At the very bottom of the list, select Advanced Settings which takes you to a different page.Select Remote Hostname/IP Address, and change it from your current WAN address to the camera name you gave it on the Hostname in the DDNS setting. Follow the name with .amcrestddns.org. From or example in the main discussion it would be amcrest12345.amcrestddns.comSelect Web Port and enter the HTTP port number which you forwarded. In our example it was 12345Select Remote RSTP port, and enter the RSTP port which you also forwarded. In our example it was 23456That's it... you're done. The camera should be working with the Wifi on through your network, or Remotely with the WiFi off via cell phone signal.

review: To be fair the camera app works as described and rates 4 stars based on it alone.Â  However, since the last Amazon app store app upgrade all apps free or paid for through the app store require you to login to amazon each time you use the app or the app won't run.Â  If they did this for apps advertised as free it would be wrong but no loss since you paid nothing and can get the same free apps from other sources.Â  But to require login for an app you bought and paid for, like this cam app, is more then wrong it boarders on scam!I don't want to here android 4.2 is the cause crap either.Â  Amazon's app store app, before their upgrade, did not have this. I also don't want to here they are working on it.Â  They should provide the older app store app and send out an update or back date notice to everyone unfortunate enough to have downloaded the latest update.Â  Sorry for the harsh words but this situation is nothing more then an ill thought out control mechanism and Amazon should know better.

title: When iPhone app connects strange messages appear
review: Initially connecting an iPhone using the Screen Mirroring companion App to the Fire Stick Screen Mirroring App the connection works but after a couple of minutes a message appears on the TV that there is an error described as unauthorized use. You can't get rid of that message even when you exit the Fire Stick App. The only way to get rid of the message is to actually reboot the Fire Stick. Although there is nu charge for the Screen Mirroring Fire Stick App I had to pay for the companion iPhone version which turned out to be two different applications from that company. So I have invested money in something that DOES NOT WORK. The company's answer was I had to wait for a new update in their application. They should have refunded my money for the iPhone apps.

title: Keeps dropping
review: I got things connected, and not 20 seconds later it wanted to show another ad.Â  When that happened, the screen sharing from my fire tablet stopped showing up on my fire stick and did not return.Â  The app on the tablet claimed it was still casting, but it was not.Â  I had to forcibly kill the service and restart it, only for it to do the same thing less than a minute later.Â  What good is a service that disconnects before you can even stream anything?

It kept getting stuck right before the actual video started. It kept playing on my phone but the screen froze. Obviously completely pointless.

title: Yesssss!
review: Finally a mirroring app that works! Hallelujah! I had to try a few to find one that works, but finally did.Â  Iâm able to use this app on my phone and amazon fire stick to mirror things from my phone to my TV - you do have to be connected to the same WiFi with both devices and it canât be a public WiFi connection or it wonât work.There was a little bit of trial and error that I had to go through along the way - but the end result was worth it!

title: Did what it is supposed to do but not what I wanted
review: Iâve wanted a way to display video from a mobile device on my TV via my fire stick for some time. This app will display the mobile device screen but will not âcastâ a video. I never realized there was a difference between screen mirroring and casting video. On my Apple devices, which always just work, one function, screen mirroring, does both. After years of trying to make this work with the fire stick, I amd giving up and buying an Apple TV ...

title: I Need More Video Tutorials to Learn How to Configure this Simple App.
review: I am unable to make it work on my inferior Huawei P8 Lite mobile phone.I suspect that the system files are not updated and can not be updated tothe current standard requirement.Â  I might need to buy a Samsung cellphone.I could not find any video tutorials that might help determine the proper wayto configure this app.

title: Audio and Video latency challenges
review: Audio did not transfer to the TV speakers, the audio only came out of my phone.Â  Maybe this is a setting but I would expect it to automatically transfer audio with the video.Â  Other than this, there was a significant lag in the video mirroring.Â  I didnât want to spend the $2 to begin with, but it still beat my family huddling around my iPhone watching the video that was needed for my kids distant learning (COVID).

title: Does Not Play The Karaoke Singer's Voice... On a Karaoke App?
review: Despite a lot of research prior to installing this on my FireTV and Android phone, I was not aware that this app does not allow for the singer's voice to be integrated into the song. This is not what I wanted on a Karaoke app. The only difference between pulling up a karaoke version of a song on YouTube and this app are a few features outlined below:PROS:-wide song selection-easy control of the volume of both the background vocals and the lead singer on the track-use multiple devices so singers can queue their own songs-not a bad price if you just want to subscribe a weekend every month or so and you need these featuresCONS:-the app is not designed to incorporate the karaoke singer's voice into the track as it plays
